OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

AUGUST 12th, 1938.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 12th day of August, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow, City Attorney
and City Clerk.

Dr. W.R. Smith, City Milk Inspector and members of the Milk Ordinance Committee appeared
before the Board in regard to securing milk inspection for milk passing through Las Vegas
from Salt Lake City to Boulder City.

Mr. Austin informed the Board that he was of the opinion that the Board of Commissioners
would legislate milk inspection only for milk distributed in the City of Las Vegas.

Attorney McNamee appeared before the Board in regard to the "bread or bakery route for
the Miller Bakery. After some discussion on this matter Mr. Miller was informed that he might
continue the operation of a "bakery route". But said route must be operated with out the ringing
of a bell and calls being made only at residences where his card appeared in the window inviting
him to call.

The gaming application of Mrs. Laura Kramer for 17 Fremont Street was taken under advisement
also the application of Dick Kalbus for a race horse Keno game at the Boulder Club Attorney
Austin was ask for a ruling on the legality of "Race Horse Keno" to be given at the next meeting
of the Board.

Harrison Stocks, representing the various contractors presented to the Board a form of
ordinance asking for changes in the present licenses covering same.

Said form of ordinance was handed City Attorney Austin for investigation.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that the wholesale liquor license granted to the Nevada Wholesale Liquor Corp; for the present
quarter be revoked on the grounds that said business has ceased operations in the City.

Vote Commissioners Krause, Corradetti Luce and Ronnow, and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. 

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti the following
Resolution was introduced and passed:

WHEREAS, there are at present three wholesale liquor licenses issued and outstanding
in the City of Las Vegas, pursuant to Section 16 or Ordinance No. 203 of the City of Las Vegas
(as amended), and whereas the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas are of the
opinion that three such wholesale liquor establishments are sufficient for the said City and
that it is for the public good and for the public welfare that no new wholesale liquor liquor 

licenses be issued and granted in said City,

NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED that until the further order of this Board, it be and
is hereby established as the policy of this Board that no further wholesale liquor licenses be
granted to any person, firm or corporation, in addition to the three such licenses now issued
and outstanding.

Commissioner Ronnow moved the adoption of the foregoing resolution, and the same was
seconded by Commissioner Corradetti, and upon being put to vote was duly passed and adopted
by the following vote: Commissioners Corradetti, Luce Krause and Ronnow voting aye. Noes, none.

At this time Mayor Marble presented the name of W.J. Rhodes to the Board for consider-
ation as to the appointment of Building Inspector and Fire Marshall.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Mr. Rhodes be appointed Building Inspector and Fire Marshall, to hold office at the
pleasure of the Board and to take office at once.

Vote Commissioners Krause, Luce Corradetti, and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Commissioner Corradetti informed the Board that He and Mr. Rhodes would make immediate
inspection of the City of Las Vegas in regard to fire hazards and report to the Board from
time to time of their findings.

The Clerk read a letter from H. Case, Las Vegas Fire Chief wherein Mr. Case ask to
be allowed to attend the National Convention of Fire Chiefs at Salt Lake City in Sept. and
also for $150.00 to cover cost of said trip.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and
carried that Mr. Case make the trip to Salt Lake City to attend said conference and that
the sum of $150.00 be allowed toward his expenses.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Hone.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and car-
ried that the City Attorney take proper steps to see that all owners of signs violating the
City Sign ordinance take immediate steps to have said error corrected and the signs moved.

Vote Commissioners Krause, Corradetti, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. noes, none.
On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
the Clerk be instructed to sign all electrical licenses and master electricians certificates
on which he Board of Commissioners as an examining Board had previously passed.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that LeRoy Whipple, Deputy City Clerk be granted annual leave of absence from August 16th, to
August 31st, 1938

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

All bids for city supplies received at this time were referred to the Purchasing Clerk for
abstract and said abstract to be handed to Commissioner Ronnow.

Ordinance No. 235 entitled "An Ordinance to amend Section 1 of Ordinance Number 168 of the
City of Las Vegas, entitled: "An ordinance of the Commission of the City of Las Vegas, establishing
a residence district, industrial and commercial districts within the said City of Las Vegas;
defining such districts; declaring it unlawful to erect, establish, maintain, or operate certain
factories, works or establishments within said residence districts and said commercial districts;
regulating the erection, establishment, maintenance, operation and rebuilding of certain works
or establishments in said districts; providing penalties for the violation of said ordinance,
and repealing ordinances in conflict herewith," was read to the Board for a second time and adopted
by the following vote: Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes, none. Absent None.

Report of Municipal Judge approved by the Mayor.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that
the city install steps on the light poles at the ball park. To cost approximately $105.00.

Vote commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Friday the 19th day of August, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS
VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

August 19th, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 19th lay of August, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Krause and Ronnow, City Attorney and City Clerk

Absent Commissioners Corradetti and Luce.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that the Mayor sign and forward Mr.	Miller owner of Miller's	Bakery	of the action of	the	Board

taken at a previous meeting whereby	Mr. Miller was allowed to	continue his bakery route.

Vote Commissioners Krause, Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the application of the Boulder Club for a "Race Horse Keno Game", be denied on the grounds
that it was ruled to be an unlawful game under the laws of the State of Nevada.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

LeRoy Harris of the Los Angeles P.W.A. office appeared before the Board in regard to the
City securing P.W.A. aid on proposed City Projects Nos. 1052 and 1053. Mr. Harris assured the
Board that he would help all he was able in pressing these projects to completion.

Mr. C.J. Mackey local Mgr. W.P.A and A.L.Worswick appeared before the Board in regard to
W.P.A. projects and the erection of	a municipal building for the City	under P.W.A.

Mr. Mackey presented to the	Board order for a pump to	be used	at the municipal	golf	course

now under construction. Mr. Krause was directed to investigate the possibility that funds for the
purchase of pump had been secured.

A number of interested citizens from Westside appeared before the Board in regard to
securing police protection, lights and streets. The Commissioners in the respective departments
were directed by the Mayor to investigate the possibility of providing for these improvements.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that the Jr. Chamber of Commerce be granted permission to use the City Ball park for a foot
ball game between the U of N and the U of A. on October 1st, 1938.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Monday the 22nd day of August, 1938 at the hour of ten o'clock P.M.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

AUGUST 22nd, 1938.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 22nd day of August, 1938 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Luce, Krause and Ronnow, City Attorney and
City Clerk

The business of limiting the number of gambling houses in the City of Las Vegas was again
discussed by the Board and after due consideration the following Resolution was introduced and
passed:

In keeping with the policy of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, as
adopted at previous meetings of the Board,

BE IT RESOLVED that until the further order of this Board it be and is hereby established
as the policy of this Board that no further gambling licenses be granted to any new gambling
clubs in the City of Las Vegas, and that until the further order of this Board no additional
gambling clubs, or gambling houses, be granted licenses in this City, other than the five gambling
clubs which are licensed to do business in this City at the present time and for the current quarter

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that nothing herein contained shall be construed to prevent the
issuance of any new license or licenses for additional gambling games in any of the five gambling
clubs above referred to and which have licenses fur the current quarter, it being the policy of
this Board that until the further order of the Board no new or additional gambling clubs shall
be established or permitted in this City.

Commissioner Ronnow moved the adoption of the above and foregoing resolution and the same
was seconded by Commissioner Corradetti, and upon being put to vote was duly passed and adopted
by the following vote:

Commissioners Corradetti, Krause and Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Mar-
ble voting aye. Noes, none. Absent none.

The State Engineer, hr. Smith and assistant Hugh Shamberger appeared before the Board in
regard to securing the help of Harry Jameson for one week. Mr. Jameson to aid these Engineers
in the survey being made in the Las Vegas Valley of the waiter situation.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that the City allow Mr. Jameson to aid the State Engineer, the salary of Mr. Jameson to
be paid by the City. Cliff Whitmore being relieved of his duties as Pound Master and taking Mr.

James place with Mr. Johnson in the care of the City park.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that the Clerk notify Lloyd S. Payne, County Clerk that the check deposited with him as the city's
portion of the expense of the water survey, Las Vegas Valley be released to the State Engineer.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow, and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Commissioner Krause reported to the Board at this time that the Las Vegas Golf Associ-
ation had secured additional donations making possible the purchase of a pump to be used at the
golf course.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that the City purchase such pump and that the Clerk forward purchase order for same to the
Lyron-Jackson Co; Los Angeles, California. Cost approximately $550.00.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye

Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Friday the 26th day of August, 1938, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

additional expense.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause and Luce Aye. Noes, none. Mayor Marble passing his

vote.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that E.F.Tandy and Bernard Burger of the Recreation Department of the City be granted leave of
absence from September 1st to 15th with full compensation.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause and Luce and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.
On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that permission be granted to ob Gilbert for use of the Ball Ground for Sunday night Aug-
ust 28th. Said Park to be used for a ball game between a Las Vegas Team and a team from San 

Bernardino, California.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause and Luce and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Mr. Hunter appeared before the Board in regard to alterations to a building owned by him in
Fire Zone 2. Building Inspector Rhodes had stopped said alterations because they didn't not met
the requirements of the Building Ordinance of Las Vegas.

Mr. Hunter was given until August 31st, 1938 to comply with same.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and adjourned
until Wednesday the 31st day of September, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

AUGUST 31st, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 31st day of August, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and City Attorney
and Clerk.

The business of allowing music, dancing and entertainment in the taverns in the City of Las
Vegas was considered at this time. Each Commissioner and Mayor entering into a discussion as to
the enforcing of rules and regulations now enforce or maybe hereafter be adopted. After some lengthy
discussion on the limiting of the form of entertainment it was on notion of Commissioner Luce
Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti moved and carried that until the further order of the Board
all entertainment in taverns be subject to the approval of the Police and Fire Commissioner.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Luce and Krause voting aye. Commissioner Ronnow and His Honor
 the Mayor voting no. Mayor Marble stated to the Board his reasons for voting against the
motion was that it allowed too much responsibility placed on one member of the Board.

Commissioner Ronnow at this time presented to the Board plans for rest rooms, and betting
booths at the race track.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the plans be handed to C.D. Baker, City Engineer and that he check the plans as to their
suitability to the various locations in the park and race track grounds.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Henry Wilson be granted vacation with pay from Sept. 15th to 30th, 1938.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The proceeding with the anticipated street improvement district in Las Vegas was next con-
sidered and it was decided at this time that the City should publish its notice of intention.
There upon the following Resolution was introduced and passed:

NOTICE OF PROPOSED STREET IMPROVEMENT

NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas proposed
to cause to be made certain street improvements comprising oil bound gravel pavement and con-
crete curbs and gutters upon the street hereinafter described, except such portion thereof as
may have thereon pavement and gutters or either; that the expense of such improvements will be
defrayed as follows: Forty-five percent (45%) will be granted by the Federal Government and the
remaining Fifty-five per cent (55%) will be defrayed by special assessment upon the property here-
inafter described according to the benefits and improvements made thereon.

that is it proposed to made said improvements upon the following described property,
to wit:

To grade for and construct oil bound pavement three inches thick from curb to curb, and
concrete curbs and gutters on the following streets and portions of streets in the City of Las
Vegas:

All of Linden Avenue from Fifth Street to Sixth Street and from Seventh
Street to Eight Street: all of Mesquite Avenue from Eighth Street to State Street;
all of Stewart Street from Ninth Street to the Alley between Tenth Street and
Eleventh Street (excepting curb and gutter on the south side of Stewart Street
between Tenth Street and the Alley between Ninth Street and Tenth Street, which
is already installed): all of Ogden Street from Ninth Street to Eleventh Street
(excepting curb and gutter between ninth Street and Tenth Street on Loth sides of
street and excepting curb and gutter on the south side of Ogden Street between
Tenth Street and the Alley between Tenth Street and Eleventh Street; which is already

installed); all of Bridger Street from Eighth Street to Ninth Street;
all of Clark Street from Eighth Street to the Alley between Ninth Street from Tenth
Street; all of Bonneville Street from Seventh Street to ninth Street; all Of Garces
Street from Seventh Street to Ninth Street; all of Gass Street from Main Street to
Eighth Street )excepting curb and gutter on the south side of Gass Street between
Fourth Street and the alley between Third Street and Fourth Street, which is already
installed); All of Hoover Street from Main Street to Seventh Street (excepting curb
and gutter on the south side of Hoover Street between Fourth Street and the Alley
between Third Street and Fourth Street); all of Coolidge Street from Main Street to
Charleston Boulevard; all of First Street from Garces Street to Coolidge Street;
all of Second Street from Garces Street to Coolidge Street; all of Third Street from
Garces Street to Coolidge Street; all of Fourth Street from Hoover Street to Coolidge
Street (excepting curb and gutter fronting on north half of lot 29 and all of lots 30,

31, and 32 of Block 17, South Addition, which is already installed); all of Seventh
Street from Garces Street to Hoover Street; all of Eighth Street from State Street
to Mesquite Street and from Clark Street to Gass Street; all of State Street from
Oak Street to Eighth Street; all of Ninth Street from Mesquite Street to Stewart
Street and from Bridger Street to a point 150 south of Garces Street; all of Tenth
Street from Stewart Street to Ogden Street, (excepting curb and gutter on the west
side of Tenth Street, 150 feet couth of Stewart Street and 50 feet north of Ogden Street,
which is already installed).

Also to grade for and construct five feet of oil bound pavement three inches thick
and concrete curbs and gutters on each side of the following streets and protions of street in
the City of Las Vegas;

All of Carson Street from Eighth Street to Tenth Street; all of Fourth Street from
Garces Street to Hoover Street excepting 225 feet of curb and gutter which is already
installed in from of lots 22 to 27, inclusive and lots 30 to 32 inclusive in Block
16, South Addition ); all of Fifth Street and Garces Street to Charleston Boulevard
(excepting that portion of Fifth Street in front of lots 25 to 32, inclusive, in Block
19, South Addition, and excepting curb and gutter in front of lot 10, Block 27, South
Addition); all of Ninth Street from Fremont Street to Bridger Street.

Also to grade for and construct oil bound pavement three inches thick from curb to
curb on Charleston Boulevard and from Seventh Street to a point east of the Alley between
Seventh Street and Eighth Street, and directly opposite the line dividing the so called Leroy
Dutton Place and the Doctor William S. Park Place; and to construct concrete curbs and gutters
on the north side of Charleston Boulevard from Seventh Street to the Alley between Seventh and
Eighth Street; and to construct concrete curbs and gutters on the South side of Charleston
Boulevard from the center line of Seventh Street to a point 160 feet easterly therefrom; and
to construct concrete curbs and gutters on the north side of Charleston Boulevard opposite
Block 32, South Addition; also to construct concrete curbs and gutters on Stewart Street from
Main Street to Second Street excepting on the south side of Stewart Street between Lain Street
and the Alley between Main Street and First Street, where same are already installed); and to
construct concrete curbs and gutter on the south side of Stewart Street from Second Street to
Fifth Street.

Estimates of expense, plats and diagrams of the said work and the locality to be
improved, are on file with the City Clerk of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, in the office of
said City Clerk in the City Hall of said City of Las Vegas, in the City of Las Vegas, Clark
County, Nevada, for public inspection.

Notice is hereby given that the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas will
meet on the 21st ay of September, 1938 at the hour of three o'clock P.M. of the said day at
the City Hall in the City of Las Vegas to consider any suggestions or objections that may be
made by parties in interest to the proposed improvements and assessments.

THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE
CITY OF LAS VEGAS
By Viola Burns,

City Clerk.

RESOLUTION

BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County,

Nevada, that the above and foregoing NOTICE OF PROPOSED STREET IMPROVEMENT be given to the public
and that a copy of said notice be published for at least two weeks in the Las Vegas Evening
Review-Journal, a Daily newspaper printed and published in the City of Las Vegas, Clark County,
Nevada, and that copies of said notice be posted in at least three public places in each ward
in said City, and that copies of said notice be posted in at least three public places near the
site of said proposed work.

Commissioner Krause, proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing resolution and the
same was seconded by Commissioner Luce and was thereupon adopted by the following vote:

Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble,
voting aye. Voting No, none.

No further business appearing before the Board the meeting adjourned.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Krause, Luce and Ronnow, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

All claims allowed as per "Claims and Warrant Register" on file in the office of the Clerk.

Report of City Clerk and Municipal Judge approved by the Mayor.

All unread minutes of previous meetings read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
Henry Wilson be employed on a regular monthly bases for care of sewer lines and that said salary
be $140100 per month. That the salaries of A.L. Drew Electrical Inspector and W.J. Rhodes Bldg,
and Plbg. Inspector be placed at the sum of $160.00 per month until the further order of the Board.

A number of members of the Westside Improvement Association appeared before the Board requesting 

additional street and lighting improvement and additional Police protection. They were
ed that the Board would assist them in every way possible to secure theses improvements.

that the following telegrams be spread on the minutes of this meeting:

and adopted by the following vote: Commissioners Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 14th, 1938.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 14th day of September, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce, and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Ronnow and City Attorney Austin.

Mr. Hickey, President of the V.F.W. appeared before the Board in regard to the conduct-
ing of a carnival under the auspices of the V.F.W.

Mr. Hickey was informed that the carnival might be operated in the City but that the com-
pany operating same or the V.F.W. sponsoring it would be held liable for the full license fee
of $100.00 per day for each day said carnival operated in the City.

The Board considered the matter of changing the parking rules in the down town area, and
present to discuss same with the Board were Chief of Police Mackey and Traffic Officer Thompson. 

After some discussion on the matter but without motion it was decided that the Police
Dept. with the aid of the Street Department repaint the parking lanes in the City.

The Clerk was instructed to write R.J. Mackie, purchaser of Lot 5 in South Addition from
the City and ascertain at what rate per month he might be able to pay off the balance due the
City from the sale of said block.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce, it was moved and carried
that the following

RESOLUTION NO. 6.

be adopted:

A resolution authorizing the Mayor of the City of Las Vegas to file an application to the
United States of America through the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works for a
grant to aid in financing the construction of Sidewalks, and designing C.D.Baker, City Engineer
to furnish such information as the govern ent may request.

Be it resolved by the Board of City Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas:

Section 1. That H.P. Marble, Mayor be and he is authorized to execute and file an appli-
cation on behalf of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada to the United States of America for a grant
to aid in the financing the construction of sidewalks.

Section 2. That C.D.Baker, City Engineer, be and is hereby authorized and directed to fur-
nish such information as the United States of America through the Federal Emergency Adminis-
tration of Public Works may reasonably request with the application which is herein authorized
to be filed.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, and Luce and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none. Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Friday the 16th day of September, 1938 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAE
VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 16th, 1938.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 16th day of September, 1938 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow, City attorney
and Clerk.
Mr. George Wood of Pasadena, California was present and presented to the Board various
new forms to be used in the new bookkeeping system to be installed in the various departments
of the City. M A.W. Blackman City auditor was present also and discussed with the Board the
various phases of the system.

Commissioner Ronnow informed the Board that the Nevada Tax Commission still saw fit to
refuse to accept the City budget for the year 1938 as same had been filed with the Commission
in March of this year. Their particular objection being to the fact that the City had requested
the sum of $30,000.00 for its general Fund for the present year and had only expended the sum of
$5.00 from said General Fund in 1937. Upon this report it was decided that the City adopt an
amended budget based on the $1.50 rate and forward same to the Nevada Tax Commission.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and
carried that A.W.Blackman City Auditor prepare a form of budget and present same to the Board
for its consideration at a meeting to be held on the 19th day of September, 1938 at the hour of
ten o'clock A.M. and that said budget be made on the rate of $1.50.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that all demands presented to the Board at this time be allowed. Said demands being Nos. 1 to
6 inclusive.

Vote Commissioners Krause, Corradetti, Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Monday the 19th day of September, 1938 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS
VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA
SEPTEMBER 19, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 19th, day of September 1938 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause and Ronnow,
and His Honor the Mayor H. P. Marble. City Attorney, Austin and Deputy City Clerk L. Whipple.

Absent: Commissioner, H. Luce.

A claim from the Fire Department in the amount of $100.00 was presented to the board
for their consideration and payment, Said claim was to reimburse the department on monies
they had spent for a cooling unit which was installed in the Firemen's Club. It was explained
that under the provisions existing that this could not be done, and upon motion by Commissioner
Ronnow, seconded by Commissioner Krause it was voted to extend this amount to the fire department
and charge same to their minimum monthly drawing account for the month's of September, October,
November and December 1938 at the rate of $25.00 Per Month. Vote being Commissioners, Corradetti,
Krause, and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor Voting Aye, Noes, None Absent Commissioner, Luce.

A requisition # 4559 from the street superintendent was presented to the board for the
purpose of ordering certain parts for the Street Sweeper it being explained that the amount
desired would exceed the $25.00 limit on purchases under the bid regulation. Also the parti
needed could only be purchased from the house from which the sweeper was purchased, Thereupon
by motion of Commissioner Krause, seconded by commissioner Corradetti permission was granted
to the Street department to make such purchases thru the purchasing department not to exceed
the amount of $60.00 Vote being, Commissioners, Corradetti, Krause and Ronnow, and His. Honor
The Mayor Voting Aye, Noes, None. Absent Commissioner Luce.



John Cahlan representing the Junior Chamber of Commerce appeared before The Board at this time
with a request from his organization to ask the City to donate from the publicity fund the
sum of $20.00 as an advertisement which in turn would assist the Junior Chamber of Commerce
in sponsoring the football game between the University of Nevada and The University of Arizona
on the 30th, of September. He also asked permission from the Council to permit the Junior
Chamber of Commerce to put on a rally and bond fire the day and evening proceeding the game.
Commissioner Ronnow explained that at the present time the publicity fund was not in any shape to help
in this capacity, that the board was with the Junior Chamber, in every way and would do all
that they could in any other way, but at this time were unable to do anything in the way of
helping to finance the proposed game.	However it was agreed by the board to grant permission

to stage the rally and bonfire, with the promise that the police and fire department would be
notified by the Junior Chamber so that they in turn could render the necessary protection and
service should occasion arise for such.

At this time the Board considered the adoption of the Amended Budget for the City of Las
Vegas for the year 1938, as prepared by City Auditor A.W. Blackman. and upon motion of Commissioner 

Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that the City adopt
the amended Budget in the following form.

	SEPTEMBER 21, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City
of Las Vegas, held on the 21st, day of September 1938 at the hour of 3 o'clock P. M.

Present: Mayor, Marble, Commissioners, Corradetti, Krause, and Ronnow. City Attorney
H. Austin and Deputy City Clerk L. Whipple.

Absent: Commissioner H.E. Luce.. and City Clerk Viola Burns.

This meeting being called from meeting of August 31, 1938 to hear any protest or objections
to the proposed Improvement District # 4. for paving of streets, and Curb and Gutter work
and no one appearing before the board or entering any protests, or objections at this time.,
the board was left to proceed as they deemed best to further the proposed improvement district
No. 4. to the best interest of all concerned.

At this time a committee of residents situated in and around fifth and Linden streets appeared
in protest to the coming of a carnival in that district on north 5th, street. Reason for
such protest was that such a business was not desirable to residences in that district.

The Board explained to the committee present that so long as the carnival payed the necessary
license fee of $100.00 per day, and met all requirements, of the city ordinances that nothing
could be done to move them unless the city ordinances were not lived up to by such carnival
It was suggested that the committee appear before the Veterans of Foreign Wars and make some
arrangements with them to locate the carnival in another spot as that organization was probably
the ones that secured the present location from the owner of the property for the carnival.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time--------------------------

upon motion of Commissioner Corradetti, and seconded by commissioner Krause, it was moved that

the meeting recess and adjourn until September 24th, at the hour of ten o'clock A. M. Vote
being Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, and Ronnow, and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye, Noes, None Absent
Commissioner Luce. Therefore the meeting ad recessed and adjourned un til September 24, 1938
at the hour of ten o'clock A. M.

No meeting was held Saturday the 24th day of September owing to the lack of a
quorum.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 26th, 1938.

Minutes of a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, held
on the 26th day of September, 1938 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and Ronnow and City Clerk.

Absent City Attorney Austin.

The Board at once entered into a discussion and reading the proposed license ordinance
section by section.

At the hour of twelve o'clock noon the work not being completed the meeting recessed until
the hour of two o'clock P.M.

Present at the hour of two o'clock P.M. Mayor Marble, Commissioners Krause, Corradetti,

Luce and Ronnow, and City Clerk.

At this time the following entitled Ordinance was read to the Board in its entirety. "AN
ORDINANCE OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS LICENSING, FOR PURPOSES OF REGULATION AND REVENUE, EVERY KIND
OF LAWFUL BUSINESS HEREINAFTER SPECIFIED, TRANSACTED OR CARRIED ON WITHIN THE CORPORATE LIMITS
OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS, STATE OF NEVADA: FIXING THE RATES OF LICENSE TAX UPON THE SALE AND

PROVIDING FOR THE COLLECTION OF SAID LICENSE TAX, AND A PUNISHMENT FOR THE CARRYING ON OR CONDUCTING 

ANY SUCH BUSINESS, WITHOUT A LICENSE, AND REPEALING ORDINANCES NUMBERED 1,2,4,13,14,35,

62, 74,75, 81, 95, 102, 105, 108, 112, 117, 145, 184 and 192." To be know as Ordinance No. 243.

Upon its second reading this date it was unanimously adopted as an Emergency Ordinance by
the following vote: Commissioners Corradetti, Krause Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor H.P.
Marble voting aye. Noes, none. Absent None.

thereupon the Clerk was directed to have said Ordinance published in the Las Vegas Re-
view Journal a daily newspaper printed and published at Las Vegas, for once a week for two consecutive 

weeks.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti, seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and
carried that the Clerk be directed to write the Las Vegas Nevada Chamber of Commerce and the
Junior Chamber of Commerce of Las Vegas and inform them at with such an emergency existing the
Board felt that it was to the test interest of all concerned to pass at once Ordinance No. 243,
but at any time the Board would meet with the members of the two organizations in regard to
amending said ordinance and discussing way and means of financing the city's expenses for the
immediate future.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Krause Luce and Ronnow and His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board the meeting then adjourned

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held

Mr. Bryan Bunker and members of the Recreation Board appeared before the Board of Commis-

Department of the City.

No vote was taken on the matter but this Board was assured that the Board of Commissioners
would not eliminate the Recreational Department unless they found it absolutely necessary.

R.F. Gilbert appeared before the Board and ask permission to operate a loud speaker system
in the City of Las Vegas.

Mayor Marble informed Mr. Gilbert that the matter would be investigated and that he would
be given an answer in the very near future.

Minutes of all meeting not previously read were read and approved as read.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS
VEGAS CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA,

OCTOBER 10th, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 10th day of October, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause and Luce City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

The enforcing of Ordinance No. 243, and the collection of licenses provided therein was
considered by the Board at this time and after due consideration the following Resolution was
introduced and passed:

WHEREAS IT appears to the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, that a great
deal of public criticism is being directed against Ordinance No. 243, recently passed by said
Board of Commissioners, the same being a new ordinance establishing new schedules of licenses
on all business with the said City of Las Vegas, and

WHEREAS AS a result of the passage of said ordinance, a mass meeting of citizens of Las
Vegas was recently held in the Court Room in the Court House in said City of Las Vegas, pro-
testing against the terms of said ordinance, and setting up a Taxpayers League to study the
terms of said ordinance and the general financial condition of said City end the necessity for
such an ordinance, and

WHEREAS the said Board of Commissioners of said City has recently been invited to and did
meet with a committee from the Chamber of Commerce, the Junior Chamber of Commerce and the said
Taxpayers League, to adopt ways and means of meeting the demands of protest against said or-
dinance, and

WHEREAS at said last named meeting which was held at the Marine Room in the Apache Hotel
building on Friday evening, October 7th, the general financial condition of said City was
freely discussed and the necessity for the passage of said ordinance was explained, and whereas
at said meeting said Board of Commissioners, acting as individuals, did convincingly state to
said meeting that said Board had at no time any desire to place any further burden upon any
business within said City than was actually necessary to carry on the affairs of said City and
did explain to said meeting that if it was the wish of a majority of the taxpayers of the City
that the police department or any other department be cut in two or otherwise deduced to a
point where salaries could be paid out of funds now on hand and those to come in from present
known sources, that the Board would gladly do so, and did also state that said Board would be
glad to receive the assistance of said committees on any modification or amendment to said or-
dinance that would meet with the approval of the general public, and

WHEREAS it was proposed at said meeting that if the said City of Las V gas would with-
hold the enforcement of said ordinance until such time as said committee could work out a sat-
isfactory revision of said ordinance, that such committee would proceed at once to such work,
the thought being that said committees did represent the feeling of the general public expressed
in criticism of the terms of said ordinance, and that the said Board of Commissioners of said
City would do everything in its power to assist in the completion of said work, and

WHEREAS to give time for the completion of said work it was proposed that the said City
of Las Vegas withhold enforcement of said ordinance until November 15th, 1938, and whereas the
individual members of said Board of City Commissioners did express the wish to comply with such
request,

NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
Clark County, Nevada, that said City of Las Vegas do not demand the enforcement of the terms of
said Ordinance No. 243 until the 15th day of November, A.D. 1938, and that until such date
the said City do not require the payment of any license fees under said ordinance and that until
such date it do not require the payment of any penalty for failure to make payments accord-
ing to the terms of said ordinance, and
BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED That with regard to any fees already paid to said City under the
terms of said ordinance or any fees in the future and prior to said fifteenth day of November,

1938, that may be voluntarily paid by any person, firm or corporation, and adjustment will be
by said City on the same to conform to the terms of the amended ordinance as finally adopted,
if the same be amended, which is to say that if any payment so made be greater than required
under the terms of said ordinance as so amended, a refund will be made by said City and if the
amount be less, an additional sum will be required, so as to make final payment of license
fee for the current quarterly period of October, November and December, 1938, in any given case
to conform to the terms of said ordinance as finally amended and adopted.

The adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution was moved by Commissioner Krause and
seconded by Commissioner Luce, and upon being put to vote was adopted and passed by the follow-
ing vote: Voting aye, Commissioners Corradetti, Krause, Luce and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble.

Voting no, none. Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

The members of the Recreation Board again appeared before the Board and ask that the City
Board see fit to finance the cost of operation of the Recreational Department. Mr. Bunker, Mrs.
McNamee and Mrs Burr of the P.T.A. spoke before the Board on this matter.

No definite action was taken but the Board assured that the City would do all it possibly
could toward maintaining the Recreational Department.

Mr. Kaltenborn of the Junior Chamber of Commerce appeared before the Board and ask per-
mission to used the race track at the City Park for a race meet to be held on November 26-27
and December 3rd and 4th.

No action was taken upon this matter but Mr. Kaltenborn was assured that the track
might be used for a race meet.

Report of the Police Judge approved by the Mayor.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that all slot machine licenses applied for at this time be granted.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Thursday the 13th day of October, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

OCTOBER 13th, 1938.

Minutes of a recessed	regular meeting of the Board	of	Commissioners of the	City of Las

Vegas held on the 13th day	of October, 1938 at the hour	of	seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and
City Clerk.

Mr. Clark, Mr. Kaltenborn and Mr. Courtright of the Junior Chamber of Commerce appeared be
fore the Board and ask for a definite answer as to the use of the Race Track at the City Park
for use on Nov. 26th and 27th and Dec. 3rd and 4th, 1938 for a race meet.

After a discussion on the matter it was on motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Com-
missioner Corradetti moved and carried that the Junior Chamber of Commerce be given the use
of the race track upon which to hold a race meet Nov. 26th and 27th, and Dec 3rd and 4th be
granted. That said organization bear the expense of putting the race track in suitable condit-
ion and all other expenses	incidental to the sponsoring	of	said event. That the	Organization

have charge of all concessions, and that at the close of said race meet to give	the City 10% of

the net proceed of said meet. Said money to be held by the City and used for further improvements
of the race track and bounds.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The granting of a gaming license to the Bank Club was considered at this time. Application
being in the hands of the Clerk for two card games and three devices and money to cover the
license of same accompanying the application.

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner
Ronnow it was moved and carried that said application be denied on the grounds that there was
now in operation in the City five (5) gambling houses, that being the limit set by a Resolution
of the Board and at this time the Board did not see fit revoke said existing Resolution at this
time. It was also moved that the Clerk refund to the Bank Club the money accompanying said 

application.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioner
Corradetti voting no.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that three slot machine licenses be granted to the L and K Market and to the White Spot Cafe.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the bid of the Shell Oil Company for fuel oil requirements for the City of Las Vegas for
the winter of 1938 and 1939 be accepted provided the quality compares favorably with the quality
of the other bids on oil, but at the rate of 7½¢ per gallon, Bid price.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes, none.
At this time the Board considered the purchase of printed forms for requisitions, affidavits
of monthly sales and plumbing inspection books and upon motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by
Commissioner Krause it was moved that the low bidder on the total amount be given the bid pro-
vided the quality of paper compared favorably with the other bids.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The limiting of the number of taverns operated in the City was next considered and the
following Resolution was introduced:

WHEREAS there are at present sixteen licenses issued and outstanding for the conduct of
Taverns in the City of Las Vegas pursuant to Section 16 of Ordinance No. 203 of the City of Las
Vegas, as amended by Section 5 of Ordinance No. 228 of the City of Las V gas, and

WHEREAS the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas is of the opinion that sixteen
Taverns are sufficient for said City and that it is for the public good and for the public wel-
fare that no new Tavern licenses be issued and granted in said City,

NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED that until the further order of this Board it be and is
hereby established as the policy of this Board that no further Tavern licenses be granted to any
firm, person or corporation, in addition to the sixteen licenses now issued and outstanding,
and,

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that this Resolution is intended to and does supercede a previous
resolution of this Board limiting said tavern licenses to the number seventeen.

Mayor Marble moved the adoption of the above and foregoing resolution, and the same was
seconded by Commissioner Ronnow, and upon being put to vote was duly passes and adopted by the
following vote:

Voting Aye, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble.
Commissioners Corradetti passed his vote. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Monday the 17th day of October, 1938 at the hour of one thirty o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

OCTOBER 17th, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, held on the 17th day of October 1938 at the hour of one
thirty o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Luce and Krause, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Corradetti and Ronnow.

A discussion as to the time when payment should be made to the Board of Commissioners
of 10% of the net receipts from the Race Meet to be sponsored by the Junior Chamber of Com-
merce was entered into by the Board at this time. Some were of the opinion that the 10% was to
be paid the City at the close of the meet in December, 1938 and others that the ten per cent
was to be paid the City at the close of annual Rodeo, which would also be sponsored by the
Junior Chamber of Commerce. The following motion was introduced by Commissioner Luce and sec-
onded by Commissioner Krause in order that the time payment of the 10% might be definitely
established:

Motion that the money be held by the Junior Chamber of Commerce until the close of the
annual spring Rodeo and at that time the 10% of the net proceed be turned to the City.

Vote Commissioners Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that all warrants presented to the Board at this time namely Nos. 19 to 28 inclusive be
allowed.

Vote Commissioners Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Thursday the 20th day of October 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

The business of appointing a Fire Marshall in accordance with the ordinance allowing the
same was brought before the Board for consideration, and upon motion of Commissioner Ronnow se-
conded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the action of the Board taken on
August 12th, 1938 whereby W.J. Rhodes was appointed Fire Marshall be rescinded for the reason
that Mr. Rhodes is not a member of the Fire Department and in order to fill said office the Fire
Marshall must be a member of the Las Vegas Fire Department as same is provided by Ordinance.

Mr. Case, Fire Chief was appointed to fill the office of Fire Marshall.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Commissioner Ronnow presented to the Board for its consideration the application for
WPA aid on the Golf Course now under construction and on motion of Commissioner Krause seconded

for the making of said application.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Commissioner Ronnow reported to the Board that Claude Mackey, WPA Mgr. would be ready
to start a sidewalk project about November 5th with a crew of approximately 25 to 30 men.

That if the City did not want to proceed with a sidewalk programme the installation of additions
to the existing sewer system would be undertaken.

Noes, none.

Noes, none.

Present Mayor Pro Tem Krause, Commissioners Ronnow Luce and Corradetti, and City Clerk

Absent Mayor Marble and City Attorney Austin.

Mr. McNamee as attorney for the Las Vegas Land & Water Company and the Southern Nevada Power
Company accompanied by Mr. Ed Clark of the Southern Nevada Power Co. Mr. Vance of the Las Vegas Gas

Company and Mr. Folger of the Las Vegas Land & Water Company appeared before the Board and ask that
the Board consider lowering the rates required of public utilities when a revision of Ordinance

No. 243 would be considered. All stated that their respective company were willing to pay a reasonable
license fee but ask that a decrease in their rates be considered at the same time a modification
was made in other licenses demanded by the City.

No action was taken on the matter but the gentlemen were assured that their requests would be
considered and were ask to present in writing their wishes and rates they were willing to pay.

Mr. Henderson appeared before the Board in regard to persons securing electrical and plumbing
permits from licensed electricians and plumbers and then hiring a person not licensed to perform the

work.
After some discussion on the matter it was decided that the electrician, plumbers and con-
tractors should appear before the Board and state their cases at a time when the City Attorney
would be present.

Dr. Smith, veterinarian appeared before the Board in regard to the class of license re should
pay and it was the unanimous opinion of the Board that Dr. Smith should sign an affidavit and
have his business placed the Section 6 of Ordinance No. 243.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that E.P. Bihlmaier be granted 12 slot machine licenses and Peter Pansey 2.

none.

An Ordinance of the City of Las Vegas licensing, for purposes of regulation and revenue
every kind of business hereinafter specified, transacted or carried on within the corporate
limits of the City of as Vegas, state of Nevada; fixing the rates of license tax upon the
same and providing for the collection of said license tax and a punishment for carrying on or
conducting any such business without a license, and repealing ordinances numbered 1,2,4, 13,

Mayor H.P. Marble voting aye. Absent None. Commissioner Ronnow voting NO.

The Clerk was directed to have said Ordinance known as Ordinance No. 244 published in
the Las Vegas Review, a daily newspaper, published in the City of Las Vegas once each week for

reading of the testimony by the Clerk Mr. Cahlan ask that steps be taken to either revoke or
suspend the licenses of the places wherein said minor testified liquor was secured. Namely
Rose Distributing Company, Peter Pansey and Ethel's Liquor Store.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.
DECEMBER 8th, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 8th day of December, 1938 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and
City Clerk

Attorney Ham appeared before the Board and ask that the location of the Overland Bar be
held open for operation as a Tavern since the fore closure of said tavern by the owners of the
building. Said foreclose affecting the license granted to Harry Anderson for operation in said
Building. The Clerk read to the Board a letter from Mr. Anderson asking that he be permitted to
transfer said license to the Northern Club since the foreclosure on the location held by him in
the Overland Hotel.

Mayor Marble informed the interested parties that this matter would be considered at a
meeting to be held in the near future.

This being the time set for hearing the cases of the Rose Distributing Company, Peter
Pansey and Ethel Rapoport and a large number of interested persons being present per mission
was secured from the Sheriff to hold the meeting in the County Court House. Thereupon on motion
of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it mas moved and carried that the
meeting adjourn to the District Court Room in the County Court House.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause, and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting-
aye. Noes, none.

There upon the meeting recessed to convene in the Court Room.

Mayor Marble opened the meeting and informed those present that this was a hearing and
in no way to be conducted as a court.

Mrs. Malon Brown was present to take down and prepare transcript of said meeting which
is to be filed in the Clerk's Office for reference.

Mr. John Cahlan as Probation Officer questioned Clinton Goodwin, a minor, as to where
and when liquors were purchased by himself other minors.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that Ethel Rapoport be excused from any questioning at this time as no evidence had
been presented showing the sale of liquors from her place of business to minors.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting

aye.

Mr. Pansey was not present for questioning being absent from the City this date.

After some questioning Clinton Goodwin stated positively that John Rose of the
Rose Distributing Company had sold him wine. Mr. Rose denied this.

No definite action was taken on this matter, revoking or canceling any licenses.

On motion of Commissioner Luce Seconded By Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that the meeting recess and adjourn until Wednesday the 14th day of December, 1938 at the hour
of seven o'clock P.M. Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

DECEMBER 14th, 1938

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas Clark County, nevada held on the 14th day of December, .1938 at the hour of seven
o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause City Clerk and City Attorney.

Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

This being the time when Ordinance No. 244 should came before the Board for second read-
ing and adoption said ordinance entitled, "AN ORDINANCE OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS LICENSING
FOR THE PURPOSE OF REGULATION AND REVENUE EVERY KIND OF LAWFUL BUSINESS HEREINAFTER SPECIFIED
TRANSACTED OR CARRIED ON WITHIN THE CORPORATE LIMITS OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS, STATE OF NEVADA
FIXING THE RATES OF LICENSE TAX UPON THE SAME AND PROVIDING FOR THE COLLECTION OF SAID LICENSE
TAX, AND A PUNISHMENT FOR CARRYING ON OR CONDUCTING ANY SUCH BUSINESS WITHOUT A LICENSE AND
REPEALING ORDINANCES NUMBERED 1,2,4,13,14,35, 48, 62, 74,75, 81, 95, 102, 105, 108, 112, 117,
145, 184, 192, and 243" was read for the second time and adopted by the following vote: Com-
missioners Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble voting aye. Commissioner Ron-
now voting No. Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

At this time Mayor Marble instructed the Clerk to read to the Board a statement of Att-
orney Marshall regarding the sale of liquors to minors and the hearing on said case held at a
recessed regular meeting of the Board December 8th. Said report was ordered filed with the
Clerk.

The Board set the date of December 21st 1938 as the time to hear the charges against
Peter Pansey. Said charges being the sale of liquors to minors.

Mr. White of the State Health Board was present and informed the Board that his depart-
ment would cooperate in every possible in health and sanitation problems in the City.


The Clerk read a letter from Mr. Leo MacNamee asking that the City take some action

toward the payment of judgement to Mr. Schultz. Both the District Court and the State Supreme
Court ruling that the City pay damages to Mr. Schultz for injuries caused in an accident.

Mayor Marble handed the letter to the City Attorney for investigation and report.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that the bids of the Mohawk Oil Company and the General Petroleum Co. be accepted. Said bids
covering gasoline requirements for the City of Las Vegas for the year 1939. That the Mayor and
Clerk sign said contracts and that the two companies share and share alike. Price of gasoline
be $.1617.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, and Luce and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioner Krause
voting No.

On motion and recommendation of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was
moved and carried that the city employ one man at the rate of $5.00 per day in assist in the
cleaning out of the main sewer line. That time of said project would be ten days.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Commissioner Luce informed the Board that Dr. Mildren, City Health Officer, W.J. Rhoads
Building Inspector and A.L. Drew Electrical Inspector had made an inspection of the condition
of a number of cabins owned by a Mr. Murray on no 2nd St. and that the said cabins were in
a very unsanitary and hazardous condition.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that the Board of Commissioners approve the action of the Health Officer, Building Inspector
and Electrical Inspector and that they continue said investigation until the said cabins were
put in proper condition.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and Hie Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Friday the 16th day of December, 1938 at the hour of one o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY NEVADA.

JANUARY 13TH, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 13th day of January 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause ad Corradetti City Clerk and City
Attorney.

At this time a number of Plastering Contractors appeared before the Board and ask that the
Clerk and License collector make diligent inquiry as to all persons doing plastering work as to
whether or not same was being done under contract and if so to demand a license from same. These
men were informed that all contractor were required to carry a license but before collecting
such fee proof of contracting must be had. But that the Board and Clerk and License Collector
would be glad to work in cooperation with contractors in the collecting of license fees.

An	ordinance to amend	Section 8	and Section 12.	of Ordinance No.	165	of the City of



Las	Vegas, entitled: "An ordinance to	prohibit gaming	and	operation of	slot machines	in the

City	of	Las Vegas, without	first obtaining a license	therefor, regulating	the same,	fixing

the amount of such license, providing, a penalty therefor, repealing ordinances Nos. 77,82,

88, 103 and 115, and all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict therewith," was
read for a first time and adopted by the following vote: Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause
and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble voting aye. Noes, none. Absent none.

Said Ordinance to be known as Ordinance No. 245 . The Clerk was directed to have
said Ordinance No. 245 published in the Las Vegas Age, a weekly newspaper published in the
City of Las Vegas once each week for two consecutive weeks.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by commissioner Ronnow it was moved ana car-
ried that the following slot machine licenses be granted for the first quarter year:

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
Clark County Nevada held on the 23rd day of January 1939 at the hour of 3 o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Luce Krause and Corradetti City Attorney and Clerk

Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

Mr. S.J. Neilson of the State Board of Health appeared before the Board in regard to sanit-
ary ordinances and conditions of the City of Las Vegas. The Board informed My. Neilson that it
would cooperate in every way possible with him and the State Board of Health in what ever
activities it undertook in this community.

The business of lifting the limitations on gambling licenses and tavern licenses in the City
of Las Vegas was considered at this time and after due consideration the following Resolutions
were introduced and passed.

BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada
that that certain Resolution passed and adopted on the 19th day of August A.D. 1938; which limits
the number of gambling clubs to be permitted to be conducted in the City of Las Vegas to five
(5), be and the same hereby is rescinded, revoked, annulled and hereby declared to be of no
further virtue, force or effect.

Commissioner Corradetti proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution and the
same was seconded by Commissioner Krause and upon being put to vote was duly passed and adopted
by the following vote:

Voting Aye: Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor. Voting no,

None. Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada
that that certain Resolution passed and adopted on the 13th day of October, A.D. 1938, which limits
the number of tavern licenses to be issued in the City of Las Vegas to Sixteen (16), be and the
same hereby is rescinded, revoked annulled and hereby declared to be of no further virtue, force
or effect.

Commissioner Luce proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution and the same
was seconded by Commissioner Krause and upon being put to vote was duly passed and adopted by the
following vote:

Voting aye: Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor. Voting no,
none. Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

The Board at this time considered the adoption of a suitable Resolution in regard to Senate
Bill No. S.2 and the following was adopted!

RESOLUTION OF THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS, CLARK
COUNTY, NEVADA, RECUESTING THE GOVERNOR AND LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF
NEVADA TO ENDORSE SENATE BILL NO.2 IN THE UNITED STATES SENATE, INTRODUCED
BY SENATOR KEY PITTMAN.

WHEREAS, there was introduced in the Senate of the United States on the 4th day of January

A.D. 1939, Senate Bill No. 2 by Senator Key Pittman of Nevada, which is a bill authorizing the
Secretary of the Interior of the United States to convey certain land at the mouth of Las Vegas
Wash to the State of Nevada to be used for the purposes of a public park and recreational site
and other purposes, and

WHEREAS, the lands described in said Senate Bill No. 2. surround that certain inlet of Lake
Mead into which empties the Las Vegas Wash which drains the area comprising and immediately sur-
rounding the City of Las Vegas, and

WHEREAS the said inlet is a narrow arm of Lake Mead upon which there is a desirable beach for
bathing purposes and

WHEREAS the said inlet will in the future be extensively used by all of the people of said
City of Las Vegas for boating, bathing, fishing and other recreational purposes, and

WHEREAS the State of Nevada has already surveyed a road to the said proposed State Park, and
WHEREAS, the State of Nevada should develop a State Park upon lands in said Bill described
for the use and benefit of all of the people of the State of Nevada, and

WHEREAS the State of Nevada is allowed 18% of the firm horse power of electrical energy
developed at Boulder Dam for use of the State, and

WHEREAS it is highly desirable not only to the City of Las Vegas but to the entire State of
Nevada that industries be encouraged to locate in Nevada and near the source of such electrical
energy, and

WHEREAS the City of Las Vegas is the natural place for such location by reason of its geo-
graphical position and transportation facilities, and

WHEREAS there is not a sufficient water supply from the Las Vegas artesian water basin to supply
such industries and

WHEREAS the lands described in said Senate Bill No. 2 do afford an ideal and the most natural
location for taking water from Lake Mead for such purposes, and

Whereas, the creation and maintenance of such a State Park will necessarily lift a consider-
able burden from the park service of the United States Government, and

WHEREAS, it is provided in said Senate Bill No. 2 that the lands therein described shall revert
to the United States if not used for the purposes set forth in said bill,

NOW THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark
County, Nevada, that the Governor and Legislature of the State of Nevada be requested, and by the
adoption of this Resolution are solemnly and respectfully requested and urged to pass and adopt a
Resolution or Memorial to the Congress of the United States endorsing said Senate Bill No.2 and
petitioning the Congress to enact such Bill, and

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that a certified copy of this Resolution be immediately forwarded to
the Governor of the State of Nevada, and that a certified copy be forwarded to each member of the
Clark County delegation in the Nevada Legislature.

Commissioner Luce proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution and the same was
seconded by Commissioner Krause and upon being put to vote was duly passed and adopted this 23rd
day of January A.D. 1939; by the following vote:

Voting aye; Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor.

Voting no: None.	Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

Commissioner Corradetti brought to the Board the fact that Mrs. Clara Keel, had for sale one
Internation truck which could be purchased for the sum of $600.00 and that same would made a suit-
able truck for the fire department. Upon due consideration being given the following Resolution
was introduced and passed:

RESOLUTION

It having been brought to the attention of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas Clark County, Nevada, that Clara Keel of 345 No Main Street in said City of Las Vegas,
is now the owner of a certain 1938 International Pick-Up Truck, which has been driven but
approximately nine Hundred (900) miles and is	in	good condition, and that the said Clara

is desirous of selling said truck to the City	of	Las Vegas for the	sum of	Six	Hundred ($600.00)

Dollars to be paid unto here on or before the	4th day of May, A.D.	1939,	and

It appearing that the City of Las Vegas	is	in need of such a	truck	for	use by the local

Fire Department and for other uses and

It appearing that certain employees of said City, as well as certain member of this Board
of City Commissioners, have inspected said truck and found it to be in good condition and that they
each do urge the purchase of the same,

NOW THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, that
the City of Las Vegas do purchase of and from Clara Keel of 345 No Main Street, Las Vegas, Nevada,
that certain 1938 International Pick-up Truck, Motor No. HD 213-35524, Serial No 31925. Type D-2
for and at the agreed price of Six Hundred ($600.00) Dollars, to be paid unto the said Clara Keel
on or before the 4th day of May, A.D,. 1939.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the Mayor and City Clerk be, and they are authorized, empowered
and directed to draw a warrant upon the funds of said City in the said sum of Six Hundred ($600.00)
Dollars, and in favor of said Clara Keel, on or before the 4th day of May, A.D., 1939, and that
when such warrant is drawn and delivered unto the said Clara Keel, it shall be in full payment
of and for the purchase of said truck.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and Clerk.

Mr.	E.O. Underhill appeared before the Board in regard	to	license fees and regulations

to	be	set	forth in an amendment to the "Liquor Ordinance" to	be	considered to-day. Mr. Under-

hill was assured by Mayor Marble that what ever new licenses would be incorporated into the
liquor ordinance they would not be prohibitive.

Mrs. Ethel Rapoport appeared before the Board in regard to protection and rules governing
minors in taverns and liquor stores.

Mrs. Rapoport was informed that all proprietor and managers of liquor stores should be
very careful to whom sales were made so as not to violate any of the Federal, State, County or
City licenses or laws.

The	Board at this time read and discussed an amendment	to	the "Liquor License Ordinance"

as	same had been prepared by the City Attorney at the direction	of the Board of Commissioners.

At the hour of 12:20 noon no definite decision being reached in regard to some sections
the Board recessed until the hour of five o'clock P.M. this date.

Present at 5 o'clock P.M. Mayor Marble, Commissioners Luce Ronnow and Corradetti and City
Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Krause.

to amend Section 4, Section 16 as amended of Ordinance No. 203 of the City of Las Vegas, en-
titled: "An ordinance regulating the distribution and control of intoxicating and alcoholic
liquors and beverages; regulating places where and under what conditions said intoxicating and
alcoholic liquors and beverages may be kept, sold, given away or otherwise distributed; pro-
viding for permits and licenses; providing penalties for the violation of this ordinance; and
repealing all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict therewith," and to further amend
said ordinance No. 203 by adding thereto a new section to be known as Section 18 (a). "

Upon being put to vote said ordinance was adopted by the following vote: Commissioners

Absent Commissioner Krause.

secures its revenue for operating purposes and also explained the system of bookkeeping used
and the method of purchasing materials and supplies through a Purchasing Clerk.
