Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause end His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

The Clerk presented to the Board a petition circulated by S.M. Pahor signed by about 52%
of the property owners with in a radius of 500 feet from the N.E. corner of 4th and Charleston
Blvd. This petition ask that the Board grant permission to S.M. Pahor to erect a cabin court
on said site. This petition was circulated as per the provisions of the Zoning Ordinance.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow that permission be granted
S.M. Pahor to erect a cabin court at Fourth & Charleston.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY NEVADA,

MARCH 4th, 1939.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Has Vegas, held
on the 4th day of March, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti City Clerk and
City Attorney.

Mr. A.J. Drews, caretaker at the golf course appeared before the Board and ask that his
salary be reinstated as the green fees were not sufficient to warrant him carring on the work
at said course without additional renumeration.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that the City pay Mr. Drews $50.00 per month commencing with the 1st of March, 1939.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Robert Woodruff appeared before the Board and ask if said Board would be willing to cancel
its lease for the "Mermaid Swimming Pool" if the same was satisfactory with Samuel Shaw Jr.
owner of said site. Hr. Woodruff was anxious to secure the entire lease so that he might make
improvements thereon.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that claims and warrants Nos 108 to 118 inclusive be allowed and that the Mayor and Clerk sign
the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

This being the time set for the issuing of an Election Proclamation the following Resol-
ution was introduced and passed:

WHEREAS this is the year provided by law for the holding of a general city election in
the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, and

WHEREAS there are to be elected at such election two commissioners, each for a term of
four years, and a mayor for a term of four years, and

WHEREAS, it is the duty of this Board of Commissioners to order said election and deter-
mine the places in said City for holding the same,

NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED By the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
Clark County, Nevada, that a general election be held in said City on Tuesday the second day of
May, A.D. 1939, at which election there shall be elected a commissioner of the first (1st)
class and a commissioner of the third (3rd) class and a Mayor, each of whom shall be elected
for a term of four years, or until his respective successor is elected and qualified, and
BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the places in said City for holding said election and voting
thereat are hereby determined as follows:

For Precinct No. 1. At the Municipal Court Room in the rear of the Police Station on

2nd Street between Fremont and Ogden Streets.

For Precinct No. 2. At the City Library on Carson Street, between 2nd and 3rd Streets.

For Precinct	No.	3.	At	the Store Room in the Montana Hotel Building 303 So	Main St.

For Precinct	No.	4.	At	Clark's Garage, Clark Street between Main and First	Streets.

For Precinct	No.	5.	At	Martin's Garage, 204 No Fourth Street.

For Precinct No. 6. At Earhart's Packard Motor Car Display Room, corner of Fifth Street

and Fremont Street.

For Precinct No. 7. At Grammar School Building, 4th Street and Lewis Street, at Fourth

Street entrance.

For Precinct	No.	8.	At	Al Drew's Garage, 801 So. 2nd St.

For Precinct	No.	9.	At	McWilliam's Garage, NE Corner 3rd & Wilson Streets,	Westside.

For Precinct	No.	10	At	Delkin's Store building (Formerly Adam's Cash & Carry Grocery)

1016 Fremont Street.

For Precinct No. 11, At Shirley Scott's Garage, 208 West 6th Street, Westside.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED That the Mayor of said City forthwith make proclamation hereof.

Commissioner Ronnow proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution and the
same was seconded By Commissioner Krause, and upon being put to vote the same was duly carried
and adopted by the following vote: Voting Aye: Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti
and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble. Voting no none.

At this time and Ordinance Entitled "An Ordinance to amend Section 4, Section 16, as
Amended of Ordinance No. 203, of the City of Las Vegas, entitled, "An Ordinance regulating the
distribution and control of intoxicating and alcoholic liquors and beverages, regulating places
where and under what conditions said intoxicating and alcoholic liquors and beverages, may be
kept sold, given away or otherwise distributed; providing for permits and licenses: providing
penalties for the violation of this ordinance; and repealing all ordinances and parts of or-
dinances in conflict herewith," and to further amend said Ordinance No. 203 by adding thereto
a new section to be known as Section 18 (a)," came before the Board for second reading, and upon
being read by the Clerk and proof of publication being presented same was adopted by the
following vote: Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Noes, none.

Absent none. This Ordinance to be known as Ordinance No. 246.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MARCH 16, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, Clark County, Nevada; held on the 16th, day of March, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock
P.M.

Present: Commissioners, Krause, Ronnow, Lace, and Corradetti. and Dep. City Clerk Le Boy
Whipple.

Absent: Mayor H.P. Marble, City Attorney H.H. Austin and City Clerk Viola Burns.

Commissioner Herb Krause acted as Mayor Pro Tem, in the absence of Mayor Marble and presided at
the meeting.

Repairs to the Scout cabins, and City Barn at the City Park were discussed, and upon
motion of Commissioner Ronnow and seconded by Commissioner Luce it was agreed to authorize the
City Purchasing Clerk to send out invitations to bid on the following: One bid to cover
materials to repair the roofs of the Boy Scout Cabins, one bid to cover paint and materials
necessary to paint the Barns and One Bid to Stucco the back and two side of the grand stand.

Mr. W. J. Roads, Street Supt, was authorized to submit such specifications on materials needed
and other data necessary to the City Purchasing Clerk in order that such bids submitted would
cover in detail the necessary requirements, in making such repairs needed.

Vote on the foregoing was as follows: Commissioners, Ronnow, Luce and Corradetti, and Herb
Krause acting as Mayor Pro tem Voting Aye, Noes None.

Bids on Salvage Canvass Covers for the Fire Department were then next opened, Four bids
being received from the following houses. Las Vegas Mattress Factory, Las Vegas Tent and Awning
Company, and Las Vegas Garage Body and Top Works all from Las Vegas, Nevada and one bid from
Roy G. Davis Company of Los Angeles, California.

After checking the figures on the bids submitted, together with samples attached to each bid
on materials bid on it was decided upon the recommendation of the Fire Chief Harold Case that
the Bid from the Roy G. Davis Company of Los Angeles Be accepted. Thereupon Commissioner
Corradetti moved that The City Purchasing Clerk be Authorized to issue a purchase order to Roy
G. Davis Company of Los Angeles for six such salvage covers No. 102 at $15.00 Each and to have same shipped immediately
to the Fire Department. The motion was seconded by Commissioner Ronnow and vote being as follows:
Commissioners, Ronnow, Luce and Corradetti and Herb Krause acting as Mayor Pro Tem Voting Aye
Noes None.

At this time the regular payroll and demand claims against the city were presented numbering
from 119 to 125 inclusive. upon motion of commissioner Ronnow and seconded by Commissioner Luce
it was moved that such claims be allowed and that the Mayor Pro Tem and City Clerk be authorized
to sign same. Vote being, Commissioners, Ronnow, Luce and Corradetti and Herb Krause Mayor Pro
Tem voting aye, Noes None.

One Five Cent Mills Slot machine license application was presented to the board for action.
Upon motion of Commissioner Ronnow and Seconded by commissioner Luce such application from Bert
Smith at N. 3rd and Stewart Streets, was acted upon and a license to operate same for the first
quarter of 1939 was granted. Vote being Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Corradetti and Herb Krause
acting as Mayor Pro Tem voting aye, Noes None.

There being no further business before the board at this time it was moved by Commissioner
Ronnow and Seconded by Commissioner Luce that the meeting recess until March 27th, 1939 at the
hour of Nine o'clock A. M. Vote was Commissioners Ronnow, and Luce and Herb Krause voting Aye,
Noes none - Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY; NEVADA
MARCH 27, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, Clark County, Nevada; held on the 27th, day of March 1939 at the hour of nine o'clock
A. M.

Present: Mayor H.P. Marble, Commissioners, Joe S. Ronnow, H.E. Luce, Herb Krause and
Al Corradetti. City Attorney H. H. Austin and Deputy City Clerk Le Roy Whipple

Absent: City Clerk Viola Burns.

A Claim presented by J. Warren Woodard for the sum of $795.00 being principle of $750.00
and interest of $45.00 to March 27th, 1939 at 6% payable annually the same being the regular
annual payment on the purchase of land at the City Gravel Pit South of the City was first acted
upon. Motion was made by commissioner Ronnow and seconded by commissioner Krause that the claim
be payed and that the Mayor and Deputy City Clerk sign such warrant as was presented for payment
Vote on same being: Commissioners, Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti, and His Honor the H.P. Marble Mayor Voting
Aye Noes, None. Absent at vote being Commissioner Luce.	

Marion B. Earl Attorney for the Southern Nevada Meat and Provision Company appeared before
the board requesting that said company be exempt from paying the regular City Quarterly License
tax as provided for under ordinance # 244. Mr. Earl stated that the Southern Nevada Meat and
provision Company was a non profit organization acting as an agent for the farmers throughout the
southern part of the state and that under their set up the Federal Government had already exempted 

them from any federal taxes or licenses as is imposed on various business concerns, and
that it would work a considerable hardship on his company in as much as they were getting under
way in their business and that such license tax would really be taxing the farmer in the state
if the city should demand such a license be paid. City attorney H.H. Austin explained that under
the present ordinance that the city could not allow any exemption and that should such an exemption
be granted that the ordinance would have to be amended. Thereupon Mayor Marble asked that the

Southern Nevada Meat and Provision Co. write a letter to the board explaining in detail their 

request and that the board would have the City attorney make a report on same.
Mr. W. J. Rhoades, Superintendent of Streets appeared before the board in regards to
the water situation in the Woodlawn Park Addition. The well in that district and water mains
being in a bad condition and that such water flowing thru the water mains was breaking thru
the old pipes and flooding the surrounding property. It could not be learned as to just whom
the well and system belonged to in order to get repairs done to the system. Motion was made
by Commissioner Krause and seconded by Commissioner Luce that the city attorney be authorized
to contact the State Engineer and ascertain as to was the rightful owner of the well in the
said district. Vote being Commissioners, Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the
Mayor H.P. Marble voting aye, Noes None.

Mr. Rhoades also at this time stated that Mr. A.P. Rubidoux would like to proceed with
curb and gutter at his property on South Tenth Street between Fremont and Carson Streets but
asked that the City Provide a surveyor to give him the necessary grades in order to make
such improvements. On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was
moved to authorize the Street Commissioner to have the survey made and that the original plat
or drawing of such survey to be made be placed on file with the City Clerk and that in the
future all such original drawings of any surveys made, must be left on file with the City Clerk
at all times before any such claim is payed for such work or services performed.

Vote on the foregoing being Commissioners, Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye, Noes None. At this time the Board recessed temporarily to meet with the

Clark County Commissioners in establishing the tax rate to be allowed the City for this years Budget then resumed its meeting

Mr. Corradetti at this time made mention of the necessity of having authority at the
police station to act in emergency whenever unforeseen circumstances arise in accident or
emergency cases, that they be allowed to have access to such medical advise or facilities as
becomes necessary to meet the situation and taking care of such person that might be involved
It was suggested that Mr. Corradetti be authorized to contact the County Commissioners in order
to see if some solution could be worked out with that board in meeting such situations.

Bids on Automobile tires for the Police Department were then next opened and presented
to the board for action. Bids being received from the following: Jim Cashman, Tower Service
Station, Jas. H. Down, General Auto Parts, Clark and De Vinney, and A. G. Grant. In as much
as sufficient information was lacking on some of the bids as to the name and make of such
tires bid on the bids were referred to the Police Commissioner and Purchasing Clerk for securing
further information.

Bids on Paint for painting the Street Barns and materials for repairs to the roofs of the
Scout Cabins in the park, also bids for stuccoing the grand stand were then opened and presented
to the board to act on. after going over the bids it was suggested that all bids be referred 

to the Street Commissioner and Purchasing Clerk for abstracting and referring to the
board at their next meeting.

A petition signed by residents owning property on north Seventh and Mesquite streets and
vicinity against the operation of a carpenter shop by one, C.W. Jorgensen at 401 N. 7th, Street
was next presented to the Board. After some discussion it was moved by Commissioner Luce and
seconded by commissioner Ronnow that the City Attorney write Mr. C.W. Jorgensen to be present
at the next meeting of the board to discuss said petition. Vote being Commissioners Ronnow,

Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor H.P. Marble voting Aye, Noes None.

There being no further business before the board at this time the meeting recessed until
Thursday March 30th, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

No quorum present March 30th, 1939 therefore no meeting was held.

The considering of the Civil Service Act passed at the last session of the Nevada State
Legislature governing the Police Department of the City of Las Vegas was considered and after some
discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was
moved and carried that the City Clerk be instructed to write to the Chief of Police David Mackey,
Mark Condo, Robert Owens and Harry Miller officers and inform them that their services on the Las
Vegas Police Department would terminate the night of April 30th, 1939, such action being taken for
the good of the service.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Ronnow, and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commis-
sioner Corradetti voting no. Absent none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Thursday the 13th day of April, 1939 at the hour of ten o'clock P.M.

APRIL 21st, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County
Nevada held on the 21st day of April, 1939 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti City Clerk and City Attorney.

Absent Commissioner luce.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that a whole-
sale beverage license be granted to	the Neva a	National Ice Co and a retail beverage license to the White Spot	Cafe.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow,	Krause and	Corradetti and is Honor	the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow was moved and carried that the slot machine
licenses applied for my Peter Pansey and Ethel Rapoport be granted.	

Vote Commissioners Ronnow,	Krause and	Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

The business of enforcing Ord 210 of the City of Las Vegas was considered by the Board. Said Ordinance 

	making it complusary for drivers andovers of Taxi cabs to carry public liability and personal property insurance.

Said insurance being hard to secure a number of taxi operators were operating with out this insurance.

After some discussion on this matter on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was
moved and carried that the Clerk write and instruct the Police Depart of said City to inform the operators of taxi cabs
that public liability andpersonal property insurance must be secure as same is provided in Ord 210, and that all lic-
enses to operate taxi cabs are hereby revoked until said insurance is secured.
Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Commissioner Luce arriving late.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the City
purchase a power mower, Jacobsen make, price $607.00 from the Ullom Hardware Co. Said mower to be used at the City
Park.	

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye Noes, none.

Police and Fire Commissioner Mr Corradetti recommended to the Board that Geo Thompson, office of the Las Vegas
Police Depart be named acting Chief of Police until a new Chief might be employed.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
Geo Thompson be named acting Chief of Police for the City of Las Vegas commencing May 1st and the salary be fixed at
$200.00 per month.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that the Electri-
cal Inspector install five additional street lights, same to cost approximately $183.00 and to be installed as
follows: 5th & Linden, 6th & Oak So Main & 5th and 2 at the race track.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried that the City pay
C.D.Baker, Civil Engineer $50.00 for maps and survey for water filings for the well at Woodlawn Cemetery.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until Monday the 24th day of
April, 1939 at the hour of 10 o'clock A.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY NEVADA.

APRIL 29th, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas Nevada held on the
24th day of April, 1939 at the hour of ten A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney and Clerk.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved add carried that the City give from
its Publicity Fund the sum of $750.00 to be used toward the transportation of the Boulder Dam Model to the
New York World's Fair.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Police Officer Condo appeared before the Board and presented for its consideration his application for 

reinstatement on the Police Dept. and waived all his rights for promotion, to the office of Chief of Police.

After consideration on the matter on motion of Commissioner Luce the matter was brought before the Board for
second and vote, Mayor Marble ask Commissioner Krause, Mayor Pro Tem to take the Mayor's chair and Mr. Marble
then seconded Mr Luce's motion to the effect that Officer Condo be retained on the Police force May 1st and
the salary be $180.00 per month.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Mr Marble and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Commissioner
Corradetti passing his vote. Noes, none.
Mayor Marble resumed his seat as Mayor.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that the Board take the
same action in regard to Officer Owens when he had made application to the Board for reinstatement and had waived
his rights to the office of Chief of Police.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none. Commissioners Cor-
radetti passing his vote.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried that the Board return to
Fred Rehn the sum of $100.00 held as a surety bond as Mr. Rehn had made application to the Board for return of
said sum due to the fact he was closing his business as an electrical contractor and leaving the City.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that the City allow
the sum of $15.30 to the Apache Cafe to cover cost of meals furnished the Junior Police Officers at a dinner
sponsored by the Police Dept.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that six slot
machine licenses to granted to each the Fremont Bar, The Recreation Center and Al's Bar.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that L and K Market
and Bernice Davis be granted retail beverage licenses.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that bids not
be call on the purchase of laboratory supplies for W.R.Smith, City Meil Inspector but that the purchasing clerk
purchase same through a supply house out side the City as said supplies could not be purchased here.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that bids be issued for
the purchase of a cooler for the City Library.		

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Com-
missioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the meeting adjourn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 4th, 1939.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
Nevada held on the 4th day of May, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow Luce, Krause and Corradetti and City Attorney
and Clerk.

Attorney Marshall appeared before the Board at the request of the V.F.W. and the American
Legion and their Auxiliaries and ask that the Board take action toward the sale of popies
as same was being sold in the City in the near future by an association the proceeds of such
sale to be used toward help for blind persons. The objection to this sale being that it occurs
near the time of the annual sales of the American Legion and the V.F.W. and the flowers being
quite similar in color and designed.

Mr Marshall and delegates from the various associations were informed that the Board would
this matter consideration later on in this meeting.

A.L. Riddle appeared before the Board in regard to securing a franchise for the operation
of sight seeing cars with guide service out side the 15 mile limit of the City. Mr Austin was
ask to give the Board a ruling on this matter in the near future.

Mr. Carter appeared before the Board in regard to securing a shooting gallery license for
operation in the 100 Block on No. 1st St. After considering the matter and being assured by
the Building Inspector that he would see that the building was not a hazard on motion of Com-
missioners Ronnow seconded by commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the Clerk
issue a license to Mr. Carter when the Building Inspector and the Chief of Police were sat-
isfied that the housing of the gallery was not a hazard.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting ave.
Noes, none.

Lenora Aguirre appeared before the Board and ask for a beverage license for 120 So.

First Street. Mrs Aguirre was informed that the application had been granted but she must use
same in the front of the building and not at the rear of the lot.

The Board upon being informed that J.L. Stewart was no longer being employed by the
Acme Plumbing Company as master plumber upon motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commis-
sioner Corradetti directed the Clerk to correct license No. 828 to read H. Brockmiller
Master plumber for the Acme Plumbing Co.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.
At this time the Clerk read to the Board a letter from A.J. Mackie asking for an additional
extension of time to pay the balance due the City from sale of Block 5 in South Addition.

Upon motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Mr Mackie be given six months additional time to pay the balance due from sale of Block 5
South Addition and that he be informed this was the final extension of time. Said extension to
terminate November 4th, 1939.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that warrants and demands Nos. 142 to 153 inclusive be allowed and. that the Mayor and Clerk sign
the same.

Vote Commission rs Ronnow, Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner
Luce seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that this meeting recess until
Tuesday the 9th day of May, at the hour of ten A.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

There upon said meeting recessed until Tuesday the 9th day of May, 1939 at the hour of
ten A.M.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that the following retail beverage licenses be granted:

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
the L and K Market be granted 2 slot machine licenses and Bert Smith one.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

The business of public liability and personal property insurance for taxi operators again
came before the Board for consideration.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the operators of taxis be given until mid-night May 10th to secure said policies.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that the Board secure bids for the publishing of bills, as same is provided in the new Charter
amendment. Publishers to bid on 6 point type and bids to be received May 15th and bids to cover
publications from April 1st to December 31, 1939.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none

Mr. Goerman, Secretary of the Las Vegas Chamber of Commerce appeared before the Board and
ask that the Board allow $50.00 toward the traveling expenses of the Mayor to Salt Lake City, Utah.
The Mayor and one other representative of the City had been invited to speak over KSL Wednesday
May 10th, 1939, to publicize Las Vegas, and the annual Helldorado and Rodeo.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
the City allow the sum of $50.00 toward traveling expenses of the Mayor or his representative to
Salt Lake City Utah .

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

A communication from the United States Flag Association was presented to the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried that
the Mayor issue proper proclamation for National Flag week, June 8th to 14th, 1939 and that the
City enter into the programme as sent forth by the United States Flag Association.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none,

The Board again took under consideration the sale of popies for the benefit of the blind,
and Mr. John Cahlan of the Las Vegas Evening Review Journal informed the Board that the paper
would carry an item and explain to the public that this sale of flowers was in no way connected
with the V.F.W. or the American Legion but was from a reliable association seeking aid for the
unfortunate blind.

Thereupon, it appearing to the Board that John L. Russell has received a plurality of all
votes cast for the office of Mayor of the City of Las Vegas, it was therefore Resolved by Com-
missioner Ronnow, seconded by Commissioner Luce, that the said John L. Russell be and he is
hereby declared to be the duly elected Mayor of the City of Las Vegas for the ensuing four years,
and it was further Resolved that the City Clerk be and she is hereby directed to issue a certi-
ficate of election to the said John L. Russell. Vote on said Resolution was Commissioners,
Ronnow, Luce, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Thereupon, it appearing to the Board that C.V.T.Gilbert had received a plurality of all
votes cast for the office of Commissioner 1st glass and it was Therefore Resolved by motion of
Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce, that the said C.V.T. Gilbert be and he is
hereby declared to be the duly elected Commissioners of the First Class of the City of Las Vegas
for the ensuing four years, and it was further Resolved that the City Clerk be and she is hereby
directed to issued a certificate	of	election to	the said	C.V.T. Gilbert. Vote on said Resolution

was Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and	Krause and His Honor	the Mayor H.P. Marble voting aye.	Noes,

None.



Thereupon, it appearing to the Board that Al Corradetti had received a plurality of all
votes cast for the office of Commissioners Third Class and it was Therefore Resolved by motion
of Commissioner Ronnow, seconded by Commissioner Luce, that the said Al Corradetti be and he is
hereby declared to be the duly elected Commissioner of the Third Class of the City of Las Vegas
for the ensuing four years, and	it	was Further	Resolved	that the City Clerk be and she is	hereby

directed to issue a certificate	of	election to	the said	Al Corradetti. Vote Commissioners	Ronnow

Luce Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Thereupon it appearing to the Board that Harry H. Austin had received a majority of all
vote cast for the office of City Attorney it was Therefore Resolved on motion of Commissioner
Ronnow, seconded by Commissioner Luce, that the said Harry H. Austin be and he is hereby declared
to be the duly elected City Attorney of the City of Las Vegas for the ensuing two years, and it
was further Resolved that the City Clerk be and she is hereby directed to issue a certificate
of election to the said Harry H. Austin.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.
Thereupon it appearing to the Board that Gus Blad had received a plurality of all votes cast

for the office of Municipal Judge, it was Therefore Resolved, on motion of Commissioner Ronnow,
seconded by Commissioner Luce, that the said Gus Blad be and he is hereby declared to be the
duly elected Municipal Judge for the ensuing two years, and it was further Resolved that the City
Clerk be and she is hereby directed to issue a certificate of election to the said Gus Blad.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until the
16th day of May, at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

MAY 16th, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 16th day of May, 1939 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Ronnow.

Minutes of meetings from April 4th to May 9th inclusive read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that warrants Nos. 154 to 160 be allowed and that the Mayor and Clerk sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Luce Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that a Master Electricians certificate be granted to Irwin G. Warner. Said application for per-
mit being accompanied by check of $50.00. Mr. Warner to work as master electrician for the
Connelly Electric Co.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Mr. C.V.T.Gilbert appeared before the Board and ask for assistance in improving the cross-
ing near the Westside School and informed the Board that both the Board of County Commissioners
and the W.P.A. would assist if the City would allow them the use of two trucks and approximately
$18.00 for gas.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that the City allow the sum of $18.00 for gas and the use of two trucks toward the improvement
of the crossing near the Westside School.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the City bills for the month of April 1939 be published in the Las Vegas Age and the bills
for May, 1939 be published in the L.V.Review Journal and that the rate paid be half the legal
rate.

Vote Commissioners Luce,	Krause	and	Corradetti and His Honor	the	Mayor	voting	aye.	Noes, none

he renewal of the lease	had by	the	C.C.C. on ground east of	the	City used as	a camp came

before the Board at this time, and on motion of Commissioner Luce, seconded by Commissioner Krause
it was moved and carried that the Mayor	sign the renewal of this	lease for	one year.

Vote Commissioners Luce,	Krause	and	Corradetti and His Honor	the	Mayor	voting	aye.	Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that a retail beverage license be granted to Joe Gallo at the Apache Bar and one be granted to
the L.V.Fire Department.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
the Elks Lodge be granted a retail Tavern License and license for 8 slot machines, three devices
and one card game at the Helldorado Village.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that the City allow the sum of $30.00 toward the traveling expenses of A.L.Drew to the Chapter
meeting of the S.W. Section of the International Electrical Inspectors Association.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 25th, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 25th day of May, 1939 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and Clerk, also
Present were the newly elected Mayor, John L. Russell and Commissioner C.V.T.Gilbert.

Commissioner Luce arriving late and Commissioner Ronnow absent.

Minutes of meeting of May 16th read and approved as read.

Bert O'Donnell appeared before the Board as a representative of the Las Vegas Junior
Chamber of Commerce and protested the maintaining of a wrecking or mercantile lot on South 5th
and Main Streets as same was being installed by Wm. Mendelssohn.

Mayor Marble ask that the Junior Chamber of Commerce present in writing its complaint and
any suggestions that it might have toward remedying same.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that the Clerk write Mr. Mendelssohn and inform him that the fence being erected around
the ground housing his wrecking yard must be completed in ten days and must be intact at all
times.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that E.P. Bihlmaier be granted seven slot machine licenses for the present quarter.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

A letter from the Las Vegas soft ball association asking permission to use the City Park
for night games was read to the Board and on motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commis-
sioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the Softball Association be granted permission
to use the City Park for games during the summer months but must pay for the electricity con-
sumed for lighting said park. That the matter of concession would be considered at a future
meeting.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On recommendation and motion of Commissioner Krause it was moved that A.J. Drews be
allowed the some of $100.00 as salary for the months of January and February 1939 as caretaker
at the Las Vegas Municipal Golf Course. Said motion seconded by Commissioner Corradetti.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

A copy of the bill of sale of the Swigart Electric Company to the Connelly Electric
Company was presented to the Board wherein and whereby as a part of the transaction was the
transferring of the Swiart Electric Co. Cash bond had with the said City to the Connelly Electric Co.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and
carried that the cash bond in the sum of $100.00 held by the City for the Swigart Electric Co.
be transferred to the credit of the Connelly Electric Company.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Mayor Marble informed the Board that he had of the five curtsey Police Captain Badges
of the five alloted to him and ask that Commissioner Corradetti, present Police and Fire Commis-
sioner take charge of same. Mayor Marble also informed the Board that the three (3) badges he
had presented were to the following persons: The Mayor of El Monte, California, the Prince of
Denmark upon his visit to the City of Las Vegas and one to Rex Bell.

On motion	of	Commissioner	Krause	seconded	by Commissioner	Corradetti	it	was moved and

carried that the	official badges	of the	Mayor, Commissioners and	City Clerk	be	retained by these

officers after the expiration of their respective term of office

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion	of	Commissioner	Krause	seconded	by Commissioner	Luce it was	moved and carried

that the Purchasing	Clerk advertise for	bids for	the purchase of	a car load	of	road oil No.

SC2.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

On motion of Commissioner Luce seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
the the City purchase the 1939 Supplement of the McQuillin Municipal Corporation Law.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

Mr. Boyer, Mr. Cashman and Mr. Adcock of the B.P.O.E. Lodge appeared before	the	Board

and ask that the City give from its publicity fund the sum of $400.00 to be used toward	the

fund for the erection of a permanent Helldorado Village. The BP.O.E. Lodge had given the City
a sum of money namely $419.00 for licenses to operate a tavern and slot machines and devices,
at the Helldorado held the week of May 11th, 1939.

Mayor Marble informed the Committee that the City would give to its fund as soon as it
had determined the amount of money the City would receive from Clark County was its part of the
licenses collected by the Sheriff of Clark County.

Commissioner Corradetti reported on his trip to the Nevada Peace Officers Convention
held at Winnemucca Nevada the 20th of May. Mr. Corradetti was much infavor of these	intercity

meetings and reported a excellent time had by those attending from Las Vegas.

Mayor Marble expressed his appreciation of the attendance of Mr. Russell and Mr. Gilbert
at this meeting and assured them of his cooperation after the expiration of his term of office
as Mayor.

Both Mr. Russell and Mr. Gilbert expressed their thanks for being invited at attend
a meeting prior to them assuming their places on the Board of Commissioners on June 5th, 1939.
Report of Municipal Judge approved by the Mayor. Fines in the amount of $127.00 for the
month of April being received.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that this meeting recess and adjourn until Monday the 29th day of May, 1939 at the hour of ten
o'clock A.M.

Vote Commissioners Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

There upon the meeting recessed until Monday the 29th day of May, 1939 at the hour of ten
o'clock A.M.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
Clark County Nevada held on the 29th day of May, 1939 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Luce.

Mayor Marble ask that the Clerk read a letter from City Attorney Austin giving his ruling in
regard to the "Civil Service" act as same was introduced at the last session of the State Legis-
lature. Said act regulating the hiring of police officers. After the reading of said letter
same was ordered filed for future reference.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that David Mackey, former Chief of Police and Assistant Chief Miller be re-employed on the Las
Vegas Police Department as "patrolmen".

Vote was Commissioners Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Commissioner Ronnow and His Honor
the Mayor voting no. Absent Commissioner Luce.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the City from its Publicity Fund donate the sum of $25.00 to the Las Vegas Fireman's Club.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none

At this time the Clerk opened three bids for the printing of "bid forms".

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Mr. Ronnow Finance Commissioner check these bids and award the order to what in his estimation
was the best bid.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that retail beverage licenses for the year 1939 be granted to Ted Konduris and D.G. Lorenzi.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

Nelson Bishop be employed by the Street Department for the next ten days at the rate of $5.00 per
day.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none

Commissioner Krause brought to the attention of the Board the fact that the had an offer
to lease the small house at the City Gravel Pit. After some discussion on the matter on motion of
Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the City
Attorney prepare a form of lease and present sane to the Board for approval before the same might
be signed by the interested parties.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner Ronnow
seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved that this meeting adjourn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the mayor voting aye. Noes,

LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY NEVADA.

JUNE 5th, 1939.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
held on the 5th day of June, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Marble, Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney
and City Clerk.

Minutes of meetings of May 25th and 29th read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that the Board of Commissioners approve the action of Commissioner Corradetti in employing
David Mackey and Harry Miller as Police Officers for the month of June, 1939 at the rate of
$5.00 per day.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the report of Municipal Judge Lewis for the month of May, 1939 be filed and that the Mayor
sign same as his approval thereof. Fines for the month of May 1939 $235.00.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Luce it was moved and carried
that warrants Nos. 161 to 170 inclusive for salaries and materials be allowed and that the
Mayor and Clerk sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Luce, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

At this time the newly elected Mayor, John L. Russell, and Commissioners Corradetti and
Gilbert, and City Attorney Austin were in attendance.

Mayor Marble ask that Commissioner Luce surrender his chair, as an outgoing Commissioner
to Commissioner Gilbert, Mayor Marble reseated Mr. Corradetti as Commissioner and Mr Austin as
City Attorney and in a few well chosen words thanked the Commissioners and the Clerk and
all other City employees for their cooperation during his term of office as Mayor, he then
extended his well wishes to the new Mayor John L. Russell and assured him of hi cooperation as
a private citizen and surrendered his chair as Mayor to Mr. Russell.

This portion of minutes approved by Mayor Marble as they represent his last action as
the Mayor of the City of Las Vegas.

Approved:

Mayor.

Before Mayor elect Russell called the meeting to order and started the order of business
the Clerk presented to the Board the bonds of each of the newly elected officers in the sum
of One Thousand Dollars, their oaths of office and the approval of the said bonds by the Chair
man of the Board of Clark County Commissioners as same is provided by City Charter, thereupon
the newly elected officers entered upon their duties. Mayor Russell explained to the Board the
programme he had in mind for his term of office and in turn ask that each commissioner tell
of their plans, ideas, and programme. All the Commissioners and Mayor assured those present
( which included about forty or fifty interested citizens) that they would all work toward the
improvement of Las Vegas, and in operating the City in a business like manner.

Mayor Russell ask what the members of the Board though of having a joint meeting with
the Board of County Commissioners in the near future and upon motion of Commissioner Krause
seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that the Clerk write the Board of Clark
County Commissioners and ask that they set a time when it would be convenient to meet with the
Board of City Commissioners.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

At this time the selection of a Mayor Pro Tem was given consideration and it was the unan-
imous opinion of the members of the Board that Commissioner Krause retain his position as Mayor
Pro Tem.

The appointment of a Chief of Police for the City of Las Vegas was brought before the
Board by Mayor Russell and he recommended the appointment of Judd Parker to the office of Chief
of Police. As this appointment must be made by the entire Board of Commissioners the Mayor
called for a motion upon the matter and receiving none surrendered his chair to the Mayor
Pro Tem and introduced the motion that Judd Parker be appointed Chief of Police of the City of
Las Vegas. After some minutes and no seconding being had Mayor Pro Tem Krause ask for a second
and still not receiving a second the motion died for want of the same.

There upon Mayor Russell resumed his seat as Mayor.
The Clerk at this time read a letter to the Board of Commissioner from the Las Vegas
Junior Chamber of Commerce wherein said Chamber ask permission to use the City Park for a
concert to be given by the Pasadena Tournament of Roses Band on June 30th, 1939.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that permission be granted to the Junior Chamber of Commerce to use the park the night of June
30th, 1939 for a band concert.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

At this time the Clerk opened bids for a cooling system for the Public Library and upon
motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause that the bids be handed to Le
Roy Whipple. Purchasing Clerk for checking both as to prices and kinds and report at next meeting
Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

The Clerk read a petition signed by about forty-five citizens asking that O.C. Boggs
be appointed Chief of Police.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that the petition be filed for future reference.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that Ebbie Davis be employed for 10 days as motor grader operator and the wages for same be $8.00
per day.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Corradetti and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

At this time the Mayor appointed the Commissioners to the various departments of which they
would have charge, but in making these appointments informed the members that changes might be made

Commissioner Krause	Police and Fire	Departments

Commissioner Gilbert	Streets and	Public Property

Commissioner Ronnow	Finance

Commissioner Corradetti	Water Sewer	and	Lights.

Mr. Blackman brought to the attention of the Board at this time the fact that his term of
office as a member of the Recreational Board had terminated and stated that he would not consider
a re-appointment to the office, but recommended the appointment of Jimmy Sadler to the vacancy
and stated that this meet with the approval of the balance of the members of the Recreational
Board.

Thereupon on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by CommissionerKrau.se it was moved
and carried that Jimmy Sadler be appointed to the Recreation Board to fill the vacancy caused
by the expiration of the the term of A.W. Blackman. Said term to be eight years from date.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Kruse, Gilbert and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The business of securing supplies to be used by the Recreational Department during the summer 

months was discussed by the Board.	

It was also brought to the attention of the Board that the Street Commissioner automatically
became a member of the Recreation Board and with this through in mind Commissioner Krause was
released of this duty and same was turned to the newly appointed Commissioner of Streets, Mr.
Gilbert.

After some discussion on the matter of supplies for this department on Motion of Commis-
sioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that Commissioner Gilbert
meat with the Recreational Board in the near future and authorize them to secure the necessary
help for additional work during the summer months and to report back to the Board in regard to
the purchase of equipment and supplies. (A sum of money for this department had been allowed in
the 1939 budget).

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that this meeting recessed until the 16th day of June, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock

P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

There upon said meeting recessed until June 16th, 1939 at 7 o'clock P.M.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JUNE 16th, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
held on the 16th day of June, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney
and Clerk.

Minutes of meeting of June 5th read and approved as read.

Commissioner Gilbert reported to the Board that the Recreational Board had started its summer
programme, and he as a member thereof had approved the expenditures within the budget of this department
 for the summer months.

Mayor Russell reported to the Board that he found the dispensing of gasoline from the City
pump not being properly recorded and that the barns for housing the horses during the race meets
and annual rodeos in an untidy condition.

The Clerk read to the Board a petition signed by a number of building contractors petitioning
the Board to retain W.J. Rhoads as Building Inspector.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded By Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
this petition be filed for future reference.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Malon Brown appeared before the Board and ask that the Board take steps toward establishing
streets grades in the vicinity of 11th and Bonneville Streets.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that The Commissioner of Streets, Mr. Gilbert investigate the making of grades at 11th and Bonne-
ville Streets and report back to the Board at the next meeting.

Vote Commissioner Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The matter of making allowances for the annual vacations for the various City employees was
considered, and on motion of Commissioner Gilbert Seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and
carried that the following employees of the Street Dept. be granted the following vacations:

H.O. Johnson	June 19-20-21-22 1939

R.C.Coon	July 1st to 15th, 1939

Noes, none.

that the following Police Officer be given annual leave:

L. Howard	July 1st to 15th, 1939

R. Owens	July	16th	to	23rd,	1939

Don Borax	July	24th	to	30th,	1939.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause, and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

0 motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that all Boards be retained as named with the exception of the Cemetery Board and the Planning
Board, and Recreation Board.

Commissioner Gilbert ask that the Board go on record as approving the action of himself taken
in giving the Drumm Construction Co. permission to use water from the well at the Woodlawn
Cemetery. Mr. Gilbert stated to the Board that he had checked on the water flow and found that this
permission would not cause the city any inconvenience as there was ample water at this time.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved
and carried that permission be granted the Drumm Construction Co. to use water from the City well at
Cemetery and that the Board approve the action taken by Commissioner Gilbert in this matter.

The matter of meeting more than the two meetings a month as set by ordinance was discussed
by the Board. Mayor Russell was of the opinion that two meetings per month were sufficient and that
by holding meetings only on these dates, namely the 4th and 16th of each month, the public would
be advised of the time of meetings and could attend same. Commissioner Ronnow stated that the
date of all meetings (recessed) were stated before a meeting recessed and that the press gave the
time of meeting considerable publicity and therefore it was not necessary to hold to two meetings
each month. After some discussion on this matter on motion of Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and
carried that this meeting recess to meet the night of June 27th, 1939 at the hour of seven thirty
P.M. Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
voting no.
On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the Clerk write Ralph Simpson, helper on garbage trucks, that he would be releaved of his
duties with the City July 15th, 1939.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved that a Resol-
ution adopted April 18th, 1938 be rescinded. Said Resolution reading as follows:

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Mayor Pro Tem Marble the following Resolution
was introduced and passed:

WHEREAS the prospective income of the City of Las Vegas will be greatly decreased through the
lowering of the levy by the County Commissioner, and

WHEREAS, there seems to be only one method of balancing the City Budget vis; through a hearty
cooperation of all city employees in a systematic and rigid reduction in expenditures,

THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED, That in the future salaries of all appointive city employees be
fixed at a figure decided upon by the Commissioners which figure may not be increased except
through a unanimous vote of all commissioners and further be it

RESOLVED That no additional employees either regular or regulars may be placed upon the payroll
except	upon the unanimous consent of the Board of Commissioners and the mayor and finance

commissioner are instructed and authorized to disapprove any vouchers which do not carry such
authorization and be it further

RESOLVED, that previous approval of a majority of the Board be required in connection with all
requisitions for supplies in excess of $25.00 and that all employees be urged to avoid emergency
purchases unless a real emergency exists.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, and Mayor Pro Tem Marble voting aye. Commissioner Krause passing
his vote. Noes, none. Absent Commissioner Perry and Mayor Arnett.

Vote on the rescinding of the fore going Resolution was Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause
and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Commissioner Ronnow explained to the Board that the reason he moved that the said Resolution
be rescinded was that same had been violated when he refused to sign a requisition hiring two
men on the police department.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that A.W.Blackman, City Auditor prepare and set up a system for checking the incoming and out
going oil and gas used by all departments of the City from the City Barn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The Mayor inquired of the members of the Commission as to their wishes in regard to the
taxi cabs operating without insurance as required by ordinance, and upon motion of Commissioner
Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that all taxi cab operator secure
the necessary insurance by June 27th or they would not be allowed to operate.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Mrs McEachin appeared before the Board in regard to securing zoning in Woodland Park.

C.F.Reid inquired of the Board in regard to securing a beverage license for 220 No 1st St.

Mr. Reid was informed that he must make written application and if same was approved by the
Chief of Police a license would be granted to him.

Mrs Nettles ask that the Board spread oil on streets in Westside leading to the Colored

Church. Commissioner Gilbert informed her that was included in the present programme for street
repairs and maintenance.

No further business appearing before the Board the meeting recessed to June 27th, 1939
at the hour of 7:30 P.M. as same had been provided in a motion introduced earlier in the meeting.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JUNE 27th, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 27th day of June, 1939 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Clerk and
City Attorney.

Also present were Mayor Miller of St. George Utah and Tom McCoy Secretary-Treasurer of the
Municipal League of Utah.

Minutes of meeting of June 16th read and approved as read.

Bids for the purchase of sheet metal to be used in the grand stands at the city park were
opened at this time, and on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was
moved and carried that the bids be handed to the Purchasing Clerk for tabulation, and that the
awarding of said bid be at the next meeting of the Board.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayorvoting aye.
Noes, none.

in the hands of the clerk on order of the Mayor said bid was opened.

Thereupon on motion of Commissioner Gilbert, seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved
and carried that Jas. H. Down, local Studebaker dealer be awarded this bid. Price $331.69.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

that the City allow the claim of Don McGarvie in the sum of $50.25 covering labor and materials
used in repair to pump at city barn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

in the library be accepted. Bid price $186.25.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that the City purchase this cooler and that same be installed at once.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Cliff Whitemore, former Poundmaster be allow $30.00 same being an allowance for one weeks
vacation at the rate of $5.00 per day six day week.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the Petty Cash fund be increased from $25.00 to $100.00 so that an amount of cash might be
on hand at all times to pay any small salaries when same became due.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Mayor Miller at this time congratulated the Board of Commissioners on the amount of bus-
iness finished at the meeting held on June 16th and the lack of unfinished business.

Mayor Miller extended to the Board and invitation to attend the annual meeting of the
State Municipal League of Utah to be held in St. George Utah August 31st and Sept 1st, 1939.

He also informed the Board that the plans for the entertaining of delegates also included a trip
to Las Vegas, Boulder City and Boulder Dam on Saturday Sept 2nd and ask that the City of Las
Vegas assist in the entertainment of the visiting officials.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that the City of Las Vegas go on record as extending an invitation to the Municipal League
of the State of Utah to visit Las Vegas, Boulder City and Boulder Dam Saturday Sept 2nd, 1939,
and to assist that League in the carring out of its plans for entertainment at that time.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye. Noes, none.

Mayor Miller thanked the Board for the invitation and cooperation as did Tom McCoy the
Secretary-Treasurer of the League.

Commissioner Gilbert reported to the Board that he was not satisfied with the bid for
supplies for the Recreation Department and Moved that the bids be rejected and that the Board
readvertise. Motion seconded by Commissioner Krause.

Vote on the motion was Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

that the Board approve the salaries for the additional help needed for the Recreational Dept.

N.B. This motion to be incorporated in above minutes:

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert the following Resolution
was introduced and passed:

WHEREAS the prospective income of the City of Las Vegas will be greatly decreased through
the lowering of the tax levy by the Board of Clark County Commissioners, and

WHEREAS, there seems to be only one method of balancing the City Budget, vis: through a
hearty cooperation of all city employees in a systematic and rigid reduction in expenditures,

THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED: that previous approval of a majority of the Board be required in
connection with all requisitions for supplies in excess of $25.00 and that all employees be urged
to avoid emergency purchases unless a real emergency exists,

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none. Absent non.

ment of an importers license in addition to the liquor licenses all ready held by them. They

went through the regular channels of amendment or repeal.

Mayor Russell informed the Board that he considered it very necessary that the appointment
of a Chief of Police be made at this time and presented the name of Geo. Thompson. Term of office
for six months and the salary $250.00 per month.

As the members of the Board did not present this approval in the form of a motion the
Mayor then presented the names of Judd Parker Frank Wait, Don Borax and Clint Boggs for the
office of Chief of Police. None of which received the necessary motion or seconded, and at this
time on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and

and upon being put to vote the following voted aye: Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and
Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor. Noes, none.

Thereupon said meeting recessed until Monday the 17th day of July, 1939 at the hour of

JULY 17th, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, Nevada held on the 17th day of July, 1939 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City
Attorney and Clerk.

this being the time set for the passage of the seim-monthly pay rolls and same being in
proper order on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was
moved and carried that warrants No. 188 to 192 inclusive be allowed and that the Mayor and
Clerk sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Minutes of meeting of July 5th read and approved as read.

The business of giving a sum of money to the Las Vegas Eagles Drum Corps, to be used
to help defray expenses of this group to the National Convention in Chicago in August, 1939,
being on file for consideration at this time on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by
Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that the City of Las Vegas from its Pub-
licity Fund give the sum of $100.00 to the Eagles Durm Corp and that the Clerk be instructed
to write this organization to this effect and express to it the City's appreciation of the
very splendid way it had participated in City affairs in the past and that the City felt it
would receive a great deal of favorable publicity from the anticipated trip of this group.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

A letter from the Board of Clark County Commissioners was read by the Clerk. Said Board
of County Commissioners stating that it would be glad to meet with the members of the City
Board at its recessed meeting to be held July 24th between the hours of two and five P.M.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved that
the Board of City Commissioners meet in a recessed regular meeting Friday July the 21st at
the hour of two o'clock P.M. to discuss the various matters that the City would like to co-
operate in with the County.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

The Clerk was instructed to inform the County Clerk that the City Commissioner would
be glad to meet with the Board of County Commissioners Monday July 24th, 1939.

Noes, none.

This ordinance to be known as Ordinance	No. 247	of the City	of Las Vegas and to be in
