Mayor Russell presented type written copies of the number of calls made my the as egas
Police Department in connection with hospitalization and emergency treatments by local doctors
and ask the members of the Board if they approved of the police cars being used in this work.
Each of the four commissioners approved of this practise since the City of Las Vegas was without
an emergency hospital and any ambulance services except privately owner cars.

Mayor Russell at this time placed the Commissioners at the heads of the following Departments: 

Commissioner Ronnow transferred from the Finance Commissioner to Police and Fire Commis-
sioner, Commissioner Corradetti from Water Sewer and Light to Finance Commissioner and Commissioner 

Krause from Police and Fire Commissioner to Water Sewer and Light Commissioner. In mak-
ing these transfers the Mayor stated that Commissioner Ronnow had been of the opinion that the
recommendation of a man for the office of Police Chief should come from the Commissioner of that
Department and that in placing Mr. Ronnow at the head of this department he would recommend his
choice of man for the office of Chief of Police and have full and complete control of that de-
partment. Mr. Ronnow accepted this commission with that understanding. Commission Corradetti
informed the Mayor he would try to fill the office of Finance Commissioner to the best of his
ability and also ask for the assistance of the members of the Board. Commissioner Gilbert was
retained as Street Commissioner.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed to meet
Friday July 21st, 1939 at the hour of two o'clock P.M. as same had been set by motion at this
meeting.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS
VEGAS CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JULY 21st, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 21st day of July, 1939 at the hour of two o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Clerk
and City Attorney.

Minutes of meeting of July 17th read and approved as read.

The Board at this meeting considered the question of wether or not to enter a protest
against the erection of a radiator to be installed by the Las Vegas Broadcasting Company on
ground adjacent to a site purchased by the City of Las Vegas for use as a municipal airport
in the future.

After some discussion on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert
it was moved and carried that the City of Las Vegas, through its Board of City Commissioners,
do not register a protest against the erection of a 180 foot vertical radiator now about to
be erected by the Las Vegas Broadcasing Company on property adjacent to a site purchased by the
City of Las Vegas with the idea in mind that the same might be used in the future as an airport.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes
none. Commissioner Krause passing his vote.

Mr. D.G. Lorenzi appeared before the Board and protested the enactment of Ordinance No.

247, governing the waste of water in the City of Las Vegas. Mr. Lorenzi had also filed a written
protest on this ordinance.

Wm. Beasley appeared before the Board and protested the license fee placed upon the
operators of trucks in the City of Las V gas. Mr. Beasley was informed that the Board might
consider a change in this fee but until such time as a change was made, through the proper
actions of the Board, the fee was a just claim and should be paid at once by all persons oper-
ating trucks in the City of Las Vegas.

This being the time set for a discussion by the City Board and the Milk Inspector in regard
to milk inspection for the City of Las Vegas and the co-operation of the Board of Clark County
Commissioners the Board entered into a discussion on this matter so that they might be informed
of the various phases of this question when the same would be discussed at a joint meeting of
the Board of County Commissioners and City Commissioners to be held on Monday July 24th, 1939.

The meeting then recessed to meet Thursday July 27th at the hour of seven thirty P.M.
as said date of meeting had been set at the recessed meeting of the Board held on the 17th day
of July, 1939.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JULY 27th, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
Clark County Nevada held on the 27th day of July, at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney
and Clerk.

Minutes of meeting of July 21st read and approved as read.

A number of citizens were present at this meeting to protest the enforcement of Ordinance No.
247 but before hearing these protests the Clerk was directed to read the written protests. These
protests numbered about 8 or 10. Mr. D.G. Lorenzi make a lengthy appeal to the Board to stop the
passage of this ordinance No. 247. Mrs Louis Pico, also spoke against the ordinance, but informed
the Board that she was aware of the fact that people had been very careless as to the use the water
had been put. Mr. Folger of the Las Vegas Land & Water Company informed the Board that the water
level had raised from 3 ft. 4 in. to ten inches in the last ten days and laid this increase to the
fact that people were obeying Ordinance No. 247.

Upon being informed that Ordinance No. 247 had been come effective Wednesday the 26th day of
July following its second publication Mr. Lorenzi informed the Board he would abide by the ordin-
ance and ask that the Las Vegas Land & Water Company employ a man to instruct the public in the
use of water and how to conserve same.

Mr. Folger informed the Board that his company did not wish to place a hardship upon the people.

A number of bids for the purchase of tires for the Police Dept. were opened at this time and
on motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that Mr. Ronnow Police Commissioner check the bids received and purchase what he considered the
best bid price received. This bid calling for the purchase of three (3) tires.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that a liquor importers license be granted to Peter Pansey and a beverage importers license be
granted to Safeway Stores Inc. and one slot machine license be granted to Bert Smith.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

James Serriville appeared before the Board and made verbal application for a license to
operate a gambling game at the Northern Club. Mr. Serriville was informed that at such time as
he made written application for a gambling license accompanied with a sum of money sufficient to
cover same it would be given consideration by the Board.

Attorney Austin informed the Board that a bid had been made to purchase the judgement
against the City by one Fred Schultz with a 7½% discount.

Mayor Russell appointed Commissioners Ronnow and Corradetti as a committee to contact the
attorneys in this case and investigate this offer and report to the Board at the next regular meeting.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that David Mackey and Harry Miller be employed as police officers for the month of August 1939
at the rate of $5.00 per day.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Commissioner Ronnow recommended and so moved that Frank Wait be appointed Chief of Police
of the City of Las Vegas to office August 1st, 1939. Salary $225.00 per month.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and car-
ried that this meeting recessed until Friday the 28th day of July, 1939 at the hour of five
o'clock P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

there upon said meeting recessed to meet Friday July 28TH, at the hour of five o'clock P.M.

Mr. Sorsensen of the Southern Nevada Packing Co. appeared before the Board at its request
and explained the fees charged for the slaughtering of animals at that plant. It appearing to
the Board that the fees charged were not prohibitive and therefore they were not interested in
these charges feeling that it was beyond the boards jurisdiction.

Mr. Sorsensen protested the payment of an additional mercantile license for the Southern
Nevada Packing Co. Stating that the business was already licensed $25.00 per year for a slaughter
house. Mr. Sorensen was was informed that so long as they sold any merchandise whatsoever they
must pay a mercantile license for the sale of meat and meat products.

Commissioner Ronnow stated this company must adhere to the license ordinance until such
time as the ordinance might be amended .



Mr. Marshall appeared before the Board protesting the granting to  A.L. Riddle a taxi license
and stand. No decision was reached at this time owning to the absence of Mr. Riddle's attorney
this matter being tabled until such time as Mr. Riddle and his attorney should appear before
the Board.

Mayor Russeell at this time changed the position of Commissioner Ronnow and Commissioner
Corradetti on the Board. Mr. Ronnow being placed as Finance Commissioner and Commissioner
Corradetti as Police & Fire Commissioner.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner
Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried that the meeting recessed until
Tuesday the 8th day of August 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

be granted to Mr.	No action was taken on this matter owing to the absence of Commissioners

Corradetti and Gilbert.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, NEVADA.

AUGUST 16,	1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of City Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, Nevada held August 16, 1939 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Present: Commissioners, Joe S. Ronnow, Herb Krause, A. Corradetti His Honor the Mayor John
L. Russell, City Attorney Harry H. Austin and Deputy City Clerk Le Roy Whipple.

Absent: Commissioner C.V.T. Gilbert and City Clerk Viola Burns.

Minutes of Recessed meetings of August 4, & August 8, were read and approved as read.

Upon motion by Commissioner Ronnow and Seconded by Commissioner Krause, it moved and carried
that the Mayor and Deputy City Clerk be be allowed to sign warrants Nos. 205 to 212 Inclusive with
demands and payroll checks attached and that the same be allowed for payment by the Board.

Vote being, Commissioners, Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye, Noes
None.

A. Letter from E. D. Mischy applying for the position of street cleaning was read before the
board, and was ordered filed for future reference.

Slot machine applications for nine slot machine were presented from E. P. Bihlmaier to the
board for consideration, the regular fee being attached. Upon motion by Commissioner Corradetti
and Seconded by Commissioner Krause, it was moved that the applications be granted and that Mr.
Bihlmaier be allowed to place his machines as follows, 3 Machines at the Oasis Cafe 123 Fremont
Str, 4 machines at the Tivoli Tavern 126 N. 1st, Street one machine at the Pinjuv Grocery 715
Ogden Str and one machine at the Johnson Grocery 632 S. 5th, Street, Vote being, Commissioners
Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor The Mayor voting Aye, Noes. None.

An application from Clarence C. Stocker for a Race Horse Keno game at the Northern Club
was next presented to the Board. After some discussion the application was ordered turned over
to Attorney Harry H. Austin for further checking and advise, and to be brought up at the next
regular meeting of the Board.

Bids on Grass seed were then next opened and presented to the Board for consideration. Two
bids were received from local merchants. After tabulation, Commissioner Ronnow moved that the
bid from the Las Vegas Hardware Co, for 100 Lbs of Bermuda grass seed priced at .31¢ be accepted
and was seconded by Commissioner Corradetti. Vote being, Commissioner, Ronnow, Krause, Corradetti
and His Honor The Mayor Voting Aye, Noes None.

At this time Attorney A. S. Henderson appeared before the Board in behalf of A. L. Riddle
asking that the taxi license previously applied for by Mr. Riddle be granted. Stating that as
far as he could ascertain the question involved was not a legal one, but appeared to be an
argument among the taxi cab operators. Mr. Henderson argued that he believed Mr. Riddle had
complied with the city ordinances and therefore should be allowed to operate the taxi in question.
Mr. Geo. E. Marshall also appeared before the Board in behalf of the taxi cab operators
of the City and argued, that already the City had licensed too may taxi cabs and that to license
any more would just keep the present operators from making a fair living. He also argued that
Mr. Riddle was operating two cars on one license and had violated the city ordinance and that he
therefore should be restrained from being granted another taxi license. Mr. Henderson again
took the floor and argued that in his opinion all taxi cab operators had violated the City
ordinances and that if Mr. Riddle had violated the City Ordinances that he was no exception.

After some discussion by the Board, it was moved by Commissioner Krause and Seconded by Commissioner
Corradetti to allow Mr. A. L. Riddle to operate another taxi cab from the stand designated at
the S. E. Corner of the intersection of Second and Fremont Streets, near the White Cross Drug.

Vote being Commissioners, Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti, and His Honor The Mayor Voting Aye, Noes None

Fred Rehn appeared before the Board at this time with a complaint as to why he should not be
allowed to continue to do electrical work in the City. Stating that he had lost several jobs
recently do the fact that the electrical inspector had interfered with him and had been keeping him
from going ahead with such jobs in question. It was brought out by the Board that Mr. Rehn had
with drawn his Cash bond from the City and therefore was not in standing to do electrical contracting 

within the City. Mr. Austin pointed out that should Mr. Rehn redeposit his cash bond
with the city and that if his Master's certificate was in good standing with his license
pay'd up, in his opinion he didn't see why Mr. Rehn would not be permitted to continue with
Electrical contracting as he had done in the past.



Commissioner Ronnow made a report to the Board of his meeting with members of the Chamber of Commerce
and other delegated in regards to the entertainment of the Municipal League of the State of
Utah here on September second; next. He stated that between 500 and 600 people were expected 

and it would cost about $300.00 to furnish a buffet luncheon to the visiting people, that
the County was being asked to put up half the expense and the City the other half. The BPOE Hall
would be used as headquarters and the luncheon would be served from there, and would be in
charge of the Chamber of Commerce. Thereupon Commissioner Ronnow moved that the City contribute
from the publicity fund the sum of not to exceed $150.00 towards the entertainment of the visitors in defraying
part of the buffett luncheon, the move was seconded by Commissioner Corradetti and vote was,
Commissioners, Ronnow, Corradetti and Krause, and His Honor The Mayor Voting Aye, Noes None.

A letter from police Chief Frank Wait was read to the Board by Commissioner Corradetti, asking
that officers Dave Mackey and Harry E. Miller be reinstated as regular officers on the police
force at the regular salary of $180.00 per month. Commissioner Corradetti also moved that the two men be
reinstated as regular officers on the police force at the afore mentioned salary beginning September
1, 1939 and was seconded by Commissioner Krause. Vote being Commissioners, Ronnow, Krause and
Corradetti and His Honor The Mayor Voting Aye, Noes None.

At this time Commissioner Corradetti asked how much time or notice should be given, in case
an employee of the City should be cut off from service with the City. Attorney Austin stated
that he would study the State Statutes and would advise definitely later but that in his off
opinion, no time is required, but the common practise of courtesy was usually 15 days. At this
point Commissioner Ronnow stated that the petty cash fund with the City Clerk should at all times be
not less than $100.00 and should be replenished if below that amount at each board meeting.

There being no further business appearing before the Board at this time, on motion of
commissioner Corradetti and Seconded by Commissioner Krause, it was moved and carried that
this meeting recess until Tuesday the 29th, day of August 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote, Commissioners, Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor The Mayor voting Aye, Noes None

Thereupon the meeting recessed until Tuesday the 29th, day of August 1939 at the hour of
Seven thirty o'clock P.M.

none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that a license for a "Cocktail Lounge" be issued Lena Silvagni Testolin for the Apache Hotel .
Said license being $25.00 per quarter, the sum of $50.00 accompanying said application to cover
license from April 1st to Sept 30th, 1939.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Police Commissioner Corradetti read to the Board a letter from Frank Wait Chief of Police
wherein Mr. Wait ask that Officer Howard be retain on the police force for the month of Sept.

the meeting of August 16th by motion of the Board Officer Howard was to be relieved of his
duties September 1st, 1939.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and car-
ried that Officer Howard be retained on the police force for the month of September, at the

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

Mr. Corradetti, as Fire Commissioner moved that Hire Chief Case be allowed to attend the
national convention of Fire Chiefs in San Francisco, California for seven days in September and
that the sum of $250.00 be allowed for expenses attending said convention.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

Commissioner Corradetti informed the Board that the sum of $250.00 as expenses to said
convention had been allowed in the 1939 budget.

Harry Jefferies and His partner Mr. Castleton appeared before the Board in regard to cutting
down the curb line at 5th and Clark Streets to make entranceway to the service station now
under construction by them. They requested that the curb line be broken out 40 ft on Fifth St;
and 35 feet on Clark Street. These gentlemen were informed that there was a Resolution enacted
by the Board of Commissioners August 8th, 1934 wherein a limit of 25 lineal feet was set as the
maximum length of all driveways in the City of Las Vegas. Application was also made for the
installation of gasoline tanks in connection with pump service.

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner 

Krause it was moved and carried that that certain Resolution introduced and passed August 8th
1934, namely: "On motion of Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner Arnett the following
Resolution was introduced and passed: Resolved that from and after this date all permits granted
by the City Street Supt. for the construction of driveways in conformity with Ordinance No. 172
of said City shall not exceed in width twenty-five (25) lineal feet, on all streets within
said city. The vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, and German and His
Honor the mayor voting aye," be rescinded and that the Board from this time on would consider
each individual application as same was presented.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that permission be granted to Mr. Jefferies and Mr. Castleton to have a 40 foot width driveway
on So 5th St, namely 431 So 5th St; and 35 feet driveway on Clark Street adjoining said 431 So
5th street, also that permission be granted for the installation of gasoline tanks when Hire
Chief Case acting as City Fire Marshall presented in writing his approval of the installation
of said tanks.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner
Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that this meeting adjourn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Thereupon said meeting adjourned.

approved as read.

Commissioner Gilbert presented to the Board plans of the driveways or approaches to the
proposed new Union Pacific Depot. After some discussion on the plans as presented to the Board
it was decided that the City Planning Commission be consulted and that this Board make recom-
mendation to the Board as to what in its opinion appeared to be the best entrance to the site.

T he Clerk was directed to inform the members of the Planning Commission of the decision
of the Board of Commissioners and to ask them to met with the Commissioners of Streets Mr. Gilbert
Monday the 11th day of September, at the hour of three o'clock in the Clerk's office.

informing him that the City hadnot filed proper papers in regard to completion of work and certi-
ficate of use of water, as same is required by law, ingerad to city owned wells.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved that the Clerk
write the State Engineers office that Mr. Baker was not longer employed as City Engineer and that
in the future all communications should be addressed to the City Clerk's Office. That the State
Engineers Office, if possible, furnish the City a brief of the wells owned by the City.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Mayor Russell brought to the attention of the Commissioners the condition of the power line

Mr. O.A. Kimball appeared before the Board to ask if he might be given the help of one
man in revamping the appraisal of the City property. This appraisal to be made in connection
with the fire insurance policies of the City of which Mr. Kimball was the writer.

motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and

ginal "Board of Appraiser".

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

C.D. Baker appeared before the Board with an amended plat of Grandview Addition to the
City and ask that this plat be approved by the Board. Said Addition had been replatted so that
property owners might benefit by the F.H.A.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried 

that this plat of Grandview. Addition be approved and that the Mayor and Clerk sign the
same under the seal of the City.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Attorney Morse appeared before the Board on behalf of the Northern Club and presented an
application to the Board from the Northern Club petitioning the Board to grant that club a
Race Horse Parley license.

As the game was not familiar to the members of the Board of Commissioners no decision
was given at this time but City Attorney Austin was ask to prepare a ruling on same at the
next regular meeting of the Board.

W.J. Flowers as a member of the organization of Milk producers and distributors pre-
sented the Board with copies of the proposed milk ordinance as same was satisfactory with the
parties interested. This ordinance to be considered and adopted before the close of the year 1939
so that same would become effective by January 1st, 1940.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and car-
ried that demands No. 223 to 228 inclusive be allowed at this time, and that the Mayor and Clerk
sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Vegas be given permission to use any musical instruments or music that the city might be in-
terested in.

ried that permission to granted to the band to use any music or musical instruments the city
might own.

voting aye. Noes, none.

The following letter was read to the Board at this time.

Las Vegas, Nevada, Sept 14, 1939.

City Commissioners,

Las Vegas, Nev.

Honorable Sirs;

At a meeting held today the City Planning Commission passed the following
recommendations:-

"That the City Commissioners not allow the Union Pacific R.R. Company to make
entrance to their proposed new depot in the middle of the block between Carson and Fremont and
between Fremont and Ogden St.---- Carried unanimously."

"We recommend to the City Commissioners that the entrance to the proposed
new depot be made at Carson St. and Ogden St. and that land in between be made into a park.
Carried."

Respectfully yours,

Robt. B. Griffith,

President.

After the reading of the above on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert
it was Moved and carried that the Clerk forward copies of the above to all the Service Clubs
in the City and to the Union Pacific System both in Las Vegas and Omaha Neb.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Mr. Bert O'Donnell of the Las Vegas Junior Chamber of Commerce appeared before the Board
and ask that the following letter be spread on the minutes of this meeting:

Las Vegas, Nevada
October 9, 1939

Honorable John Russell, Mayor,

City Counsel.

Dear Sirs:

The Junior Chamber of Commerce in an effort to beautify the City of Las Vegas has appoint-
ed a committee to act upon the City Beautification.

This Committee has as a result of it's observation, found that the corner of Pth and Fremont
Streets, upon which is operated Mr. Stock's Planing Mill, is very unsightly and that it is viewed
by all tourists upon entering and leaving the City of Las Vegas. The Committee has called upon Mr.
Stocks and found him very congenial and very willing to co-operate and has has stated that later
he will attempt to clean this lot up. However, it has been the experience of the committee,
especially in the case of Mr. Bill Mendelsohn, that although promises were made that the promises
were not carried out.

It has also been called to the attention of the committee that Mr. Stocks is soon to make
application for a building permit so that he may build a new are house and planing mill on this pro-
perty. This will of course, assure us that this type of business will be carried on on one of the
front streets of our city for many years. It seems quite reasonable that if debris and scrap
lumber are found in connection with the planing mill now located on this property that this will be
true in the years to come.
It seems that it would be a simple matter for the City Commission to insist upon a written
letter from Mr. Stocks stating that he will keep all unsightly objects from the view of passers-by
upon Fremont Street. This would serve to make him realize his obligation to keep his property free
from suck unsightly properties and also assure the city commission and those parties interested
that this would be done.

We are not, as young members of this community, attempting to in any way interfere with the
individual property rights or with the government as it is being carried on, but, as interested
citizens in the future of our town and community, we are merely attempting by suggestion to help
in its development. I am enclosing a letter as a way of suggestion, that night be used as a model
for Mr. Stocks to sign.

Sincerely yours,

Jas. H Down, Jr.

President, Junior Chamber of Commerce
Bert O'Donnell Beautification Committee.

Thereupon on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved

and Fremont Street should be held up until such time as a suitable settlement had been made.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Commissioners Gilbert and Krause reported on their recommendations as to the use of the City
owned barns by the public and presented the following "Rules and Regulations" to the Board for its
approval.

RULES AND REGULATIONS

Governing the Use of Stables Owned by the City of Las Vegas, Nevada.

Permit must be secured by any one desiring to use the stables at anytime. Permits are secured and
registration is done at the Police Station.

Register must be signed, stating how many horses or animals are to be housed, the number of stalls
used, and corresponding stall numbers.

No cooking is to be done in any of the stables, and no fires or stoves of any kind are allowed in
the barnes.

All stalls must be kept clean, all manure and straw must be kept in designated place at all times.

No building in of mangers, or moving of any partisions or lumber is allowed at any time.

Any damages done that ne Necessitates immediate repairs shall be paid for by the owner of such
horses or animals so housed.

When leaving or vacating the building all doors must be closed, and the person in charge of the
department for the City must be notified or, in his absence notify the Police Department.

Commissioner Ronnow moved the adoption of the above rules and also moved that the same be
printed on cards and cards be posted in and about the stables. Motion seconded by Commissioner
Corradetti.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

The business of granting "Race Horse Keno" or Race Horse Parley" games in the City of Las
Vegas was considered at this time and on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner
Gilbert it was moved and carried that the Las Vegas Club and the Northern Club each be granted
licenses for the above named games. Applications being on file with the Clerk and money in the sum
of $166.67 each covering a pro rated license for the last two months of this quarter year.

Vote Commissioners Corradetti, Gilbert, Krause and Ronnow voting aye. Mayor Russell voting

NO.

Mayor Russell informed the Board that the reason he voted no on the granting of the licenses
as he felt the a licenses applied for were for games not held as legal owing to the following
rules given him, in writing from the District Attorney Roland Wiley:

Las Vegas, Nevada,

November 2nd, 1939.

Honl John Russell, Mayor
City of Las Vegas

Harold Morse,

Attorney at Law
Las Vegas, Nevada.

Gentlemen;

Pursuant to your question concerning whether or not the game commonly known as "80 Ball
Keno" and also the game designated as "Race Horse Parly" constitute a lottery under the Constitution
and laws of the state of Nevada, I wish to cite you to a decision rendered on the 19th day of March
1932, by the Hon. Wm. E. Orr, now Justice of the Supreme Court of the State of Nevada, and then
Judge of the Eighth Judicial District Court in and for the County of Clark.

The Minute order of this decision, a copy of which is annexed hereto, may be found in Look II, page
126, of the minutes of the Eighth Judicial District Court, in and for the County of Clark. In this
case, Judge Orr sustained a Demurrer to the petition for Writ of Mandamus, upon the ground "the
game was described in the petition is a lottery and not authorized by the constitution and laws of
the State of Nevada."

It will be noted the game described in the petition as "80Ball Keno" is substantially the same as
the game in the application designated and called "Race Horse Parley". In "80 Ball Keno" the game
is played with cards having 80 numbers, whereas in "Race Horse Parley" the game is played identi-
cally the same, excepting the names of 80 horses are substituted for numbers.

After reviewing a number of authorities cited in the able briefs of counsel in that case, and bear-
ing mind the decision of the Court, I am of the opinion that "80 Bell Keno" and Race Horse Parley"
are lotteries and prohibited by Section 75, Article 4, of the Constitution of the State of Nevada,
which reads as follows:

"No lottery shall be authorized by this State, nor shall the sale of lottery tickets be allowed"
and as defined in Section 10176 of the Nevada Complied Laws of 1929, which reads as follows:

"A lottery is any scheme for the disposal of distribution of property, by chance, among
persons who have paid or promised to pay any valuable consideration for the chance of
obtaining such property, or a portion of it, or for any share or any interest in such
property, upon any agreement, understanding, or expectation what it is to be distributed
or disposed of by lot or chance, whether called a lottery, raffle or gift enterprise,
or by whatever name the same may be known."

In view of this fact, it would be my duty, and I would not hesitate, to issue a criminal Complaint
against anyone operating in Clark County the games heretofore described, or any other game pro-
hibited by the Constitution and laws of the State.

I wish to point out that in giving this opinion, I am in no way influenced by matters of policy

I have been requested for an opinion by each of you gentlemen and I feel it my duty to do so at
the earliest date possible.

Sincerely Yours,

Roland H. Wiley.

			Las Vegas, Nevada, March 19, 1932.

At a regular session of the District Court of the Eighth Judicial District of the State of
Nevada, in and for the County of Clark, held pursuant to adjournment, Court Called to Order by
the Sheriff. Present Hon. Wm. E. Orr, District Judge, and officers of the Court.

Mayme Stocker

Plaintiff
vs

Viola Burns, As City Clerk
of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada.

At this time plaintiff was represented in Court by her attorney Louis Cohen, Esq; defendant being
represented by City Attorney F.A. Stevens, Esq; This matter having heretofore been submitted to
the Court for decision on Demurrer the Court now finds as follows:- Demurrer of the City Clerk
will be sustained on the grounds that the Court believes the game described in the petition is a
lottery and not authorized by the constitution and laws of the tate of Nevada. he Court reserves
the right to file a written opinion if deemed expedient.

see if the would not comply with the State Laws.

Street between Fremont and Carson Streets. Mr. Sargeant was informed by the Board that if enough
persons were interested in the sewer lateral that the City would supply the labor and the property
owners purchasing the materials. Mr. Sargeant informed the Board that he would report back to the
Board his findings on this matter.

No further business appearing before the Board on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Com-
missioner Gilbert it was moved and carried that this meeting recess until Thursday the 16th day of
November, 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

There upon the meeting recessed until Thursday the 16th day of November, 1939 at 7:30 P.M.
CITY OF LAS VEGAS, NEVADA,

NOVEMBER 9th, 1939.

CALL OF SPECIAL MEETING

TO VIOLA BURNS, CITY CLERK
LAS VEGAS, NEVADA.

A Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas is hereby called to be
held in the Board of Commissioners Room in the City Clerk's Office in the City of Las Vegas, Nevada
Thursday the 9th day of November, 1939 at the hour of ten thirty A.M. to consider and act upon the
following business:

I. To consider and act upon the business of constructing an addition to the horse barns at the City
Race Track providing more housing for animals in said barns.

Dated this 9th day of November, 1939.

John L. Russell

Mayor of the City of Las Vegas.

To— Mayor Russell and to Commissioners

Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti:

YOU AND EACH OF YOU WILL PLEASE TAKE NOTICE: That pursuant to a call this day issued by the Mayor
of the City of Las Vegas, A Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
will be held in the Board of Commissioners Room in the City Clerk's Office on Thursday the 9th day
of November, 1939 at the hour of ten thirty A.M. to consider and act upon the following business:

I. To consider and act upon the business of constructing an addition to the horse barns at the City
Race Track providing more housing for animals in said barns.

You will govern yourselves accordingly.

Dated this 9th day of November, 1939.	Viola Burns

City Clerk

ACCEPTANCE OF SERVICE

WE, the undersigned mayor and commissioners of the City of Las Vegas hereby admit due service of
the foregoing notice of a special meeting.

John L. Russell	Joe S. Ronnow	C.V.T. Gilbert

Mayor	Commissioner	Commissioner

Herb Krause	Al Corradetti

Commissioner	Commissioner

Minutes of a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held on
the 9th day of November, 1939 at the hour of 10:30 A.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and
City Clerk.

This meeting being called for the purpose of constructing an addition to the present barn at
the race track the Board at once considered the matter. Commissioner Gilbert, Commissioner in charge
of this department of the City informed the Board as to the great need to construct this addition
at once. A number of horses taking part in the Fall Race Meet to be held the last of the month*
arrived in Las Vegas and the housing of such a large number of animals not be adequate it was
necessary that steps be taken at once to provide this housing.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that the Purchasing Clerk together with the Street Commissioner and the Department Head purchase
necessary materials to construct an addition to the barns. Same to Cost approximately $1,000.00.
Purchases to be made with out bid owing to the lack of time.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and
carried that this meeting adjourn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

There upon said meeting adjourned.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

NOVEMBER 16th, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 16th day of November 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

Minutes of the meetings of November 4th, 7th and 9th read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that warrants numbers 254 to 260 inclusive be allowed and that the Mayor and Clerk sign the same.

Vote commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Jack Weisberger appeared before the Board and ask for the issuance of one slot machine li-
cense as same had been on file with the clerk for a number of days. Mr. Weisberger was informed
that the Board would investigate this matter and give him an answer at the next regular meeting.
The reason for this delay being that Mr. Weisberger at one time had been found guilty of operating
a "crooked slot machine" and his licenses had been suspended for sometime.

Mr. A. Cants of the A.N.A.A. C.P. appeared before the Board asking that the Board again
consider the petition filed on October 4th, 1939 wherein the Colored People ask for rights to
make use of the "City Parks, Golf Course, Cemetery Swimming pool, and Library. Mr. Cants ask that
his people be particularly given the right to use the Woodlawn Cemetery in any location they so
desired.

Mayor Russell informed Mr. Cants that this matter would be considered at the next regular
meeting.

Robert Woodruff, lessee of the swimming pool controlled by the City appeared before the
Board and ask leniency in regard to the collection of the month lease.

Mayor Russell appointed Commissioner Ronnow as a Committee of one to work with Mr. Woodruff
and to report back to the Board in the near future.

Application from the Boulder Club Inc. for the operation of one Race Horse Keno Game was
considered.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
 that one race horse Keno game license be granted to the Boulder Club Inc.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Krause voting Aye. Mayor Russell voting no for the
following reason, "I vote no, my reason for so voting was stated at the November 4th meeting.

That the game us unconstitutional and against the laws of the State of Nevada.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that one Faro Bank Game license be granted Joe Morgan for 108 No 1st St.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that all slot machine licenses applied for this meeting be granted.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow Gilbert, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the Purchasing Clerk purchase bicycle licenses for the year 1940 costing approximately $55.00
and dog tags for the year 1940 costing approximately $13.45 and to also order truck plates for
the same year.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time it was on motion of Com-
missioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause moved and carried that this meeting recess
until Tuesday the 28th day of November, 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye.

Noes, none.	Approved:
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY NEVADA.

NOVEMBER 28th, 1939.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commission rs of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 28th day of November, 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and Clerk

Absent Commissioner Gilbert.

Minutes of meeting of November 16th read and approved as read.

The consideration of application of the Northern Club for the operation of a "foot ball
parley game" was had at this time. After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner
Ronnow, seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that this application be
denied on the grounds that the licensing of same had not been provided by either ordinance or
resolution and that also that said game had been in operation prior to making of application for
said game.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that a beverage license be granted to Joseph Cazier for 206 Wilson Ave.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and car-
ried that one slot machine license be granted to Jack Weisberger for 508 Fremont St.

Vote Commissioners Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioner
Ronnow voting no because Mr. Weisberger had been found guilty of using unfair tacts in the oper-
ation of his slot machines and had served sentence when found guilty on this charge.

Mr. Riddle of the Biddle Scenic Tours appeared before the Board with a schedule of the
tariff charged by his company and ask that the Board approve the same. After some discussion
it was decided before approving Mr. Riddle's schedule that the Board would consider the present
schedule of the other companies operating vehicles for hire.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the Clerk write the holders of taxi cab licenses in the City and ask them to file in the
office of the Clerk not later than Monday the 4th day of December copies of their schedules of
tariff.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none.

Bids for the installation of a heating unit for the jail, fire station and police station
were opened at this time. This bid calling for the installation of an oil buring system. After
discussing the matter for some time the Mayor appointed Commissioners Corradetti and Ronnow
to investigate the cost of heating the same by electricity, and to report back to the Board,

Mrs. Lane appeared before the Board and ask that the Board reimburse her for hospital bills
incurred at the time she was injured by a fall on Carson Street in the City of Las Vegas.

This fall being due, so she stated, to the poor repair of the public street. Mrs Lane was inform-
ed that the time limit had lapsed for the placing of any such claim and therefore the City was
not in position to allow same.

Ordinance No. 247, entitled " An Ordinance to amend Section 8 of Ordinance No. 244 of the
City of Las Vegas, entitled: "An ordinance of the City of Las Vegas licensing, for purpose of
regulation and revenue every kind of lawful business hereinafter specified, transacted or carried
on within the corporate limits of the City of Las Vegas, State of Nevada: fixing the rates
of license tax upon the same and providing for the collection of said license tax, and a punish-
ment for carrying on or conducting any such business without a license and repealing Ordinances
Numbered 1,2,4, 14,35,48, 62, 74, 81, 95, 102, 112, 117, 145, 184, 192, and 243" was read for a

first time and adopted by the following vote; Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and
His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none. Absent Commissioner Gilbert.

The Clerk was directed to have this ordinance published in the Las Vegas Review Journal
for once each week for two consecutive weeks.

Ordinance No. 248, entitled "An Ordinance to amend section 2, as amended, and section
16, as amended, of Ordinance No. 203 of the City of Las Vegas, entitled; "An Ordinance regulating
the distribution and control of intoxicating and alcoholic liquors and beverages; regulating
places where and under what conditions said intoxicating and alcoholic liquors and beverages may
be kept sold, given away or otherwise distributed; providing for permits and licenses; providing
penalties for the violation of this ordinance and repealing all ordinances ar parts of ordinances
in conflict therewith," and repealing all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict with this
ordinances," was read to the Board for a first time and adopted by the following vote: Commission-
ers Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none. Absent Commis-
sioner Gilbert.

The Clerk was directed to have this ordinance published in the Las Vegas Age, a weekly news-
paper published in the City of Las, Vegas, once each week for two consecutive weeks.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner Corrade-
tti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that this meeting adjourn.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

Thereupon said meeting adjourned.

and Clerk.

Minutes of recessed regularmeeting of November 28th, read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
warrants Nos. 252, 261 to 269 be allowed and that the Mayor and Clerk sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

A number of tavern keepers and their employees appeared before the Board in regard to the
amendment to the Liquor Ordinance, governing the collection of licenses. These man ask that the
amendment be explained to them which Mr. Austin City Attorney did.

Robert Ritter, and a delegation from the Jr and Sr. Chamber of Commerces appeared before the
Board in regard to securing financial aid toward the purchasing of a bloat to enter in the Tourna-
ment of Roses Parade in Pasadena January 1st. Mr. Ritter explained to the Board the cost of the
entry would be $1150.00 and ask that the City give the sum of $500.00 toward this fund. Mr. Ritter
was informed that the Board would consider the matter and advise him in a few days of its action.

Mr. Krause, presented the Board with plans for the lighting of Fremont Street during the
Christmas season. After discussing that matter it was found necessary to transfer money from the
unappropriated surplus to the Water, Sewer and Light Department to finance this project.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved
and carried that the sum of $633.46 be transferred from the unappropriated surplus to the
General Fund to be divided as follows, $500.00 to the Chamber of Commerce to be used for Publicity
purposes namely for assisting in covering the cost of entry for the Tournament of Roses Parade,
and $133.46 to be used in lighting Fremont Street for the Christmas Season.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Harry Pursel appeared before the Board and ask that the Board take steps to purchase for use
at the golf course a small tractor.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved add carried
that the City purchase a McCormic Deering Tractor costing $509.41 F.O.B. Las Vegas.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Mayor Russell appointed Commissioners Ronnow and Gilbert with Mr. A.W. Blackman, as a com-

and Race Track, and to report back to the Board their findings.

that the report of Municipal Judge, Gus Blad, for the month of November 1939 be approved;

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye
Noes, none.

that the City purchase a vice and drill from the Cole Tool Co for $27.62.

vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye

Minutes of regular meeting of December 4th read and approved as read.

Mr. Bracken representing the Union Pacific R.R. Co. appeared before the Board in regard to placing
 telegraph poles on City owned land on the Westside of Main Street in the City of Las Vegas.

After examining the plans and figuring on the proper width of the street and sidewalk space on
motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that per-
mission be granted to the UNION PACIFIC R.R. Co; to place telegraph poles on City property as the
placing of same would not inconvenience the general public and would not create a hazard.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Mr. E.W. Allen representing the Community White Christmas Tree Committee appeared before the
Board and ask that the City donate the sum of $100.00 to the fund to be used by the White Christ-
mas tree Committee.

Ur. Alen was informed that an answer to his request would be given at the meeting to be held
Saturday the 16th day of December, 1939.

Mr. H Lysne, Radio technician from the Police D pt. appeared before the Board and explained
the real need for new radio equipment.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the City purchase a radio for police service from the Western Auto Supply Co. costing $131.41

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

At this time an ordinance entitled, "An Ordinance regulating the sale of milk, cream, and other
dairy products in the City of Las Vegas; defining standards for milk and cream; providing for the
issuance of permits for the sale of milk and cream, and the revocation of such permits; providing
for the creation of a milk ordinance committee; providing for the appointment of a dairy and milk
inspector; authorizing the City Commissioners to promulgate rules and regulations for the enforce-
ment of this ordinance, providing a penalty for the violation of this ordinance; repealing Ordinance
Number 200 of the City of Las Vegas entitled; "An ordinance regulating the sale of milk, cream
and other dairy products in the City of Las Vegas; defining standards for milk and cream: providing
for the issuance of permits authorizing the City Commissioner to promulgate rules and regulations
for the enforcement of this ordinance; providing a penalty for the violation thereof; and repealing
all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict therewith," and repealing all ordinances and
parts of ordinances in conflict with this ordinance, was read to the Board a first time and

adopted by the following vote, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

The Clerk was directed to have said ordinance published in he Las Vegas Age, a weekly news-
paper published in the City of Las Vegas once each week for two consecutive weeks and said Ordin-
ance to be know as Ordinance No. 249 of the City of Las Vegas.

December 28th, 1939

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
Clark County Nevada held on the 28th day of December 1939 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti City Attorney
and Clerk.

Minutes of meeting of December 21st read and approved as read.

Luella Thornton appeared before the Board in regard to securing a license for the op ration
of a beauty shoppe in the residential district on No 7th. License to operate this beauty parlor
had been denied at a previous meeting. After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commis-
sioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved that Mrs Thornton be granted a lic-
ense to operate a beauty shoppe on No. 7th Street in the residential district due to the fact
a license had been granted her for the 2nd quarter year 1939.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert and Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioners
Ronnow and Corradetti voting no.

The application of the Frontier Club Inc. signed by Fred Kreiger for the operation of one
"Hopper Keno" license was considered, and on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commis-
sioner Krause it was moved and carried that this license be granted and that the fee for the same
be in the amount licensing "Keno" in the ordinance governing the issuance of gambling licenses.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert, Krause and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioner Corradetti
voting no. Commissioner Ronnow passing his vote.

Mr. O'Donnel appeared before the Board in regard to the erecting of three rooms in close
proximity to the home occupied by his soon. This home being in the restricted residential dis-
trict where only one one family residence is allowed on fifty feet, but after explaining t at this
building would only be in the nature of sleeping quarters the Board informed Mr. O Donnel that
he could proceed with his plans. Commissioner Gilbert was appointed by the Mayor to work in con-
junction with Mr. O'Donnel.

Ethel Rapoport appeared before the Board in regard to selling short pints of liquor in the
family liquor store operated by her at 407 Fremont Street. Mrs. Rapoport was informed that this
would not be	under the present ordinance but the Board anticipated the amending of

the liquor license ordinance before the second quarter year to include the sale of less than half
pint bottles.

A letter from Dr. W.S. Park asking that the City purchase a lawn renovator and that the
purchase of same be allowed for in the 1940 budget, was read to the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
this letter be placed on file also the folder describing said renovator and that the same would be
placed in the 1940 Budget.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye
Noes, none.

Noes, none.

RESOLUTION

FIXING NUMBER OF POLICEMEN, HOURS OR WORK AND SALARY OF THE MEMBERS OF THE LAS VEGAS POLICE

FORCE.

WHEREAS, the present police force of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County Nevada, consists of a
Chief of Police, one acting Chief of Police and eight Patrolmen, exclusive of one man on Mer-
chants Patrol and One Radio Technician, and

WHEREAS the patrolmen on said force and the captains are now working a shift of twelve hours each
day, end

WHEREAS it is desired to change said working day from twelve to eight hours and that by reason
thereof it will become necessary to engage two extra men to be known as Relief Patrolmen,

NOW, THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County,
Nevada, that from and after the 1st day of January, A.D. 1940, eight hours shall constitute a
work day for each member of the Police Force, which shall mean eight hours of actual duty service
and shall not include time taken for meals, and that from and after the said 1st day of January
A.D., 1940, and until the further action by this Board, the salary of the respective members of
said Police Force (not including said Merchants' Patrolman and the said Radio Technician) shall
be as follows:

Chief of Police	$225.00	per	month

Two Captains of Police, each	180.00	"	"

Seven patrolmen, each	170.00	"	"

Two Relief men, each	150.00	"	"

Police Commissioner, Corradetti moved the adoption of the above and foregoing resolution and the
same was seconded by Commissioner Krause, and upon being put to vote was duly adopted, at a regular
(adjourned) meeting of said Board held on the 28th day of December, A.D. 1939 by the following vote:
Voting aye: Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting.
voting no, none.

No. 247 of the City of Las Vegas.

At this time Mayor Russell informed the Board that he was much in favor of hiring a man,
namely George Walters, to work for the City of Las Vegas in regard to radio interference and
to carry forward a programme to promote better radio reception in the City. Mayor Russell also
stated that if the City, referring to the members of the Commission were not in favor of such a
programme that he as an individual would hire Mr. Walters and that he would be employed Friday
January 5th, 1940.

Mr. Ronnow stated that due to the fact that the Commission was not in accord with the
Mayor's programme to put Mr. Walters to work January 5th, 1940 that this proposition would not be
a City affair but the Mayor would do this as an individual, and as far as he was concerned it
was the mayor's own responsibility.

Commissioner Gilbert moved for the adoption of Commissioner Ronnow's opinion and motion was
seconded by Commissioner Ronnow and vote upon the same was Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and
Krause voting aye. His Honor the Mayor voting No. Absent Commissioner Corradetti.

Mr. Ronnow further stated, "I am in favor of doing all we can to eliminate radio interference
when we can and that we include in the budget a sum to be used for that work. If and when the
budget is finally approved we take steps to secure a capable man to do this work, and if possible
a local citizen."



Mayor Russell ask that Mr. Austin City Attorney give him an opinion as to whose business it
was to find out if an elected officer was qualified to sit at the Board.

Mr. Austin informed Mayor Russell that as long as a certificate of election had been
issued and the oath of office taken he would say that it was no responsibility of the Board."

These questions were ask in regard to the position of Commissioner Gilbert on the Board of
Commissioners.

Mr. Austin added further that an action might been taken by an individual citizen but not
by the Mayoracting as Mayor or a Commissioner as a Commissioner.

At this point in the meeting Commissioner Gilbert ask to be excused,

An Ordinance entitled "An ordinance regulating the sale of milk, cream and other dairy pro-
ducts in the City of Las Vegas; defining standards for milk and cream; providing for the issuance
of permits for the sale of milk and cream, and the revocation of such permits; providing for the
creation of a milk ordinance committee; providing for the appointment of a dairy and milk inspect-

and the revocation of such permits; authorizing the City Commissioners to promulgate
rules and regulations for the enforcement of this ordinance; providing a penalty for the violation
thereof; and repealing all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict therewith;" and repeal-
ing all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict with this ordinance," was read to the Board
for a second time and adopted by the following vote: Commissioners Ronnow and Krause and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes none. Absent Commissioner Corradetti and Gilbert.

CALL OF SPECIAL MEETING

TO---VIOLA BURNS,

CITY CLERK, LAS VEGAS, NEVADA.

A Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada is hereby
called to be held in the Board of Commissioners Room in the City Clerk's Office in the City
of Las Vegas, Nevada, Thursday the 25th day of January, 1940 at the hour of two o'clock P.M.
on said day to consider and act upon the following business:

1. To consider and act upon the payment of claims for new equipment of the City of Las Vegas
purchased in 1939.

2.	To consider the payment of a sum of money to Fred Schultz covering a portion of a judg-
ment allowed by the Courts of the State of Nevada.

Dated this 25th day of January 1940

John L. Russell

Mayor of the City of Las Vegas, Nev.

RONNOW, GILBERT, KRAUSE AND CORRADETTI.

Mayor of the City of Las Vegas a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, will be held in the Board of Commissioners Room in the City Clerk's Office on Thurs-
day the 25th day of January, 1940 at the hour of two o'clock P.M. to consider and act upon the
following:

1.	To consider and act upon the payment of claims for new equipment for the City of Las
Vegas purchased in 1939.

2.	To consider and act upon the payment of a sum of money to Fred Schultz covering a
portion of a judgement allowed by the Courts of the State of Nevada.

You will govern yourselves accordingly.

Dated January 25th, 1940.	Viola Burns

City Clerk

Minutes of a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held
on the 25th day of January 1940 at the hour of two o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Gilbert.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that warrants Nos. 286 and 287 be allowed. That the Claim of Hogan and Westlake be withheld
until the delivery of the Dodge truck purchased through through them. All other equipment being
received.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the claim of Fred Schultz in the sum of $1,525.26 be allowed. This being a partial payment
of a judgement allowed in the Courts of the State of Nevada.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The business being transacted for which the meeting was called said meeting adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS CLARK COUNTY NEVADA,

FEBRUARY 5th, 1940

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held
on the 5th day of February 1940 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney
and Clerk.

Minutes of regular meeting January 4th, recessed regular meeting January 16th and Special
Meeting January 28th read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that Warrants Nos 295 to 302 inclusive be allowed at this time and that the Mayor and Clerk
sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Mr. A.A. Hinman again appeared before the Board in regard to the City transferring its title
in a certain plot of ground to said A.A. Hinman. This ground had been conveyed to the City by
Mr. Hinman to be used as a golf course or Country Club in the operation of "recreational, social
and educational activities" and Mr. Hinman declaring that the deed had become null and void.

Mr. Austin City Attorney informed the Board that he would prepare the necessary papers where-
by the land would revert to Mr. Hinman with out cost of the suit to the City.

Mayor Russell presented the Board with a letter from the Young Sign Co in Salt Lake City
stating that that company was not liable for radio interference caused by sign sold by said com-
pany in this City.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that Commissioner Krause compile and forward a letter to the Young Sign Company and ascer-
tain if said company would be willing to assist in the elimination of radio interference caused
by signs sold by said company.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the bills of the City of Las Vegas for the year 1940 be published turn and turn about for
the twelve months of the year with the Las Vegas Age and the Las Vegas Evening Review Journal.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert, Krause Ronnow and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The renewal of the "fleet insurance policy" of the City of Las Vegas was considered and on
motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried that this
policy be renewed in the "St. Paul-Mercury Indemnity Co." Cragin & Pike, local agents, and that
premium be divided equally among all local agents.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the report of Municipal Judge Gus Blad be accepted and filed. Fines for the month of January
1940 being $111.00.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

stand he had taken on dealing with case brought into the City Court for "drunk driving".

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

FEBRUARY 9th, 1940

Minutes of a Recessed Regular Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 9th day of February, 1940 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney
and Clerk.

This being annual Boy Scout Week a number of Scouts were present and took part in the
meeting, assuming the chairs of the various City Offices. Those present and the offices they filled
were as follows:

Robert Lee	Mayor

Eugene Hampton	Finance Commissioner

Bob Robinson	Street Commissioner

Glen Van Eaton Water Sewer and Light Commissioner

Sam Davis	Police and Fire Commissioner

Jules Benbow	City Attorney

Jimmy Porter	City Clerk

Sam Case	Electrical Inspector

Frank Kim	Truant Officer

Chester Gilbert Juvenile Officer

Jimmy Porter as City Clerk read to the Board a form of Agreement signed by A.A. Hinman
allowing the City of Las Vegas to use ground owned by him as a golf course until July 1, 1940.

Minutes of a regular meeting of February 4th were read and approved as read.

Krause

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner	seconded by Commissioner

Krause it was moved and carried that the "Agreement" signed by A.A. Hinman be accepted.

aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that 5 slot machine licenses be granted E.P. Bihlmaier and 4 slot machine licenses to granted
Ethel Rapoport.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye. noes, non.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Mayor Russell sign the "master electrician certificates" of S. Dosch, Tom Connolly and H.K.
Jansen. These men had passed the required Electrical Examination given by A.L. Drew, City Electrical
Inspector ad the sum of $50.00 from each covering cost of Examination was filed with the Clerk.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert, Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and car-
ried that the Board go on record approving the purchase by the Water, Sewer Light Commissioner
Mr. Krause of parts from the Door Company for the plant at the sewerage disposal plant.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes, none.

At this point in the meeting the Boy Scouts were excused.

The purchase of four (4) fire hydrants by the City was considered at this time and
the tabulation of bids opened at a previous meeting were presented to the Board. Fire Commissioner
Corradetti ask that the Clerk read a letter from Fire Chief Case recommending to the Board the
purchase of Meuller Columbian Fire Hydrants as it appeared to the Volunteer Fire D pt of the
City of Las Vegas that this make of hydrant was the best for this department.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and
carried that the City purchase four fire hydrants of the Meuller Columbian type from the Standard
Wholesale Supply Company. Bid price $284.00

Mayor Russell informed Commissioner Corradetti that he was going to transfer him to
some other department of the City and appoint some other of the Commissioners to the commission
of Police and Fire Commissioner.

Commissioner Gilbert called for question and upon being put to vote the vote was Commissioners
 Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting for the purchase of the fire hydrants
and His Honor the Mayor voting no.

Mayor Russell ask that the minutes show that he voted no because he was opposed to the
purchase of said hydrants for the reason in his opinion another brand namely, Pacific States, was
of the same quality and the price bid was $208.00
Mayor Russell transferred Commissioner Ronnow to the office of Street Commissioner from the office
of Finance Commissioner and placed Commissioner Corradetti as Finance Commissioner removing him
from the office of Police and Fire Commissioner Commissioner Gilbert was placed in charge of the
Police and Fire Commission being removed from Street Commissioner. Commissioner Krause was left
in charge of the Water, Sewer and Light Department.

Commissioner Ronnow ask Mayor Russell to be left in his position as Finance Commissioner but
Mayor Russell informed Mr. Ronnow that he was desirous of having him take charge of the Street
Department.

Oh motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried that
Blackman, City Auditor, be paid an additional $50.00 as he had spent considerable time on
preparing the City Budget for the year 1940.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Commissioner Ronnow informed the Board that he, with Commissioner Corradetti and Commissioner
Gilbert had met with a committee from the American Legion in regard to the City taking over the
War Memorial Building and that the necessary Resolution would be prepared and presented to the
Board at the next meeting asking that the City place the sum of $10,000.00 in escrow at the
First National Bank to be used toward the purchase of the building.



Commissioner Ronnow informed the Board that Senator Pittman would be in Las Vegas in the near
future and suggested to the Board that it get in touch with the Senator and see if the Bureau
of Fisheries would construct a proper wall at said fish hatchery located on City owned ground
southwest of the City of Las Vegas so that the overflow of water would be curbed. Commissioner
Gilbert suggested that the City look into the matter of having the hatchery abandoned.

Mayor Russell ask that Commissioner Ronnow meet with Senator Pittman and take these matters
up with him upon his arrival in Las Vegas.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
this meeting recess until Friday the 16th day of February, 1940 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

There upon said meeting recessed until Friday the 16th day of February 1940 at the hour of 7:30 P.M.

ulation of bids opened at a previous meeting was presented to the Board. Fire Commissioner Cor-
radetti ask that the Clerk read a letter from Fire Chief Case recommending to the Board the
purchase of Meuller Columbian Fire Hydrants as it appeared to the Volunteer fire Dept of the City
of Las Vegas that this make of hydrant was the best for this department.
