Minutes of a Special meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held on the
26th day of December 1940 at the hour of three thirty o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Krause and Corradetti City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Ronnow and Gilbert.

The purpose of this meeting being to adopt a Resolution in regard to the Municipal Air Port on
motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti the following Preambles and
Resolution were introduced and passed:

RESOLUTION ACCEPTING AN OFFER OF AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT
OF THE LAS VEGAS (WESTERN AIR EXPRESS) AIRPORT, MADE BY
 THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA THROUGH THE ADMINISTRATOR
OF CIVIL AERONAUTICS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE AND
PROVIDING CERTAIN ASSURANCES AND COVENANTS IN CONSIDER-
ATION THEREOF.

WHEREAS the Administrator of Civil Aeronautics of the United States Department of Commerce,
through the Regional Manager of Civil Aeronautics, Santa Monica, California, advises that the
development of the Las Vegas WAE Airport in the approximate amount of $340,000.00 has been approved
by the Board composed of the Secretaries of War, Navy and Commerce as necessary to national defence
for inclusion in the construction program authorized by Public No. 812, 76th Congress, approved
October 9, 1940.

WHEREAS the undertaking of this development is continent on the fulfillment of certain conditions,
to-wit:

1.	That the City of Las Vegas through its properly constituted officials provide evidence
that it has title, or will obtain title prior to construction being placed underway to the re-
quisite land for the project.

2.	That the City of Las V gas agree to accept full responsibility for the maintenance of
the improved airport.

3.	That the City of Las Vegas agree to accept full responsibility for the operation of the
improved airport as a public airport in the public interest.

4.	That the City of Las Vegas agree to protect the aerial approaches to the airport to the
full extend of its legal ability.

5.	That the City of Las Vegas agree to operate with the Civil Aeronautics Administration
in the orderly prosecution of the proposed work.

6.	That the City of Las Vegas agree to hold the United States harmless from all claims

and damages which may arise from the construction operations but are not a definite part thereof.

Whereas, the proposed development would be to the advantage and benefit of the City of
Las Vegas.

NOW THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED BY THE BOARD OF CITY COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

Section 1. That the City of Las Vegas, hereby agrees subject to the United States undertaking
the development of the Las Vegas Airport at an approximate cost of $340,000.00 as follows:
REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

(a)	That the City of Las Vegas owns and possesses title in fee simple to the lands comprising
the landing area of the Las Vegas Airport, together with all other lands to be improved under the
project or will acquire title in fee simple to these lands without delay, which lands are more
particularly described herewith by metes and bounds (which lands are shown herewith on Exhibit "A"

The East half (E½); and the East half of the Southwest Quarter (E½ of SW¼) of Section
Three (3); West half of the Northwest Quarter (W½ of NW¼); the Northeast Quarter of the
Northwest Quarter (NE¼ of NW¼) and the Northwest Quarter of the Southwest Quarter (NW¼ of
SW¼) of Section Two (2); all in Township Twenty (20) South, Range Sixty-two (62) East M.D.B.& M.:
also the Southeast Quarter (SE¼ of Section thirty-four (34); and the West half of the South
west Quarter (W½ of SW¼) and the Northeast Quarter of the Southwest Quarter (NE¼ of SW¼)
of Section Thirty-five (35); all in Township Nineteen (19) South Range Sixty-two (62) East,
M.D.B. & M.; (together with all and singular the tenements, hereditaments and appurtenances
thereunto belonging or in anyways appertaining)

(b)	That the City of Las Vegas has the power and authority under the laws of the State of
Nevada to perform all of its obligations hereunder.

Section 11. That the City of Las V gas agrees to permit the agents of the Government and all
contractors or sub-contractors engaged directly or indirectly in carrying out the project, includ-
ing their agents and employees to enter upon, use and occupy the airport as may be deemed by the
Government to be necessary to desirable in the conduct of the project.


Section 111. Ownership of Improvements

That all improvements made under the project shall be the sole ana absolute property of the
City of Las Vegas, except where specifically agreed otherwise prior to the undertaking of the im-
provement or installation.

Section IV. Maintenance of Airport Facilities

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to accept full responsibility for the maintenance of the Las
Vegas Airport, to include all work undertaken under this project by the United States of America/

Section V. The Operation of the Airport.

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to accept full responsibility for the operation of the Las
Vegas Airport for the use and benefit of the public on reasonable terms and without unjust discrim-
ination and to grant no exclusive right therein contrary to the provisions of Section 303 of the
Civil Aeronautics Act of 1938.

Section VI. Prevention of Hazards.

The the City of Las Vegas agrees, insofar as is reasonably possible and within its legal
ability to protect the aerial approaches to the airport from the erection of structures or from
growth tending to render the use of the airport dangerous to aircraft and that it will not erect
on the airport or permit to be erected, any structure or building which will limit the usefulness
of the airport or constitute a hazard to aircraft using the airport.

Section VII. Cooperation.

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to cooperate with the Civil Aeronautics Administration in
the orderly prosecution of the project.

Section VIII. Release from Claims.

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to hold the United States harmless from any and all claims
or damages which may arise from the construction activities of the United States but are not a
definite part thereof.

Section XI. Certification.

_ That the City Clerk is hereby authorized and directed to send to the Administrator through the
Regional Civil Aeronautics Santa Monica Cal. two certified copies of this Resolution with two
Certified copies of an extract of the minutes of the meeting of this Board of City Commissioners
showing all proceedings in connection with the adoption of this resolution.

Vote on the adoption of the foregoing Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Krause and
Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none. Absent Commissioners Ronnow and
Gilbert.

The business being conclude d for which this meeting was call the meeting then adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA
JANUARY 4th, 1941.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas Clark
County, Nevada held on the 4th day of January, 1941 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney
Austin and City Clerk Viola Burns.

Mayor Russell upon calling the meeting to order read the following:

Las Vegas Nevada,

Pat Clark, is hereby appointed Commissioner of the City of Las Vegas to fill the vacancy
caused by the resignation of Joe Ronnow, to hold office during the unexpired term of said
Joe Ronnow, resigned.

William Gore, is hereby appointed Commissioner of the City of Las Vegas to fill the
vacancy caused by the resignation of Herbert Krause, to hold said office during the unexpired
term of said Herbert Krause, resigned.

R.J. Kaltenborn, is hereby appointed Commissioner of the City of Las Vegas to fill the
vacancy caused by the resignation of C.V.T. Gilbert, to hold office said office during the
unexpired term of said C.V.T. Gilbert, resigned.

Arthur F. Smith, Sr., is hereby appointed Commissioner of the City of Las Vegas to fill the
vacancy caused by the resignation of A. Corradetti, to hold said office during the unexpired
term of said A. Corradetti, resigned.

Dated this 4th day of January, 1941.

John L. Russell

Mayor of the City of Las Vegas.

Thereupon the Mayor ask that these gentlemen take their places about the table. City Attorney
Austin informed those present that the office of the four Commissioners were not vacant and that
Mr. Gore, Mr. Kaltenfborn and Mr. Clark and Mr. Smith were not entitled to sit at the Board and
declared that this meeting being conducted by Mayor Russell and Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert,
Krause and Corradetti was legal and in regular form.
Mayor Russell informed the Board that he had secured legal advise and that he believe the meet-
ing illegal and that he was within his power and duties to appoint four new Commissioners and at
this time administrated the official oath of office to Mr. Core, Clark, Kaltenborn and Smith and
appointed them to the following departments:

A.S Smith	Finance Commissioner

Wm Core	W.S. & L.

R.J Kaltenborn Police & Fire
Pat Clark	Streets.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that
Herbert Krause, Mayor Pro Tem act in the Chair of the Mayor.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell was absent
from the table and did not cast a vote when the vote was called.

Minutes of the regular meeting of December 4th, 1940 and Special meetings of 9th, 20th, and
26th read and approved as read and signed by Mayor Russell.

An ordinance entitled, "An ordinance of the City of Las Vegas providing for the acquisition of
a municipal airport by taking over the present airport of Western Air Express Corporation, pursuant
to a Proclamation of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, made and issued on the
12th day of November, A.D 1940, and published in the Las Vegas Evening Review-Journal on November
12th, 1940, November 19th, 1940 and November 26th, 1940," was read to the Board for a second time
and adopted by the following vote:

Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Mayor Russell ask that the vote be called of Mr. Clark, Gore, Kaltenborn and Smith and each of
these gentlemen voted aye.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti the following Resolution
was introduced and passed: subject to the approval of said lease and Resolution by the City Attorney.

RESOLUTION

WHEREAS, Western Air Express and the City of Las Vegas have entered into an escrow agreement
setting forth the terms thereof and providing for certain improvements to be made and certain
rights to be granted in connection with the improvement of and the use of the Las Vegas Mun-
icipal Airport, and

WHEREAS, the Civil Aeronautics Authority will not improve lands to which the City does not have
title, and

WHEREAS, the Western Air Express has presented an outright deed to the runway portion of said
airport, together with a lease covering the use of this deeded portion of the Airport, and

WHEREAS, the acceptance of said deed and the granting of said lease will provide the means
whereby the Civil Aeronautics Authority can improve to the extend of $340,000 said Airport

NOW THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED, that the Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas on the 4th day
of January, 1941, in regular meeting, do hereby accept the deed and authorize the Mayor and
the City Clerk of the City of Las Vegas to sign the lease on behalf of the City.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Mayor Russell ask for the action of Messrs. Kaltenborn, Gore, Smith and Clark on the above
and	foregoing	and Mr. Kaltenborn introduced said	motion which	was	seconded and	put	to vote with

the	following	results, Mr. Kaltenborn, Mr. Clark	and Mr. Gore	and	Mrs Smith voting	aye.

Commissioner Ronnow ask the Mayor if he would	proceed with	the	meeting with	the	Commissioners 

and Mayor Russell refused to act with the four Commissioners	contending that they were not

commissioners and that the meeting would be handled by a group of private citizens. Attorney
Austin again informed the Board that the Commissioners were in good standing and any business
transacted at this time was legal.

Commissioner Ronnow moved and Commissioner Gilbert seconded the motion that Mayor Pro Tem
Krause take the Chair and that the meeting proceed.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell voting
no and stating that he voted no because the meeting was not legal and was being conducted by private
citizens.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried
that warrants Nos. 446 to 458 inclusive be allowed with the exception of Warrant No. 449 and
that the Mayor Pro Tem and Clerk sign the same.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye.

Mayor Russell voting no because this was not a legal meeting being conducted by private citizens.
in his opinion.

ical in substance as follows:

January 4, 1941.

TO THE HONORABLE MAYOR AND MEMBERS OF THE
BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

Gentlemen;

On December 20th., 1940 by a letter delivered to you, I tendered to you my resignation
as a member of your honorable body.

Inasmuch as no action has been taken on that letter and inasmuch as a large number of
business people of this City have requested me to withdraw my said tender of resignation and
continue in office, I hereby do withdraw my said tender of resignation and beg to advise you
that I will continue to perform and discharge the duties of my office as Commissioner of the
City of Las Vegas.

Very truly yours,

On of said letters being signed by Commissioner Krause, one by Commissioner Ronnow, one by Com-
missioner Gilbert and one by Commissioner Corradetti.
The Clerk then presented to the Board a number of petitions petitioning Commissioners Ronnow
Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti to continue to serve as City Commissioners. Said petitions were
signed by approximately 175 businessmen and other citizens of the City. Mayor Russell read the
names on said petitions to the Board.

Commissioner Gilbert moved and Commissioner Corradetti seconded the motion that the letters of
resignation of Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti be with drawn

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Mayor

were not officials of the City but private citizens.

a meeting of the S.W. Section of the Electrical Inspectors Ass'n. was presented to the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that this amount not be allowed.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that a Resolution of the Board of Commissioners adopted March 4th, 1940 be rescinded.

Said Resolution reading as follows:

"On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried 

that the City maintain a schedule of $35.00 per night for use of War Memorial Building
when same would be rented to individuals or associations of persons.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none."

And that the Street Commissioner Ronnow be placed in charge of said building and rates
until the next meeting of the Board and at that time present to the Board of form of schedules
to be charged for the rent of said War Memorial Building.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell passing
his vote.

A.W. Blackman, City Auditor presented to the Board the form of Budger for the year 1941
also copies of the annual report for the year 1940. No action was taken on the Budget but same
was left on file with the Clerk so same might be studied by any interested person.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the bid of the Signal Oil Co for purchase of gasoline for the City of Las Vegas for the
year 1941 be accepted.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

No further business appearing before the meeting at this time on motion of Commissioner
Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that this meeting recess
until Thursday the 23rd day of January, 1941 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

There upon said meeting recessed until Thursday the 23rd day of January 1941 at the hour

This meeting being called for the purpose of signing a lease with the U.S. Government for
use of the Las Vegas Airport as same was set forth incall of special meeting and the Mayor together
with Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City attorney and Clerk being present
the Board at once took up the matter.

Also being present were Commissioners Clark, Gore, Kaltenborn and Smith.

General Harns and Lt. Cassidy of the U.S. Army and Fred Kelley of the W.A.E. presented to the
Board a form of lease and after considering the same the following Resolution was introduced and
passed:

RESOLUTION

BE IT RESOLVED By the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada,
that the Lease this day present to said Board by the United States government, wherein and whereby
the said City of Las Vegas does lease and let unto the United States, the use of the Las Vegas
Municipal Airport (formerly the airport of the Western Air Express Corporation) be and the same is
hereby approved, and that the Mayor and City Clerk be and they are hereby authorized to execute
the same for and on behalf of said City of Las Vegas and to affix thereto the corporate seal of said
City of Las Vegas.

Commissioner Ronnow proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution and the same
was seconded by Commissioner Corradetti, and the same was passed and adopted by the following vote:

Voting aye; Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor.

Voting no, none.

Absent none.

At the request of Mayor Russell the following Resolution was also adopted:

RESOLUTION

BE IT RESOLVED By the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada,
that the Lease this day presented to said Board by the United States government, wherein and
whereby the said City of Las Vegas does lease and let unto the United States, the use of the Las
Vegas Municipal Airport (formerly airport of Western Air Express Corporation), be and the same is
hereby approved, and that the Mayor and Clerk be and they are hereby authorized to execute the same
for and on behalf of said City of Las Vegas and to affix thereto the corporate seal of said City
of Las Vegas.

Commissioner Kaltenborn proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution and the
same was seconded by Commissioner Smith and the same was passed and adopted by the following
vote:

Voting Aye Commissioners Kaltenborn, Smith, Clark and Gore and His Honor the Mayor.

Voting no, none.

Absent none.

There upon the said meeting adjourned.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, Nevada held on the 23rd day of January, 1941 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney
and Clerk.

Also Present were Messrs. Clark, Gore and Smith. Absent Mr. Kaltenborn

Minutes of regular meeting of January 16th read and approved as read.

On motion of Mr. Clark seconded by Mr. Smith it was moved and carried that Warrants Nos
455 to 459 be allowed.

Vote Messrs, Clark, Gore and Smith and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Mr. Clark seconded by Mr. Smith it was moved and carried that the bid of the
Signal Oil Co. for purchase of gasoline requirements of the for the year 1941 be accepted.

Vote Messrs. Clark, Gore and Smith and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and car-
ried that the contract with the Burroughs Adding Machine Company for service for adding machine in
the Clerk's Office for the year 1941 be signed. Price for service $20.10.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

On motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that all slot machine licenses applied for at this time be allowed;

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.
On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved ana car-
ried that the application of Safeway Safeway Stores Inc. for a retail beverage importers
license and retail beverage license be granted for the year 1941.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

Bids for the purchase of one tire for the American LaFrance Fire Truck having been opened
at this same meeting said bias in tabulated form were presented to the Board for consideration,
and on motion of Commissioner Krause seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that the bid of the Motor Supply Co. be accepted. Price $46.55 for tire and $5.89 for tube.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

Commissioner Ronnow at this time ask that City Attorney Austin read to the Board charges
against Mayor John L. Russell of the City of Las Vegas as same were prepared and in writing.

At the conclusion of the reading of said charges against Mayor Russell Commissioner Ronnow
moved and Commissioner Gilbert seconded the motion that the following Resolution be adopted:

Be it Resolved that a copy of the changes against Mayor Russell of the city of Las
Vegas be filled with the City Clerk and that a copy thereof be served upon said Mayor John
L. Russell, that a day be set to inquire into the truth of the charges and that the said Mayor
John L. Russell be notified of the time and place of said hearing and that he be present
thereat; and any and all witnesses for and against the accused John L. Russell, be notified
of said hearing and to be present thereat.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the
Mayor passing his vote.

Thereupon Commissioner Ronnow handed to Mayor Russell a copy of said charges.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that the hearing be heard at a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners
to be held on the 3rd day of February, 1941 at the hour of nine o'clock A.M. and that all other
City business be dispensed at this time and the entire meeting be given over to said hearing.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and
carried that this meeting recess until Monday the 3rd day of February, 1941 at the hour of
nine o'clock A.M. on said day.

Vote commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
passing his vote.

There upon said meeting recessed until Monday the 3rd day of February, 1941 at the hour
of nine o'clock A.M.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA,
February 4th, 1941

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
Clark County Nevada, held on the 4th day of February 1941 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney and
Clerk.

Minutes of Special meeting held on the 23rd cay of January 1941 at the hour of eleven o'clock

A.M. and recessed regular meeting held at the hour of seven thirty P.M. on said day read and
approved as read.

Before proceeding with the meeting Mayor Russell stated"that "on advice of council he did not
recognize the authority of the old council to act namely Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and
Corradetti.

Commissioner Ronnow stated that he upheld the decision of the City Attorney, Mr. Austin as
he was the duly elected, qualified and acting City Attorney, that the four Commissioners, Messrs.
Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti were the duly elected, qualified and acting Commissioners
of the City of Las Vegas and that they will sit and transact City business at this time.

Upon Mayor Russell's refusal act with the four Commissioners on motion of Commissioner
Gilbert seconded by commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that the Mayor Pro Tem take the
chair and that the meeting proceed.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye.

Mayor Russell voting no stating that the meeting was illegal.

Bn motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that the Mayor Pro Tem and the clerk be authorized to sign Warrants Nos. 460 to 467 as
payment of same was approved by the Board.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye.

Noes, none. Mayor Russell stating that he did not wish to vote on the same.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that all slot machine licenses applied for at this time be allowed.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that one poker game license be granted to the Kiva Club, 131 Fremont St.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that the following licenses be granted:

E O Underhill, Wholesale liquor license and liquor importer's license.

Sewell's United Stores, Inc; Boulder Club Inc; and Blaine Johnson retail beverage licenses

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and car-
ried that the report of A.G. Blad for the month of January, 1941 covering Municipal Court fines
be approved. Fines collected $261.00

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes
none.

A letter from the City Auditor A.W. Blackman drawing to the attention of the Commissioners
the fact there was a surplus remaining in several accounts of the City and stating that it would be
necessary to get permission from the State Legislature to place said amounts in the General Fund
was read to the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that the City Attorney draft a form of bill ready for presentation by the Clark County Delegation
to the State Legislature empowering the City of Las Vegas to place said surpluses in the
General Fund and to forward said form of bill at once to the Clark County Delegation.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,
none.

A form of lease had with the City of Las Vegas and State of Nevada covering use of the

War Memorial Bldg. by the National Guards of the State of Nevada was presented to the Board	by

the City Attorney.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that said form of lease as presented to the Board at this time be signed by the proper authorities

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes
none.

Bids for	the purchase of a "lub gun" were opened at this time and upon finding only one	bid

in	the hands	of the Clerk on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert	it	was

moved and carried that LeRoy Whipple Purchasing Clerk for the City send out of the City for bids
and that same be opened at a recessed regular meeting of the Board to be held on the 17th day of
February, 1941.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved ana car-
ried that the bid of the Standard Wholesale Supply Co for purchase of 36 fire plug caps at $1.12½
each be accepted.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes
none.
Bids for the purchase of six (6) signal lights and materials for the installation of same
opened at this time and handed the Purchasing Clerk for tabulation. Same to be presented to

Two demands upon the City made by persons having children injured in what is known as the
Meyers Fire demanding certain settlements by said City and stating that said City would be sued

of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that the demands
be filed with the Clerk.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes

none.

ho further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner Gilbert
seconded by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that this meeting recess until Monday the
17th day of February 1941 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes

none.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti City Attorney

Minutes of regular meeting of February 4th and Special meeting February 7th read.

men attending the meeting were not Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell passing

On motion of Commissioner Smith it was moved and carried that the minutes be approved as

read.

Vote Commissioners Gore and Smith and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes None.

 *

Commissioner Ronnow inquired of the Mayor if he was willing to cooperate with the Board of
Commissioners and proceed with the business at hand. Mayor Russell stated that he did not re-
cognized Messrs Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti as Commissioners and did not wish to
take part in this meeting, There upon on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner
Gilbert it was moved and carried that Commissioner Krause be seated as Mayor Pro Tem and that
the meeting proceed.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell not
wishing to vote.

ried that Warrants Nos. 468 to 472 be allowed and that the Mayor Pro Tem and the Clerk be
authorized to sign the same.

ried that a beverage license be granted to Bert Smith and one to Joe Gallo for the year 1941.

and best bid received at this time.

none.

Bids for the purchase of six signal lights for Fremont Street were considered at this time.
Said bids having been opened at a previous meeting of the Board and at this time were considered
in tabulated form.

ried that the bid of Luce and Goodfellow Inc. for the purchase of six signal lights be accepted.
Bid price $1,376.50 and that the bid of McQuay Supply Co. for materials for the installation of
same in the amount of $1040.25 be accepted.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow Gilbert and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,

that the report and letter also sample of paving received from the Rock Asphalt Co. of Salt Lake

election.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,

non.

 the 21st day of February, 1941 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Minutes of recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners held on the 17th day of

Smith read.

On motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and car-
ried that the minutes of meeting of February 19th be stricken from the records.

On motion of Mr. Smith seconded by Mr. Gore it was moved that the minutes be approved as
read.

No vote was called on either of the above motion and no minutes were approved as read,
and no minutes corrected or amended.
On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved ana carried
that due to the fact Mayor Russell refused to preside and participate in this meeting with
the four Commissioners namely Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti and refusing to
recognize the same as Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas that Commissioner Krause as Mayor Pro
tem of the City preside at this meeting and that meeting proceed.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell passing
his vote.

A letter from the Las Vegas Golf Association was read to the Board. Said letter containing a
list of members of the Association asking the Board to designate five of said members to act on
a Board called the City Golf Board.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert sec need by Commissioner Ronnow it was moved and carried that
the following members be appointed to said Board.

Luther Horner, A.G. Daugherty Dr. C.W. Woodbury Chas DeArmond Lorin Ronnow.

Each of said appointees to serve on said Board at the pleasure of the Board of Commissioners

and Clerk.

he did not recognize the Messrs. Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti as Commissioners and would not
participate in any of the business that might be transacted with these gentlemen acting as Commis-
sioners but had no objection to them holding a meeting, but that he would act with Messrs. Gore,
Kaltenborn and Smith, as his legal authority informed him ana advised him that the last mentioned
gentlemen were the Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas.

Section 2, Chapter 11, Statutes of Nevada 1935: "* * * Upon preparation and completion of
said budget, it shall be signed by the governing board of such city, town, municipality, school
district, county high school or high school district, or educational district, and the several
sums set forth in said budget under estimated expenditures for the then current year shall be
thereby appropriated for the several purposes therein named for the said then current year.***"

We hereby approve the above budget of the city of Las Vegas, Nevada for the year 1941.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas Clark County Nevada held on the 6th day of March 1941 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow Krause and Corradetti City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Gilbert.

Minutes of regular meeting of March 4th 1941 read and approved as read.

Commissioner Ronnow inquired of the Mayor the reason for Messrs, Gore, Clark Kaltenborn
and Smith and Mayor Russell voting against certain claims on the 4th day of March, 1941. Mayor
Russell informed the Commissioners that they were the claims of Messrs, Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause
and Corradetti who he did not consider commissioners of the City at this time. Mayor Russell
informed those present that he could not approve or sign claims for any persons as commissioners
of the City of Las Vegas until a suit now pending in court was settle and the decision handed
down by the judge as to whom constituted the commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada.

Mayor Russell informed Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti that they could proceed 

with a meeting but he refused to act with them as a Board of Commissioners.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and car-
ried that Commissioner Krause as Mayor Pro Tem of the City be seated as presiding officer at
this meeting and that he proceed with the business at hand.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Noes none. Mayor Russell
not voting.

Bids for the purchase of necessary printing for various departments of the City were opened
at this time and on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconDed by Commissioner Corradetti it was
moved and carried that these bids be tabulated and that the Commissioner of Finance and the Pur-
chasing Clerk award the bid as in their opinion was the best bid.

Vote Commissioner Ronnow and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Roes, none.

Matters pertaining to the holding of a General City Election for the City of L s Vegas
were considered at this time and the following Preambles and Resolution were duly adopted:

WHEREAS this is the year provided by law for the holding of a General City Election in the
City of Las Vegas, Clark County Nevada, and

WHEREAS there are to be elected at such election two Commissioners each for a term of
four years, and a City Clerk for a term of four years, and a municipal judge and city attorney
each for a term of two years, and

WHEREAS it is the duty of this Board of Commissioners to order said election, and deter-
mine the places in said City for holding the same,

NOW, THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark
County, Nevada, that a general City Election be held in the said City on Tuesday the 6th day of
May, 1941, at which election there shall be elected a commissioner of the second class and a
commissioner of the fourth class and a city clerk each of whom shall be elected for a term of
four years, and a city attorney and judge each of whom shall hold office for two years or until
his respective success or is elected and qualified, and

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the places in said city for holding said election and voting
thereat are hereby determined as follows:

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MARCH 18th, 1941.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

Vegas Clark County Nevada, held on the 18th day of March, 1941 at the hour of seven thirty
P.M. on said day.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney
and Clerk.

Minutes of meeting of March 17th read and approved as read.

The Clerk read to the Board a letter from the Southern Nevada Aero Club wherein said Club
ask that the City of Las Vegas provide a suitable air port for private and commercial flying.
Mr. Fox of the Aero Club spoke to the Board in regard to this matter, but no action was taken
at this time, but Mayor Russell suggested that the Club investigate lands to the south and east
of the City.

Dr. Nelison of the State Board of Health appeared before the Board and made oral report
of his findings in the City of Las Vegas.

Matters pertaining to the Las Vegas Municipal Airport were next considered.

RESOLUTION

BE IT RESOLVED By the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County,

Nevada, that the sum of twenty five thousand ($25,000.00) dollars be taken from the General
Fund of said City and deposited in the First National Bank of Nevada, Las Vegas, Branch, in a
separate bank account and to be used for one purpose only, namely to apply on the cost of con-
struction of an administration building at the Las Vegas Municipal Airport, which said sum
shall be paid out upon usual form city warrants, issued by the City of Las Vegas and counter
signed by some representative of said Western Air Lines Inc. (formerly Western Air Express
Corporation) to be designed- said representative of said Western Air Lines Inc. shall not, how-
ever, refuse to countersign any such warrant which may be issued by said City for any item
comprising a portion of the cost of said administration building; that the purpose of this
deposit is to be able to secure from Pioneer Title Insurance and Trust Company, Las Vegas, Nev-
ada, the deed to the lands comprising said Airport which is now being held in escrow by said
Pioneer Title Insurance and Trust Company until an administration building shall be completed
at said Airport at a cost of not less than twenty-five thousand ($25,000.00) dollars; and that
the reason for this action and for making of said deposit is that the Civil Aeronautics
Administration of the United States requires that title to said Airport be in said City of Las
Vegas before proceeding further with the improvement of said Airport.

Commissioner Ronnow Proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing Resolution the same
was seconded by Commissioner Corradetti and upon being but to vote was passed and adopted by
the following vote:

Voting Aye; Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti. Voting No His Honor the
Mayor John L. Russell.

Mayor Russell stated this reason for voting no being, in as much as the agreement with
the Western Air Express runs for two years, does not believe that the General Fund of the City
should be depleted to the sum of $9,027.36, said figure as given by A.W. Blackman, and that
the City should call on the Western Air Express before taking action to see what said Western
Air Express would be able to do to satisfy the C.A.A. That the Commission should not rush into
any deal without giving same more consideration.

Commissioner Ronnow stated that due to the fact that the day has been set for awarding
of bids for construction work at the Las Vegas Municipal Airport and that date is March 21st
1941 that time is very short and that failure on the part of the City might resport in the
City losing the airport project, was the reason for the haste in the above mentioned Resolution
at this time. According to figures compiles as of 3/18/41 with the disposition of the $25,000.00
for this purpose and in view of the fact that money due and payable to the City on or before
April loth, 1941 we have arrived at the balance of $39,027.36 which we feel is sufficient to
carry the City for the next three months.

Thereupon on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved
and carried that Warrant No. 488 be allowed in the sum of $25,000.00 and that the Mayor and
Clerk sign the same. That this amount be sent up in a separate fund as per foregoing Resolution.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor
voting no as per his previous statement.
DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE
CIVIL AERONAUTICS ADMINISTRATION

RESOLUTION ACCEPTING AN OFFER OF AID
IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE LAS VEGAS MUNICIPAL
AIRPORT, MALE BY THE UNITED STATES OF
AMERICA THROUGH THE ADMINISTRATOR OF CIVIL
AERONAUTICS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE
AND PROVIDING CERTAIN ASSURANCES AND COVE-
NANTS IN CONSIDERATION THEREOF.

WHEREAS, the Administrator of Civil Aeronautics of the United States Department of Commerce
through the Regional Manager of Civil Aeronautics, Santa Monica, California, advises that the development
 of the Las Vegas Municipal Airport in the approximate amount of $340,000.00 has been
approved by the Board composed of the Secretaries of War, Navy and Commerce as necessary to
national defense for inclusion in the construction program authorized by Public No. 812, 76th
Congress, approved October 9, 1940.

WHEREAS, the undertaking of this development is contingent on the fulfillment of certain
conditions, to-wit;

1.	That the City of Las Vegas through its properly constituted officials provide evidence
that it has title or will obtain title prior to construction being placed underway to the requisite
land for the project.

2.	That the City of Las Vegas agree to accept full responsibility for the maintenance of
the improved airport.

3.	that the City of Las Vegas, agree to accept full responsibility for the operation of the
improved airport as a public airport in the public interest.

4.	That the City of Las Vegas agree to protect the aerial approaches to the airport to
the full extent of its legal ability.

5.	That the City of Las V gas agree to cooperate with the Civil Aeronautics Administration
in the orderly prosecution of the proposed work.

6. That the City of Las Vegas agree to hold the United States harmless from all claims and
damages which may arise from construction operations but are not a definite part thereof.

WHEREAS the proposed development would be to the advantage and benefit of the City of Las

Vegas.

NOW THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED BY THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

SECTION 1. That the City of Las V gas hereby agrees, subject to the United States undertaking
the development of the Las Vegas Airport at an approximate cost of $340,000.00 as follows:
REPRESENTATION AND WARRANTIES

(a) That the City of Las Vegas owns and possesses title in fee simple to the lands
comprising the landing area of the Las Vegas Airport, together with all other lands to be improved
under the project will acquire title in fee simple to these lands without delay, which lands
are more particularly described herewith by metes and bounds (which lands are shown herewith on
Exhibit "A");

The East half (E½)	and the East half of the Southwest Quarter (E½ of SW¼) of section

Three (3); the	West	half of the Northwest	Quarter (W½ NW¼); the Northeast Quarter of the

Northwest Quarter (NW¼ of SW¼) of Section TWo (2); all in Township Twenty (20) South Range
Sixty-two (62)	East	M.D.B. & M.; also the	Southeast Quarter (SE¼)	of Section Thirty-four

(34): the West	half	of the Southwest Quarter (W½ of SW¼); and the	Northeast Quarter of

the Southwest Quarter (NE¼ of SW¼) of Section Thirty-five (35); All in Township Nineteen
(19) South, Range Sixty-two (62) East M.D.B. & M.

(b) That the City of Las Vegas has the power and authority under the laws of the State of
Nevada to perform all of its obligations hereunder.

SECTION 11. That the City of Las Vegas agrees to permit the agents of the Government and
all contractors or sub-contractors engaged directly to indirectly in carrying out the project,
including their agents and employees to enter upon, use and occupy the airport as may be deemed by
the Government to be necessary or desirable in the conduct of the project.

SECTION III. OWNERSHIP OF IMPROVEMENTS

That all Improvements made under the project shall be the sole and absolute property of
of the City of Las Vegas, except where specifically agreed otherwise prior to the undetaking of
the improvement of installation.

SECTION IV. MAINTENANCE OF AIRPORT FACILITIES

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to accept full responsibility for the maintenance of
the Las Vegas Airport, to include all work undertaken under this project by the United States of
America.

SECTION V. THE OPERATION OF THE AIRPORT.

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to accept full responsibility for the operation of the
Las V gas Airport for the use and benefit of the public on reasonable terms and without unjust
discrimination and to grant no exclusive right therein contrary to the provisions of Section 303
of the Civil Aeronautics Act of 1938.

SECTION VI. PREVENTION OF HAZARDS

That the City of Las Vegas agrees, insofar as is reasonably possible and within its legal
ability to protect the aerial approaches to the airport from the erection of structures or from
growth tending to render the use of the airport dangerous to aircraft and that it will not erect
on the airport or permit to be erected, any structure or building which will limit the usefulness
of the airport or constitute a hazard to aircraft using the airport.

SECTION VII. COOPERATION.

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to cooperate with the Civil Aeronautics Administration
in the orderly prosecution of the project.

SECTION VIII RELEASE FROM CLAIMS

That the City of Las Vegas agrees to hold the United States harmless from any and all
claims or damages which may arise from the construction activities of the United States but are
not a definite part thereof.

SECTION IX CERTIFICATION

That the City Clerk is hereby authorized and directed to send to the Administrator through
the Regional Manager of Civil Aeronautics, Santa Monica California, two certified copies of this
resolution with two certified copies of an extract of the minutes of this meeting of the Board of
Commissioners showing all proceedings in connection with the adoption of this resolution.

Commissioner Corradetti proposed the above and foregoing Resolution and same was seconded
by Commissioner Gilbert.

Voting aye; Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor.
Noes, none.

to the fact that the City had title in fee simple to lands to be used for the Las V gas Airport, also
that Mayor Russell, Chief Executive officer of the City forward his approval of the action of the
Board in adopting C A A Resolution Form AP-4.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Wm. Busick presented to the Board sixteen (16) petitions signed by 377 citizens of the City of
Las Vegas petitioning as follows:

PETITION

To the Board of City Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada;

The undersigned, constituting more than ten (10) per centum of the qualified voters resident
within the Corporate limits of the said City, as shown by the number of votes cast for Mayor at the
last preceding election at which a Mayor was elected for said City hereby petition that those
certain charges against John L. Russell as Mayor, filed by Joe S Ronnow, to-wit, January 25, 1941
with the City Clerk of said City, be not tried and that no further action be taken thereon.

 Also, that you cause a special election to be held as provided by law, for the submission
of this proposition to the voters of said City, or, if it appear more practicable and economical,
that said proposition be so submitted at the next General City Election.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried

that these petitions be filed with the Clerk and that she make check of said names as to being
registered voters.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Krause and Gilbert, and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioner
Corradetti passing his vote. Noes, none.

motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved ana carried
that the hearing of charges against Mayor Russell as filed by Commissioner Ronnow be heard at a
recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners to be held on Wednesday the 26th day of
March, 1941 at the hour of 9:30 A.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti voting aye. Mayor Russell passing
his vote.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that this meeting recess until Wednesday the 26th day of March, 1941 at the hour of 9:30 A.M.

At the request of the Civil Aeronautics Administration the following Resolution was adopted:

R E S OLUTION

RESOLUTION ACCEPTING AWARD OF CONTRACT IN THE SUM OF $233,703 00
BY THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS ADMINISTRATION FOR IMPROVEMENT OF LAS
VEGAS MUNICIPAL AIRPORT.

WHEREAS, the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, at a regular recessed meeting
held on the 18th day of March, 1941, did adopt a certain Resolution accepting an offer of aid in
the development of the Las Vegas Municipal Airport, made by the United States of America through
the administration of Civil Aeronautics of the department of Commerce and providing certain assur-
ances and covenants in consideration thereof, known as resolution AP-4 and

WHEREAS, said City of Las Vegas did thereafter forward to said Civil Aeronautics Administration 

at Santa Monica, California, certified copies of said resolution, and 

WHEREAS in pursuance thereof said Civil Aeronautics Administration did on March 26, 1941, award
a contract for work on and development of said Las Vegas Municipal Airport in the sum of $233,705.00
and

WHEREAS the land upon which said airport is located are described as follows:

The East hald (E½) and the East half of Southwest Quarter (E½ of S.W. ¼) of
Section Three (3); the West half of the Northwest Quarter (w½ of N.W. ¼); the
Northeast Quarter of the Northwest Quarter (N.W.¼ of S.W.¼) of Section Two (2);

All in Township Twenty (20) South Range Sixty-two (62) East M.D.B. & M.; Also
the Southeast Quarter (S.E. ¼) of Section Thirty-four (34); the West half of the
Southwest Quarter (W.½ of S.W.¼); and the Northeast Quarter of the Southwest Quarter
(N.E. ¼ of S.W. ¼) of Section Thirty-five (35) All in Township Nineteen (19) South
Range Sixty-two (62) East M.D.B. & M.

Now, Therefore be it resolved by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark
County, Nevada, that the said contract awarded by Civil Aeronautics Administration on March 26,

1941, in the said sum of $233,703.00, be and hereby is accepted and approved by the said City of
Las Vegas.

Be it further resolved that the City Clerk be and she is hereby directed to forward two certi-
fied copies of this resolution to the office of Civil Aeronautics Administration, 1508 Fourth
Street, Santa Monica, California

Commissioner Gilbert proposed the adoption of the above and foregoing resolution and the same
was seconded by Commissioner Corradetti and upon being put to vote was adopted by the following
vote:

Voting aye. Commissioners Gilbert, and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor John L Russell.

Voting no. none. Absent Commissioners Ronnow and Krause.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time on motion of Commissioner Cor-
radetti seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried that this meeting recess until
Thursday the 16th day of April at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert, Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

There upon said meeting recessed until Thursday the 17th day of April, 1941 at the hour of

seven thirty P.M.

Jack Egan of the American Legion appeared before the Board and ask permission of the Board for
the use of the War Memorial Building one night free of rent to entertain the National Guards at a
dinner and public dance to follow. This dinner to be held in honor of the National Guards of Las
Vegas before their transfer to an army camp.

Mr. Egan was informed that the American Legion might use said Building rent free but would be
required to pay about $12.50 for additional janitor services.

A letter from the U. Public health Service was read to the Board wherein said letter an
anticipated budget requirement from the City of Las Vegas in the sum of $5,000.00 per annum to
participate in a health service for Clark County, was requested.

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner
Corradetti it was moved and carried that this matter be tabled until the next meeting of the Board
of Commissioners.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow Gilbert Krause and Corradetti voting aye. His Honor the Mayor voting
no because the U S Public Health Service required that action be taken immediately.

The approving of the plat of the Beckley Tract was presented	to the Board at this time and	it

appearing that it would be necessary	to vacate a corner of Block F in Park Place the

"ORDER VACATING TRIANGULAR CORNER OF BLOCK F IN PARK PLACE" was Ordered

as follows:

A petition having been presented to the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
to vacate a triangular portion of Block F in Park P ace, in the City of Las Vegas, which triangular
portion is in the northwest corner of said Block F and is Eighteen and five-tenths (18-5/10) feet
along Charleston Avenue	and forty (40)	feet along the west	side of said Block F	and which was

dedicated to public use	at the time of	the platting of said	Park Place, and

It appearing to the satisfaction	of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas that

said triangular piece of land is no	longer necessary for public	travel or for public	use and

It appearing to the said Board that a petition to vacate said triangular portion of said Block
F has been signed by the owners thereof and by the oners of land contiguous thereto,

Now therefore, it is hereby ordered that the above described triangular portion of land in the
northwest corner of Block F in Park Place, in the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, for
public use be and the same is hereby vacated and that the full title thereto revert to the owner
of said Block F.

Commissioner Ronnow	moved that the	above and foregoing	Order be made, that a copy thereof	be

spread upon the minutes	of said Board,	and that this order	be recorded with the	County Recorder

of Clark County, Nevada, and the same was seconded by Commissioner Krause and upon being put to vote
was carried by the following vote:

Voting aye. Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Two letters from Fire Chief Case were presented to the Board wherein said Fire Chief Case
recommended that the plats of Vega Verdi and Beckley Tract not be approved by the Board of Commis-
sioner until the owners of said tracts had guaranteed the City it would post suitable bonds insuring
 the installation of suitable fire hydrants in said tracts.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that the Board of Commissioners approve the plat of the Vega Verdi Tract in as much as the City
Planning Commission had recommended to the Board that	it approve said Tract and that Mr. Franklin

one of the owners of said tract had agreed to furnish	bond in the sum of. $400.00 guaranteeing the	

City that the subdividors would install fire hydrants as recommended by the Las Vegas Chief of
Fire Department. Also that the Mayor and Clerk sign said plat as of this date.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that the Board of Commissioners approve the plat of the Beckley Tract in as much as the City Plann-
ing Commission had recommended to the Board that it approve said Tract and that Mr. Guy Mathis one
of the owners of said tract had agreed to furnish the City with a bond of $200.00 assuring the
City that the owners of said Beckley Tract would install suitable fire hydrants as recommended by
the Chief of the Las V gas Fire Department. Also that the Mayor and Clerk sign said plat of this date.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried
that this meeting recess until Monday the 28th day of	April, 1941 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

on said day and that at said recessed regular meeting	all other business be dispensed with but

the hearing of charges against Mayor Russell as same had been filed by Commissioner Ronnow.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

There upon said meeting recessed until Monday the 28th day of April, 1941 at the hour of
ten o'clock A.M.

Minutes of a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas Nevada
held on the 25th day of April, 1941 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M. on said day.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and City Clerk

Absent Commissioner Ronnow and City Attorney Austin.

Commissioner Corradetti, a member of the Airport Committee brought to the attention of the
Board the necessity of hiring an architect for the administration building to be constructed at the
Las Vegas Municipal Airport and suggested the sum of $35,000.00 being adequate for the construction
of the building, heating and cooling and architect fees and Commissioner Corradetti so moved that
A.L. Worswick, local architect be employed by	the	City of Las Vegas as architect on	the administrative

building to	be constructed by the City at the	Las	V gas Municipal	Airport. That the	cost of said

building delivered to the city including architect fees and heating and cooling systems be not over
the sum of $35,000.00.

Vote	Commissioners Gilbert, Krause and	His	Honor the Mayor	voting aye. Noes,	none.

The	consideration of the construction	of	the access road	from Highway 91 to the Las Vegas

Airport was considered at this time and Commissioner Corradetti informed that Board that it was con-
sidered the best procedure for R.B. Griffith as a member of the Airport Committee and Mr. Murphy
of the State Highway Dept. to fly to Reno Monday April 28th and met with Gilbert Ross of the State
W.P.A. in regard to said road. Mayor Russell expressed his opinion by stating that the same would
be satisfactory to him if Commissioner Corradetti accompanied Mr. Griffith and Mr. Murphy.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that Commissioner Corradetti accompany Mr. Griffith of the Airport Committee and Mr. Murphy of the
State Highway Dept. to Reno and that Commissioner Corradetti be instructed to sign W.P.A. Project
No. 50,074 provided he feels that said application and offer is correct. Said application being for
R.P.A. aid on access road to Las Vegas Airport from Highway 91.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

On motion of Commissioner Gilbert seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the traveling expense involved in the making of the above mentioned trip by Mr. Murphy, Nr.
Griffith and Commissioner Corradetti be allowed and paid by the city of Las Vegas.

Vote Commissioners Gilbert Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes

none.

There upon the business being completed for which this meeting was called said meeting adjourned.
BEFORE THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

STATE OF NEVADA)

County of Clark)

JOHN L. RUSSELL, being first duly sworn, on oath, deposes and says:

That the above entitled matter has been set for trial April 28, 1941, at 10 A.M.

That since and including April 21, 1941, affiant has served on the federal jury at said Las Vegas,
wherefore, he has been unable to confer with his counsel and to make adequate preparations for said
trial.

That he advised the federal judge of said trial and requested to be excused from such jury service
which request was denied, except that the said judge stated he might be excused April 28th only, and
no longer, but that said trial cannot be concluded in one day.

Wherefore, affiant requests that said trial be continued until after said jury service with a
reasonable time thereafter to prepare for said trial.

John L Russell

Subscribed and sworn to before me this 28th day of April, 1941.

Albert A Hinman

Notary Public in and for said

Notary seal.	County and State.

After considering said request on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it
was moved and carried that in as much as Mayor Russell and his counsel have ask for a continuance
of the trial of the Mayor, because Mayor Russell has been called for Federal Jury duty and that Att.
Hinman stated he has not had sufficient time to contact witnesses he would like to call, and that
the Board is willing to grant continuance so as not to cause the Mayor any inconvenience that the
Board extend the time of the hearing until Thursday May 8th, at the hour of ten A.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes,
none. Mayor Russell not voting.

Mayor Russell and Counsel approved the date of hearing as of May 8th, 1941 at 10 A.M.

No further business appearing before the Board the meeting adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS
VEGAS CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 5th, 1941.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held on
the 5th day of May, 1941 at the hour of seven thirty P.M.

Present Mayor Russell, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti, City Attorney
and Clerk.

Minutes of all meetings not previously read, read and approved as read.

Mr. Frank McNamee appeared before the Board in regard to securing a gaming license for one
roulette wheel for Harry Samet at 101 Fremont Street. After some discussion on the matter on
motion of Commissioner Corradetti seconded by commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried that
that the Board of Commissioners not grant a license for any gambling games unless the applicant
applies for license for three games, as the minimum. That this number (3) be the bases for the grant-
ing of original games for any gambling club in the City of Las Vegas and that the same is effective
this date.

Vote commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Upon motion of Commissioner Gilbert and Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti, a license for
t wo poker games and one roulette wheel for 105 Fremont for Harry L. Samet was granted. Vote being
Commissioners, Ronnow, No, Commissioners, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti Aye, and His Honor the
Mayor voting No.

Upon motion of Commissioner Gilbert and Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti, it was moved and
carried that demands numbered 503 to 511 inclusive be allowed and that the Mayor and Clerk be
allowed to sign the same.

A wholesale beverage license application was presented by the Nevada Beverage Company for a
license at 1112 South 3rd, Street was presented to the Board for action, Upon motion of Commissioner
Gilbert and Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti, it was moved and carried that such license be
granted. Vote Commissioners Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti voting Aye, His Honor the Mayor voting
No. Stating that his reason for voting no, was that such location was not in the Commercial District.
Commissioner Ronnow had been excused from the meeting to attend to other business.

A retail beverage application submitted by Frank Kernan for a license at the Tourist Cafe South
5th, Street in about the 1400 block was presented to the Board. Upon motion of Commissioner Gilbert
and Seconded by Commissioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that such license be granted.
Vote Commissioners, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye, Noes None.

A retail beverage application submitted by Sophia Noon for a license at 220 N. 2nd, Street was
next presented to the Board for Consideration. After some discussion on the matter it developed
that the Board had gone on record against allowing any more such licenses to be operated on or near
an alley, that in the past considerable trouble and difficulty ha d been experienced from the
operation of such licenses so located, therefore upon motion of Commissioner Krause and seconded by
Commissioner Corradetti, it was moved and carried that such application be rejected, Vote being
Commissioner: Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye, Noes None.

Upon motion of Commissioner, Gilbert and Seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and
carried that the following slot machine licenses be granted, applications and fees attached being
in the proper form.

1 Jennings -5¢ for A.W. Blackman at 421 S. 5th, Street,

1 Mills - 5¢	for E.V. Breckenridge at 123 S. 1st, Street,

1 Mills -	5¢ For Theodore Michelon 113 No. 1st, Street - Nevada Cafe.

3 Mills -25¢, 10¢ & 5¢. for Apache Hotel Lobby - 104 N. 2nd, Street,

1 Callie- 5¢ for John Stathis 105 N. 1st,Street,

3 Jennings- 10¢, 5¢, &5¢ for State Cafe - 22 Fremont Street,

3 Nilks - 10¢, 5¢. & 5¢. for Mike Gordon - 106 Fremont Street,

Vote being Commissioners, Gilbert, Krause ana Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor Voting Aye,

Noes, None.

The monthly report from Municipal Judge A.G. Blad was next presented to the Board, Upon
motion of Commissioner Krause ano Seconded by Commissioner Gilbert, it was moved and carried that

said report he accepted and ordered filed. Vote being Commissioners, Gilbert, Krause ana Corradetti
and His Honor the Mayor Voting Aye, Noes, None.
The renewal of lease with the C.C.C. Camp on the old Air Port East of Town was presented for
consideration and action by the Board. After some discussion, and upon motion of Krause and Seconded
by Commissioner Gilbert, it was moved and carried that the Mayor and Clerk be empowered and authorized
to renew and sign such lease for the term on one year upon expiration of present lease, such renewal
to expire July 1, 1942. Vote, Commissioners, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti & His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye, Hoes Hone.

A proposal from the Albright's Business machines to furnish one Steel Cabinet for the Police
Department, for use as a finger print filing cabinet in the sum, of $75.35 f.o.b. Las Vegas, Nevada
was presented to the Board for consideration, such proposal being the only one submitted, requests
having been made of the Office Equipment also, but no proposal was submitted, and that the police
department being in very bad need for additional filing space, it was deemed advisable to purchase
such cabinet at once. Therefore, upon motion of Commissioner Krause, and seconded by Commissioner
Gilbert, it was moved and carried that Purchasing Clerk Le Roy Whipple be allowed and authorized
to purchase said filing cabinet for the police department.

Vote being Commissioners, Gilbert, Krause and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor voting aye, Noes
Hone.

There being no further business before the meeting at this time, upon motion of Commissioner
Gilbert and Seconded by Commissioner Krause, it was moved and carried that this meeting recess
until the 8th, day of April at the hour of 10 o'clock A.M. Vote commissioners, Gilbert and Krause
and Corradetti and His Honor the Mayor Voting Aye, Noes none. Thereupon the meeting recessed
until April 8th, at the hour of 10 o'clock A.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS
VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY NEVADA.

MAY 9th, 1941.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, Clark county Nevada held on the 9th day of May, 1941 at the hour of ten o'clock A.M.

Present Mayor Pro Tem Krause, Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert and Corradetti City Clerk and
Attorney Breeze acting attorney for the City.

Attorney Hinman, council for Mayor Russell presented the Board with a telegram from Mayor
Russell in which Mayor Russell stated that the doctor advised him due to the condition of his
sister who was confined to a hospital in Burbank California, not to return to Las Vegas at this time.

It was agreed by the members of the Board of Commissioners to proceed with the hearing of
charges against Mayor Russell as same had been filed January 23rd, 1941 by Commissioner Ronnow.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that Hattie Lundy be appointed the official reporter for this hearing and that she forthwith
take the official oath of office.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes none.

There upon Mattte Lundy took the official oath of office.
Attorney Hinman at this time objected to the hearing of the charges against Mayor Russell
and ask that the same not be heard.

On motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner Gilbert it was moved and carried
that the objections of Attorney Hinman be over ruled and that the Commission proceed with the
hearing.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes, none.

Attorney Hinman speaking on behalf of Mayor Russell denied each and every one of the eight
(8) charges filed against Mayor Bussell by Commissioner Ronnow, and there upon excused himself.

Attorney Breeze, council for the Commissioners opened the hearing and testimony was given
by Viola Burns, City Clerk as first witness who was followed by Commissioner Gilbert.

At the hour of twelve o'clock noon on motion of commissioner Ronnow seconded by Commissioner
Gilbert it was moved and carried to recess until the hour of two o'clock P.M. on this day.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert, and Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye.
Noes, none.

Meeting reconvened at two o'clock P.M. with the following present, Mayor Pro Tem Krause, Com-
missioners Ronnow, Gilbert Corradetti City Clerk, Reporter Mattie Lundy and C.D.Breeze, Attorney.

Other witnesses called were City Attorney Austin, Commissioners Ronnow, Corradetti, and Mayor
Pro Tem Krause and after hearing the witnesses and being of the opinion that Mayor Russell might
be able to appear at a date in the near future on motion of commissioner Ronnow seconded by commis-
sioner Corradetti it was moved and carried that this hearing be resumed Monday the 12th day of
Kay 1941 at the hoar of ten o'clock A.M.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow, Gilbert. Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes, none.

The signing of an agreement with Jimmie Crossan, Pro at the Las Vegas Municipal Golf Course
was considered at this time, and on motion of Commissioner Ronnow seconded by commissioner Gilbert
it was moved and carried that the form of agreement entitled "Golf 'Pro' Agreement" as presented
to the Board be accepted and that the Mayor Pro Tem and Clerk sign the same on behalf of the City
and Jimmie Crossan on behalf of himself as the party of the second part.

Vote Commissioners Ronnow Gilbert Corradetti and Mayor Pro Tem Krause voting aye. Noes, none.

The granting of an easement over City owned ground on which to construct an access road to the
Las Vegas Municipal Airport from Highway 91 was considered at this time and the following
Resolution was introduced and passed:

R E S O L U T I O N

"Whereas the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, has recently acquired certain lands in
Sections three (3) and four (4) in Township twenty (20) South Range sixty-two (62) East, M.D.B.&

M. for the purpose of the acquisition and development of the Las Vegas Municipal Airport, and,

Whereas it is necessary and essential that a highway be constructed into said airport from
State Highway Route #6, Section D2, which is a part of U.S. Highway #91, over said lands now owned
by the said City of Las Vegas, and,

Whereas a map and plat of said proposed access highway has been submitted to and filed
with the City Clerk of the said City of Las Vegas by the Department of Highways of the State of
Nevada, and,

Whereas a description, by metes and bounds, of said proposed access highway has been
furnished to the City of Las Vegas by the said Department of Highways of the said State of 

Nevada,

Now ,therefore, BE IT RESOLVED, that the following described lands be and the same are
hereby dedicated to the public for right of way purposes, and the exclusive use thereof, for
right of way purposes, is hereby reserved to the public, to wit:

A right of way of varying width over and across a portion of the Northeast one-
quarter (NE¼) of the Northeast One-quarter (NE¼) of Section four (4) and the South one-half
(S½) of the Northwest one-quarter (NW¼) of Section three (3, Township twenty (20) South,

Range Sixty-two (62) East, M.D.B.&M., and being more particularly described by metes and
bounds as follows, to wit:

Beginning at a point on the southeasterly, seventy-five foot, highway right of way line
-of the State highway in Clark County, Route 6, Section D2, known as Highway Engineer's Station
"0" 0/76.87 P.O.T. which point bears South 48˚32' 50". East a distance of 76.87 feet from
Nevada State Highway Engineer's Station "R" 343/50.00 P.O.T;; said point of beginning being
further described as bearing South 20°35'10" West a distance of 912.99 feet from the north-
east corner of said Section four (4); thence North 54°06' East along the southeasterly,
seventy-five foot, Nevada State Highway right of way line a distance of 153.73 feet to a point
on the proposed, northeasterly, one hundred fifty foot, airport access highway right of way

along said right of way line with a radius of the thirteen hundred and fifty (1350) feet,
through and angle of 40°38'40", a distance of 957.56 feet to a point; thence continuing
along said right of way line South 89°11'30" East a distance of 1952.62 feet to a point on

of the Northwest one-quarter (NW¼) of said Section three (3); thence North 89°ll'30" West

distance of 2774.58 feet to a point bn the section line common to said Sections three (3) and
four (4); thence North 0°14' West along said Section line a distance of 240.33 feet to a point
on the southwesterly, fifty foot, right of way line of said airport access road; thence from
tangent which bears North 56°51'41" West curving to the right along said right of way line

Said above described lands shall be used only for highway purposes and whenever the same shall
cease	to	be used as	a public highway, as access to said municipal airport, then the title	to the

above	described	land	shall revert to and be vested in the said City of Las Vegas.

R.E.S.O.L U T I O N

WHEREAS the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, has recently acquired certain lands
in	Sections three (3) and four	(4) in Township	twenty	(20) South Range sixty-two	(62) East,

M.D.B. & M. for the purpose of	the acquisition	and development of	the Las Vegas Municipal

Airport , and,

WHEREAS it is necessary and essentia 1 that a highway be constructed into said airport
from State highway Route #6, Section D2, which is a part of U.S. Highway #91, over said lands
now owned by the said City of Las Vegas, and,

WHEREAS A map and plat of said proposed access highway has been submitted to and filed
with the City Clerk of the said City of Las Vegas by the Department of Highways of the State
of Nevada, and,

WHEREAS a description, by metes and bounds, of said proposed access highway has been
furnished to the said City of Las Vegas by the said Department of highways of the said State
of Nevada, and,

WHEREAS said map and plat shows, in blue color, certain lands contiguous to said access
highway which are desired to be used for park or beautification areas, and,

WHEREAS a description by metes and bounds, of said proposed park and beautification
areas has been furnished to the said City of Las Vegas by said Department of Highways of the
State of Nevada,

NOW THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, that the following described lands be and the same are
hereby dedicated to the public for park and beautification areas, and the exclusive use
thereof, for park and beautification areas is hereby reserved to the public, to wit:

That piece or parcel of land bounded on the east by the east boundary line of said
Section four (4), on the South by the South boundary of the Northeast one-quarter (NE¼)
of the Northeast; one-quarter (NE¼) of said Section four (4), on the southwest side by the
northeast, fifty foot right of way line of the Airport Branch of the Union Pacific
Railroad Company, and on the northeast side by the southeasterly, seventy-five foot,
highway right of way line, exclusive of that two hundred (200) foot public highway
established by the City of Las Vegas which is a part of the Airport Access Road.

Said above described lands shall be used only for the park purposes and beautification
areas and whenever the same shall cease to be used for said purposes, then the full title
to the same shall revert to and be vested in the said City of Las Vegas.
